loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala V., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. This will be her third loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Kalala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her kids' school fees. Her husband is involved in farming.

loans.use: To maintain business needs.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz has worked in a printing house for 2 years. He was born in 1954. He lives in the Khachmaz region. He is married with 3 children. Now Chingiz needs a loan of $1,200 US to buy the necessary equipment for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for improving his business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam always wanted to work independently and for this reason five years ago she decided to set-up a store in her house. With much effort and sacrifice, she was able to install the store and stock it with a variety of products. Currently, it’s the most popular General Store in the district. Additionally, for the last 8 years Miriam weaves sweaters to order.

The loans she has requested have been used to stock her store with more products. She was also able to construct her house and buy a car.

Miriam would like to increase her shop’s stock and to expand into selling other products like electrical goods, toys and books.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Miriam siempre quiso trabajar de forma independiente, por esta razón, fue que hace 5 años decidió poner una bodega en su casa. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios, pudo instalar y surtir con variedades de productos su bodega. En la actualidad, es la bodega preferida del barrio. Asimismo, desde hace 8 años Miriam teje chompas por encargo o pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha pedido los ha utilizado en surtir su bodega con más productos. También pudo construir su casa y comprarse un auto.

A Miriam le gustaría aumentar el stock de su tienda y ampliarla a la categoría de bazar y librería.

loans.use: To stock her store with more products, build her house and buy a car

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata C., 30 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des graines d’arachide, les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatoumata C., 30, married with two children to raise, has been a member of the Village Bank of Médina Diambéré for two years. She wants a loan to buy peanuts (groundnuts) to transform into peanut butter and re-sell. Her income allows her to participate in supporting her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing peanuts to produce peanut butter for re-sale

loans.name: Gina Filipe

texts.pt:
Gina Filipe C. nasceu na província de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 20, 13 e 8 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Gina estudou até 9ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida, gina vive basicamente de negocio de venda de malas de madeiras quais adquira por 1500,00mt lá no centro do pais e vende na cidade de Maputo por 5000,00mt. Com isso tem tida um rendimento mensal de 30000,00mt.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Gina na Hluvuku e no Kiva e já teve no valor de 12.000,00mt na associação de credito e aplicou na venda de verduras negocio que não deu bons resultados. Assim com este empréstimo de 18.000,00mt pretende reforçar o estoque.

Tem como planos futuros a construção de uma casa condigna dado que neste momento vive numa dependência e também pretende comprar um carro e tudo conta com ajuda do credito.
texts.en:
Gina Filipe C. was born in the province of Maputo, is 38 years old, single, and mother of 3 children with ages between 8 and 20 respectively. She only supports her family. Gina attended school until the 9th grade, and she stopped when she became pregnant. Gina lives basically by selling wooden chests which she acquires for 1,500MT in the center of the country and then sells in the city of Maputo for 5,000MT. With this she has had a monthly income of 30,000MT. This is her first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva, but she already had a loan for 12,000MT with the credit association that she applied to a vegetable sales business that did not have good results. With this loan of 18,000MT she intends to replenish her stocks. She has future plans to construct a suitable home given that in this moment she lives in a rental. She also intends to purchase a car, and everything counts on the help of credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden chests for resale

loans.name: Jero Taman

texts.id:
Kegiatan beternak Babi pada awalnya hanyalah membantu pendapatan suaminya. Setelah berjalan sekian tahun dan mendapatkan keuntungan yang menjanjikan, Maka Jero Taman mencoba untuk mencoba memelihara babi secara serius. Karena sudah mempunyai induk, maka Jero Taman mengembangkan ternaknya akan dipelihara secara penggemukan dengan tujuan nantinya dapat keuntungan lebih banyak lagi.

Impiannya  dapat terwujud setelah Jero Taman mendapat dana pinjaman dari Lembaga  adat yang ada didesanya dan lembaga tersebut merupakan lembaga binaan dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk membeli tiga ekor bibit babi yang akan dipelihara selama 4 bulan dan pakan. Jero Taman memperoleh  pembinaan dan training tentang kesehatan ternak babinya yang dilakukan secara berkala dari Yayasan DINARI. Keuntungan yang diperoleh selama  4 bulan  dapat mencapai Rp. 1.200.000,- dari hasil beternaknya Jero Taman dapat memperoleh pendapatan tambahan selain dari  pendapatan suaminya.
texts.en:
Jero Taman started farming pigs to help her husband by earning supplemental income. After several years with good results, Jero Taman is becoming more and more serious in this business. Jero Taman owns a breeding pig, so she is expanding her piglet fattening business to increase her profit. She dreams that she can obtain financial and technical assistance from DINARI. She will use the fund to purchase 3 piglets, that will be fattened for 4 months, and feeds. Jero Taman obtains training on pigs health from DINARI foundation. She can earn $120 profit in 4 months after the piglets mature. She hopes to obtain additional income from the farm.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Merly Heydi

texts.es:
La señora Merly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. León de Judas Mz. 31 Lt. 5 AA.HH “Luz y Paz”, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio. En las mañanas se dedica a sus hijos y por las tardes sale a vender su mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 docenas de conjuntos para niñas, 5 docenas de blusas, 1 docena de pantalón, 2 docenas de polos, etc.

Merly agradece a Dios por tener una familia unida y al banco comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Merly Heydi belongs to the communal bank "Loreto", located in the Jr. León de Judas Mz. 31 Lt. 5 AA.HH "Luz y Paz", Manantay District, Coronel Portillo Province, in the Ucayali Region of Peru. She is a 25-year-old mother of two dependent children; she is married and her husband works driving a motokar (3-wheeled motorized rickshaw). With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she invested in selling groceries. She has worked with the communal bank for one year. Currently she works selling clothing door-to-door. She spends her mornings dedicated to the children and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her merchandise to her clients. With this 2,000 soles loan, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 5 dozen girls' outfits, 5 dozen blouses, 1 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen shirts, etc. Merly is grateful to God for keeping her family together and to the communal bank for its help.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 dozen girls' outfits, 5 dozen blouses, 1 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen shirts, etc.

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en:
Chhoeum K. is 32 years old and resides in Phnom Penh City. She is married and now looks after two children. Both of her children are single and are living at home. She is a local merchant who owns and runs a store selling several kinds of fruit and rice also. She has been running her business for over 3 years in the area where her husband is also working. Her husband, Nghet Pisey, age 35, is a staff member of an association.

To expand her business and earn more income, K. needs to ask for a loan to purchase additional rice and fruit for re-sale. She hopes for a loan so she will be able to increase her income to cover her family's expenses and give her family stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Korneliya

texts.en:
Korneliya is married with 2 kids. Her family is an average Ukrainian family of 4 with many basic needs of 2 growing kids. Korneliya and her family live in Mukachevo next to Green market. She sells souvenirs, crystal, and dishware items from a small retail store in a favorable busy location of her home city. Korneliya has been in business for 6 years. Her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas.

Korneliya is an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. She seeks to expand her business and help her children find their place in life, as she believes this is her responsibility as a mother. Korneliya is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnas to increase her stock and her sales as a result.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Mrs. Na Lam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
TwenT. three people living in Ou Roung village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Na L., the 50-year-old village bank president, is a palm sugar seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more palm sugar to resell to earn income. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Sam Lim, is a worker who earns a little salary to support the family. Mrs. Na L. has three children, one of whom sells firewood while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Krok Mom and Mr. So Sopheak who are group guarantees and are also presented with the village bank members in the picture. 

TwenT. members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Este banco lleva como nombre  “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, sus socios son un total de 17 miembros,  ellos viven en el distrito de san jerónimo, nuestros socios tienen diferentes actividades, para lo cuál requieren el préstamo.

Los socios se dedican al comercio, muchos de ellos tiene pequeñas tiendas de abarrotes, otro  grupo tiene puestos de ventas de comida rápida, otros socios tiene pequeñas ferreterías, y otros tiene tiendas de venta de plásticos, otras socias tiene criaderos de truchas. Nuestros socios desean esté préstamo como un capital para poder abastecer sus tiendas y pequeños negocios y así convocar mayor número de clientes y que sus negocios puedan crecer mas.

Los socios valoran y agradecen de manera especial el préstamo otorgado por este medio comprometiéndose de esta manera a pagar las cuotas establecidas y el total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank's name translates to "Always United". They are 17 members. They all live in the district of San Jeronimo. Our members are involved in sales. Some have small convenience stores, some have fast-food stands, some have small hardware stores, some sell plastics, and some raise trout. Our members would like to use this loan in order to stock up and increase inventory for their stores and small businesses. By doing this, they hope to attract more clients and hopefully grow even more. These members are very thankful and very appreciative of this loan. They have agreed to pay the monthly amount and the total loan amount on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María Esther R. reside en ciudad Arce, junto a sus cinco hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual tres de sus hijos le colaboran a hacer tortilla y a atender a los clientes. María Esther solícita un presta a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio,  ya que dentro de sus principales necesidades para mejorar su negocio esta comprar más leña, maíz y una plancha nueva para hacer las tortilla. A pesar que María Esther es una señora de edad avanzada, trabaja duramente para poder obtener una vida digna con todo lo necesario para ella y sus hijos. Es por ello que desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
María Esther R. lives in the city of Arce with her five children. She sells tortillas, and three of her children help her by making the tortillas and attending to customers. Maria Esther is requesting a loan to invest more capital in her business, and to meet some basic needs of the business such as the purchase of firewood, corn and a new iron to make tortillas. In spite of the fact that Maria Ester is elderly, she works very hard to provide a dignified existence, meeting all the necessities for her and her children. That is why she wants to improve the quality of her business in order to increase her sales and her family income.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. A. is 59 years old. She is widowed with two children who currently work. Linda is very committed to her business and improving her social status. She lives at cape coast in the central region of Ghana with her family. She has been selling traveling bags, sewing machine parts, and used clothes in the central market for almost forty years. She started this business with her mother when she was a little girl and took over after her mother died. Linda hopes to  expand her business by restocking her inventory. She therefore would use this loan to buy traveling bags, sewing machines parts and clothing materials etc. and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy traveling bags, sewing machines parts and cloths in bulk.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and a vendor of dry goods such as combs, washing utensils, door mats and so on. She is married to Virdiano and their children are: Bernardo, 26 years old; Virdialyn, 24 years old; Jordan, 19 years old and a  high school graduate; Dianna, 14 years old, who works as a sales lady; Jadelyn,12 years old, and still in the elementary level; and Adelyn, 8 years old, in grade school. They reside at Baranggay Sipat, Cauayan City. Their business is situated in the public market of Cauayan. 

She has been in the business for three years and is still doing better.  She is now requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to increase her working capital. She will use the loan to purchase more items and hopefully generate more income.  She hopes to have her own stall in the market in order to be safe from heat and rain. Now she just displays her products on the sidewalk, which is not cemented.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Maimona's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 4 est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Chacune d’elle fait son propre  commerce de tissus et autres accessoires de femmes. Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réuni chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 4 brings together married women who sell various products. Each of them has her own business selling cloth and other accessories for women. The group of 3 members meets each week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to each of them in turn. With the loan they intend to bolster their businesses by buying additional inventory. The income from their businesses allows them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of additional merchandise

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’adéwui à Lomé, cette femme est mariée et à 2 enfants. Son mari est un  ouvrier au port autonome de Lomé et son revenu est insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer. Pour aider son mari, elle a débuté le commerce de pagnes en 2007. Elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Elle veut agrandir son activité. Elle a déjà obtenu un prêt de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite son deuxième cycle de prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
A resident of the Adéwui neighborhood in Lomé, this woman is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a workman in the autonomous port of Lomé and his income is insufficient to cover all the household expenses. To help her husband, she began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) in 2007. She does this work on foot. She would like to expand her business. She has already had one loan from WAGES that she reimbursed correctly. She is now asking for her second loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne" of varying qualities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie N. is 36 years old and a married mother of three children, ages 1, 4, and 7.  Epiphanie runs a small boutique in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she sells raw agricultural products.  Her business employs two other people and Epiphanie currently earns 160,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month.  In order to expand her product offerings, she has decided to seek credit for the first time.  A 500,000 FRW loan will allow her to purchase rice, five sacs of beans, and three sacs of sugar to add to her product offerings.

loans.use: Buy items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: José Isaías

texts.es: Don José Isaías G. Y. cuenta con 34 años de edad casado vive con sus dos hijos lleva 7 años laborando en la tejeduría como operario debido a la falta de demanda en su trabajo sus ingresos son muy bajos por tal razón se acercó ala asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprar una carreta para la venta de productos alimenticios ya que en su comunidad no existe este tipo de servicios aprovechando la circunstancias el quiere aprovechar este recurso para poder crear otra fuente de trabajo a la anterior y así poder sufragar los gastos de su familia y continuar con la educación de sus dos hijos y aprovechar este recurso para el mantenimiento de los gastos personales.
texts.en:
Don José Isaías G. Y. is 34 years old. He is married, and lives with his two children. He has spent 7 years working in textiles as an operator. Due to the lack of demand for his work, his income has become very small. For this reason, he began his association with ASDIR, in order to ask for a loan and so be able to buy a cart for the sales of food products. At the moment, in his community, this type of service does not exist. To make the most of the circumstances, he wants to take advantage of this chance, in order to create another source of work for the future, and so be able to meet the expenses of his family and to continue with the education of his two sons, taking advantage of this recourse to meet personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 2 years aged.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Habiba started her own shop business selling spare parts 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Habiba`s first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more spares.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Habiba hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more spare

loans.name: Adjouavi Celestine

texts.fr: Célestine est revendeuse de bois de chauffage dans son quartier de Kpogan Bame à Lomé. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 et cette activité lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari éleveur de volailles pour l’éducation de leurs 03 enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent son bois à des revendeuses d’eau chaude au CHU Tokoin de Lomé et à l’Hôpital de Bè toujours à Lomé. Actuellement elle a besoin d’acheter de nouveaux bois ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander un camion de bois de chauffage.

loans.use: Achat de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean O. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old and is single. Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
S. is 29 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She makes a living raising pigs, which she sells for slaughter in four months time after raising them. She has been raising pigs for about four years.

S. is married with three children, all three of whom are attending school. She is married to Thear who is 30 years old and a construction worker. S. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase a piglet to raise in a new stall that she built.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet to raise in a stall that she has built

loans.name: Omoriyeba

texts.en: Omoriyeba is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State.  She sells firewood in front of her house and has been in the business for the past 17 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
There are four low-income women who have jointly taken this group loan. The group leader, Mrs. C. T., is a 34-year-old chef for a local garment factory. Her husband is a teacher for a local public school. The couple has been blessed with three school-aged children, who live in the family home. C. T. has applied for a loan to purchase pigs to raise in the pigpen next to her house. The other borrowers are:
S., a basket weaver, is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials. 
V. is taking out her loan to order baskets to sell for income.
M. is a basket maker who requests a loan to buy bamboo for weaving baskets.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise in the pigpen next to her house.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
el sr. PANFILO M. H. tiene 59 años de edad, cuenta con una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "Don Pancho",  actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 4 años, es padre de 4 hijos. con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre los gastos Familiares.
el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que los carros distribuidores solo pasan una vez a la semana y a veces no pasan generandole perdidas por tener que ir a comprar a la ciudad de Danli y esto le ocasiona gastos de pasajes y tiempo para realizar las compras , el solicita el credito para comprar mercaderia en cantidades suficientes para suplir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Y ahora con la subida de los precios de café el piensa que le ira mucho mejor ya que las personas compran mas en su pulperia y asi que sus clientes no se le vayan para otra tienda.
texts.en:
PANFILO M. H., 59, has had a small general store called Pulpería "Don Pancho" for the past 4 years. He is the father of 4 children. With income generated from his store he is able to meet household needs. He needs financing to stock his store because delivery trucks only come by once a week and sometimes then don't come by at all which causes him losses because he has to go into the city of Danli to buy supplies and this means transportation costs and time lost shopping. He is requesting financing to buy merchandise in quantities large enough to meet his customers' demand. He hopes that now, with the increase in the price of coffee, that his customers will do much better and buy more in his store so that they don't go shop at some other store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, tortillas, cornmeal, powdered milk and soft-drinks, dairy products, churros (fried dough pastries dusted with sugar and cinnamon), soft-drinks, soaps, toilet paper, pastas, sauces, candles, matches, pills, lard, oil.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. She sells frozen foods such as turkey, chicken and beef to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her greatest joy is the festive season. She is happy because her sales and profits will increase. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia L. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Alicia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. His oldest daughter, who is 21 years old, is a university student and the youngest, who is six years old, attends a local secondary school. Ganbaatar operates a wooden products business with the help of his wife. He is responsible for making a variety of wooden products such as tables, chairs, and cupboards, while his wife is responsible for decorating and painting the products. 
They started their business in 2000 with working capital of 350,000 tugrugs (~240 USD). Over the years he has expanded and improved his business with working capital now reaching 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1,800 USD). They are well known to residents of their town because of their products' good quality and modern style. With their business profits, they were able to redesign and fix their own home. To supplement their earnings they also began a secondhand clothing retail business in 2004. Now they can fully support all of their family members' needs. He says, "In business one must possess good communication skills." He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for his furniture business.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wood

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
MICAELA BASTIDAS II
Organización y responsabilidad es lo que caracteriza a la Alcancía Comunal Micaela Bastidas II Ahora lo conforman 10 socias que cursan el sexto ciclo. 
La Presidenta María  Elena se dedica a rubro de las confecciones hace todo tipo de ropa además de confecciones a medida, vestuarios, forros para muebles y todo lo que le solicitan sus clientes.
Hace muchos años Hellen vende productos de belleza es algo que le gusta hacer aunque ella nos manifiesta que este año no ha tenido muchas ventas en comparación con el año pasado pero eso no la desanima ya que siempre busca las circunstancias para poder ofrecer sus productos  piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos.
La venta de Caldo de gallina y comida al paso por las noches ha ayudado a Demesia a educar y mantener a su familia. Hace varios años acondiciono parte de su casa para hacer su negocio, con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar  ollas y platos para la venta de su comida. Ahora tiene muchos clientes que la esperan, la socia está conforme con el crédito y desea continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.
texts.en:
Organization and responsibility is what characterizes the Micaela Bastidas II Communal Bank. Now there are 10 members and they are in their 6th loan cycle. President María Elena is dedicated to making clothes of all types, including tailored items, uniforms, furniture covers, and whatever else her customers request. For many years, Hellen has sold beauty products. It is something she likes to do, although she tells us that this year she hasn't had as many sales as last year. But this hasn't discouraged her; she is always looking for circumstances that enable her to offer her products. Hellen is thinking of her children's wellbeing. Selling chicken broth and meals in the evenings has helped Demesia to educate and maintain her family. Many years ago, she modified part of her house to accommodate her business. With great effort she managed to buy pots and plates in order to sell her food. Now she has many customers who patronize her place. The member is agreeable to the terms of this loan and wishes to continue working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NEEDED PRODUCTS

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, la señora Catalina Romero se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de madera y artesanías como sillas, mesas, hamacas, marimbas de juguetes, sombreros, canastos, entre otros.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos de madera y artesanía para continuar ofreciéndolos en el mercado y así abastecer a sus clientes que a diario visitan el mercado y que están interesados en comprar los productos de madera y las bellas artesanías que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega central market, señora Catalina Romero sells wooden products and handicrafts such as chairs, tables, hammocks, toy marimbas, hats, and baskets among other things. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional wood products to sell, thus satisfying the clients who visit the market daily, interesting in purchasing the beautiful handicrafts that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood products and handicrafts

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a widow. She has a small business located at the central market in Berdyansk town. Alla sells various types of products, including bakery items, tea and coffee, small home products, plastic bags, etc. Alla has been in this business for only two years. High demand for these kinds of products provides Alla with a stable business. Besides this, Alla is very polite and caring with her clients. She's got many repeated customers.

Alla would like to improve her business location. She would like a loan of 9,000 UAH. She believes that better business conditions will attract even more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: To improve her business location

loans.name: Flor De Durazno Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA FLOR DE DURAZNO  PORQUE  EN LA CASA DONDE SE REUNEN HAY UN ARBOL QUE EN DETERMINADA EPOCA DEL AÑO DAN UNAS FLORES MUY LLAMATIVAS EN FORMA DE RACIMOS COLOR ROSA.

EL GRUPO FLOR DE DURAZNO ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TOTOLAPAN MORELOS MEXICO AL NORTE DEL ESTADO DE MORELOS, CUYO HISTORIAL CREDITICIO SIEMPRE LOS HA DISTINGUIDO POR SER RESPONSABLES EN LOS PAGOS.

LA  SRA. ADRIANA DULCE MARIA L. Z. QUIEN ES ORIGINARIA DE TOTOLAPAN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, SU FAMILIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR CINCO INTEGRANTES LOS CUALES SON SUS TRES HIJOS (VARONES), SU ESPOSO Y ELLA; SUS TRES HIJOS ESTUDIAN, SU ESPOSO SE LLAMA EDUARDO Y TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO.

ELLA DICE SENTIR UN GRAN APOYO CON LOS CREDITOS QUE SE LE HAN OTORGADO, PUES LE HA AYUDADO A INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS. EL PROYECTO QUE TIENE CON RESPECTO A SU NEGOCIO ES  QUE  INCREMENTANDO SUS VENTAS PARA QUE PUEDA  SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO EN SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE ESTO LE GENERE  CONSTRUIR UN RESPALDO FAMILIAR  ECONOMICO PARA ELLA Y SU FAMILIA Y LOGRAR COMPRAR UNA VITRINA PARA SU NEGOCIO.

LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SUS OFICIOS SON:

MIREYA B. C.-VENTA DE NOVEDADES
LETICIA A. R.-VENTA DE ROPA
SUSANA A. R.-VENTA DE ABARRTOTES
LUMINOSA L. M.-VENTA DE REPOSTERIA
HORTENCIA R. B.-VENTA DE REGALOS
ADRIANA DULCE MARIA L. Z.-VENTA DE ABARROTES
LUCIA N. R.-VENTA DE ZAPATOS
SANDRA B. P.-VENTA DE ABARROTES
texts.en:
This group is called "Flor de Durazno" because at the house where they meet there is a tree that, at a certain time of the year, puts out very showy flowers with pink petals. The group "Flor de Durazno" is located in the community of Totolapan Morelos, Mexico, in the north of the state of Morelos. They have always been distinguished for being responsible in paying back their loans. Adriana, who is originally from Totolapan, has a grocery store. Her family is comprised of five members who are her three sons, her husband and her. Her three sons are students. Her husband is called Eduardo and he works in the fields. She says that she has received great support from the loans that she has been awarded because they have helped her to increase her sales. Her business project is to increase her sales so that she can continue investing in her grocery store and, with the income that this generates, she can build economic support for her and her family and be able to buy a display cabinet for her store. The other members of the group and its officers are: MIREYA B. C.- selling novelty items LETICIA A. R. - selling clothes SUSANA A. R. - selling groceries LUMINOSA L. M. - selling confectionary HORTENCIA R. B. - selling gifts ADRIANA DULCE MARIA L. Z. - selling groceries LUCIA N. R. - selling shoes SANDRA B. P. - selling groceries

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue investing in her grocery store and to buy a display cabinet for her business

loans.name: Meyling Guillermina

texts.es:
La joven Meyling Guillermina C. G. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como auxiliar de contabilidad, pero actualmente está estudiando para ser contador público en león, por lo cual ella solicito el crédito para cubrir con el pago de la Matricula de su Universidad y dejar pagado unos meses por adelantado y de esta manera ayudarse.

La Joven Meyling C. es soltera y no tiene hijos, aun vive con sus padres, pero no depende de ellos.
texts.en:
Meyling works as an accountant’s assistant in the Chinandega city hall. She is also studying in Leon to be a certified public accountant. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay for her tuition in advance at the university. She is single with no children. She lives with her parents, but supports herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: Dulamsuren U. is 41 years old and lives with her 16-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, Hongorzul, attends a local secondary school. Dulamsuren is a professional hairdresser. She started her business in 2001 after she moved to Ulaanbaatar. Over the years, she has expanded her business and has a loyal customer base because of her good service. With her business profit, she purchased her own plot of land with a house for her family. Dulamsuren has been planning to expand her business and renovate her equipment in the future. She is a proud mother and a very hardworking person who has been trying to provide a better life for herself and her daughter. She says, “My daughter will graduate soon from her high school, and I started saving some money for her university tuition fee. ” Dulamsuren is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 365 USD) loan to purchase necessary equipment and more hair dye products at wholesales prices for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar D. J., tiene la edad de 49 años, está separado, y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Omar también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Omar D. J., 49, is separated and lives alone. He is requesting funds to invest in his farm, specifically in his coffee crops. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizer. He wants to care for his crops properly so that quality will be optimized thereby obtaining the best sale price at harvest time. This is the first time he has used FUDECOSUR financing and he is very happy with the loan terms he was offered. He has been a farmer for a long time and hopes to have a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future so that he can continue to develop both as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is from the village of Dawo, Dapitan City. She is 48 and married with three adult children. Rebecca has a retail store selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the renovation of her videoke machine — a popular form of entertainment in the Philippines. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her videoke machine

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Joanne S. is now the mother of four infant children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Joanne has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells an animal she has raised. Joanne said that it is difficult to have four very young children but she is doing her best to meet their needs. Joanne's family lives in the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. 

In 2009, Joanne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Joanne is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. C. is an elderly man whose wife appears in the photo above.  They reside in an area of a Commune in Kompong Tom Province, where they have made a living raising rice and pigs since 2000.

In addition to their farming business, C. works as a district consultant advisor. He now has four children, two are married and the other two are still young and live in the family home. Because raising pigs is profitable, C. is taking out his first loan to purchase pig food and piglets for his pen.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou Song, 41 years old, is the village bank president selected by its eight members located in Kanhchang village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Chanthou Song and her husband, Mr. Choeun Chim, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to increase their income to improve their family's standard of living, Mrs. Chanthou Song decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her new business. This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, two are students in the local school and the youngest is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for her new business

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela R. is from Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Shela is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Shela owns & operates a business selling snacks & other food products like viands in the local community. Shela is just starting this  making and selling food business, before she is managing mini sari sari store , later she opt to have food vending business.

In 2009, Shela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Shela is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Shela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Betty Yliana

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 44 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijas en el distrito D. Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito perteneciente a L. provincia D. Chepén ubicada en L. región L. Libertad, a mas D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en L. casa donD. vive, elL. ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. uso diario que usualmente son D. difícil acceso por lo que su negocio siempre cuenta con acogida D. parte D. sus clientes. Esta actividad es importante para su familia porque gracias a elL. Betty pueD. ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

Betty necesita ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. mas productos D. modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.

ElL. es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, elL. se esfuerza constantemente para salir adelante ya que desea ver a su familia progresar. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Betty, age 44, lives with her husband and their three daughters in the Pueblo Nuevo district. This district belongs to the Chepén province in the L. Libertad region. It is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells basic needs products and groceries in a store set up in her home. She sells all types of products for daily use, which are usually difficult to get. That is why her business is always well-received by her customers. This activity is important for her family. Thanks to the business, Betty is able to help her husband cover the family expenses. Betty needs to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can continue to satisfy her customer demand. That is why she is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will contribute to achieving her objective. She is a hard-working woman who is very devoted to her family. She constantly strives to get ahead because she wants to see her family make progress. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility about making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products and groceries to expand the store in her house

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar L. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo poner la instalaciones de la luz en toda la casa.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder termina los acabados del interior y exterior de la vivienda ya que actual mente no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de una agencia aduanal.  
Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Cesar el se encontraba en su empleo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Dinora González es la persona que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Cesar L. is very grateful for Kiva's help in his last loan, which allowed him to install electricity in his house. He is now requesting a loan to buy more materials and pay the electrician. He plans to repay his loan with his salary as an employee at a customs agency. Mr. L. was at work during the home visit when this photo was taken. His wife, Dinora González, appears in the photo instead.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Final details for house interior and exterior

loans.name: Patricia Enomar's Group

texts.en: Patricia E. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and a widow with five adult children. Patricia is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Patricia E.’s Group. To make a living, Patricia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third taken out by Patricia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Used to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn T. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Lalyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Lalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, buying and selling rice. Lalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Lalyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Cresildo

texts.en:
Cresildo L. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old. Cresildo is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Cresildo owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating this service. Cresildo has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cresildo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresildo is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Cresildo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: El cliente utilisara su credito para la compra de mobiliario y equipo para poder mejorar  la imajen de su negocio y asi poder jenerar un mayor ingreso y asi poder sacar adelante a su nieto ya que depende de ella y de su esposo y desean darle una buena educacion por que la mama de  el niño se encuentra enferma  y ellos se hicieron cargo total mente de el niño .los hijos de la señora josefina ya estan todos casados y apoyan a sus padres de la manera que le ayudan a acomodar sus platillos en sus respectivos trabajos.
texts.en:
This client will use her loan to buy some furniture and equipment to improve her business’ image and be able to generate more income.  This will help her to get her grandson ahead, since he depends on her and her husband and they want to provide a good education for him.  The child’s mother is sick and they have taken complete charge of the boy.

Josefina’s children are all married and also help support them as best they can.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary Ekua Mansa

texts.en: Mary Ekua Mansa E. is a single parent with one child. She is into the sale of cosmetics, dresses and slippers at Asenadze near Abura. Mary uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of herself and her child. The loan will be used to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a house.

loans.use: purchase more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem A. F. is a young man from Deir A.-Balah in Gaza Strip. Waseem and his mother, who work in a UN school, are responsible for the household expenses. Waseem has a generA. store where he sells accessories, gift items, books and stationary. The store is located in front of a school in Deir A.-Balah and next to the city clinic, which guarantees customers.

Waseem wanted to expand his store and increase the returns, so he took a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods. 

Waseem appears in the picture here in front of his store.

loans.use: To purchase stationary, accessories and gift items for a general store

loans.name: Luis Ange

texts.es: El sr. Luis Angel M. S.  quiere el prestamo para mejorar su casa ya que tiene poquito viviendo ahí y apenas pudo adquirir una casa de interes social,con muchos esfuerzos le ha hecho algunas mejoras y  el desea poner una barda en su casa ya que donde el vive con su esposa Monserrat no tiene ningun tipo de proteccion ya que su esposa esta embarazada y el sr. Luis Angel tiene miedo que le puedan hacer algo a su esposa, el trabaja en una maquiladora y aveces tiene el turno de noche o a veces de dia o de tarde por eso el desea su barda en su casa ya que esta muy poquito ahí con ella y se queda muy preocupado. El señor Luis Angel quiere lo mejor para su esposa y su futuro hijo, y se preocupa por la calidad de vida que les quiere dar.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Angel M. S. wants this loan to make a home improvement. He was barely able to acquire his home through a government subsidy program. With many efforts, Luis has been able to make some improvements. He wants to put up a fence around his house.

Luis lives his wife, Sra. Monserrat, who is pregnant. Since they do not have any type of protection, he is afraid that something might happen to her. Luis works the night shift at a factory and sometimes works in the morning or afternoon. For this reason, he wants a fence around his house. With his wife alone in their small home, he is extremely worried. Luis wants to provide the best for his wife and future child. He is concerned about the quality of life he wishes to give them.

loans.use: Put up a fence around his house

loans.name: Mukaramkhon

texts.en:
Mukaramkhon is a skilled seamstress. She lives and works in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan, and offers tailoring services.  Mukaramkhon is married and her husband is very supportive of her business endeavors, which is also her greatest hobby. All her products are very well sewn and are relatively affordable, which is why Mukaramkhon's services are always in good demand. 

Mukaramkhon has been in this business for 25 years and has learned some valuable lessons, overcoming challenges and hard times. Her business has another big advantage in that it provides jobs for other people, helping fight the high unemployment rate which has always been a problem in Tajikistan. 

Mukaramkhon is seeking a loan of $1700 USD to purchase sewing machines and accessories to improve the quality of items she offers for sale, and to facilitate some working procedures for her employees.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and accessories

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 23 años de edad, reside en Chilanga departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos, Carlos de 4 años y Aurora de 1 año de edad, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas Juan alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, pero por la pobreza de su familia su padre se dedicaba al cultivo de hortalizas, por lo que él decidió ayudarle a sembrar y aprendió el oficio perfectamente.
Él inicio el su propio negocio ayudado por su padre, desde hace cinco años está trabajando para su propia familia, su ventaja es que el terreno donde cultiva es bueno, tiene tierra fértil por lo que su cultivo normalmente le da buenos frutos, Juan por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono, controladores de plagas y poliducto para regar; sus planes son sembrar mil plantas de chile, mil de tomate, este préstamo le ayudara a darle un buen cuido a esta siembra que es bastante y sería lamentable que se perdiera.
Juan es un joven visionario, emprendedor y ha sabido salir a adelante por sus propios medios, sus sueños es seguir produciendo la tierra, ayudar a su familia especialmente que sus hijos estudien y tengan oportunidades de crecimiento profesional, además de ser buen ejemplo.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old.  He lives in Chilanga, in Morazán department with his wife and two children: 4 year-old Carlos and 1 year-old Aurora.  Juan grows vegetables.  He studied at elementary school but his family was poor.  His father grew vegetables and so he decided to help him grow his crops and learned the trade perfectly.

Juan started his own business with his father's help.  He has been working for five years for his own family.  His advantage is that the land where he grows his crop is good land.  It is fertile which means that his crops normally grow well.

Right now Juan is requesting this loan so that he can buy farming supplies such as manure, products for controlling insect infestations and pipes for his irrigation.  Juan's plans are to sow 1000 chili plants and 1000 tomato plants.  This loan will help him to care for his crops.  He has a lot of crops and it would be terrible if they were to be lost.

Juan is a visionary and enterprising young man who has known how to get ahead on his own.  His dreams are to continue farming his land and to help his family.  He would particularly like to help his children to study and have opportunities for professional growth.  He would like to be a good example to his children.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies such as manure, products for controlling insect infestations and pipes

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José Dolores de profesión albañil tiene como planes establecer en un futuro una pulpería para obtener mayores ingresos y con el apoyo de su esposa administrarla, así también el mejoramiento de la vivienda ya que se le está deteriorando es un hombre humilde y trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo mantiene a su familia ya que ser albañil es una profesión que algunas veces existen trabajo seguido y en otro tiempo son un poco escaso. 
El préstamo que solicitad es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, arena, perlines, bloques, piedra cantera entre otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto. Agradeciendo a la financiera por su apoyo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José Dolores is a builder by trade though he has future plans to set up a small grocery stall in order to make more income.  He will run the store with his wife's support.  He also plans to improve his home since it is starting to show signs of wear and tear.  José Dolores is a hard-working and unassuming man who works hard to support his family since the building trade is such that sometimes there is a run of work and other times jobs are scarce.

José Dolores will use his loan to buy building supplies such as cement, iron, sand, beams, blocks, quarry stone and other materials he needs to build a room.  He is grateful to the financial institution for their support in improving his home and his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal María Montessori del distrito de Manantay y departamento de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad y 3 hijos menores de edad.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, préstamos que le han servido para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, porque dependen solo de ella.
La señora Rosa tiene su taller de costura, se dedica a la confección de vestidos y también cose ropas de dormir y ropas interiores.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará sus materiales que necesita como son: 10 metros de algodón, 8 hilos de diferentes colores, cierres, 1 rollo de elástico para pierna, 1 rollo de elástico para cintura, aguja de máquina, aceite de máquina, carbón para el motor de su máquina, 1 bobina de máquina.
La señora Rosa tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando, por eso es muy cumplida con sus pagos, y esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le sigue dando Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank Maria Montessori located in the Manantay district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has three young children. 

She has been working with loans from field partner Manuela Ramos for three years. The loans have served in helping her raise her children because they depend solely on her. 

Rosa has a sewing workshop where she makes dresses and also sews pajamas and underwear. With this loan of 1800 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy materials that she needs such as 10 meters of cotton, 8 threads in different colors, zippers, 1 roll of elastic leg, 1 roll of elastic waistband, sewing machine needles, machine oil, coal for the engine for her machine and one winding machine. 

Rosa wants to continue working which is why she always makes her payments. She is thankful for the opportunities that field partner Manuela Ramos keeps giving her.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is from Lebanon. She started her own business in 2008. She sells different types of CDs and DVDs. She cooperates with her father to be able to meet the family's heavy living expenses.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase larger variety of CDs and DVDs to take this chance to increase her business sales. In the future, she hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantity of CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 50 años, es una amable y cariñosa mujer. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis de 52 años y sus 3 hijos mayores de los  4 que son en total. Después de haber  trabajo por muchos años vendiendo pescado en un mercado ambulatoria, se le presentó la oportunidad de acceder a un lugar fijo y seguro para sus ventas. Desde entonces, junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de variedad de pescado y otros productos marinos, en la puerta del  frigorífico del pesquero (almacén de pescados). Es así que desde las 4.00 de la mañana, ya están en su puesto  distribuyendo pescado hasta las 11.00 de la mañana. De esta manera, Isabel y su esposo educaron a sus hijos e instalaron un taller de confecciones, donde trabajan sus hijos y eso es su mayor gratificación por lo que se siente muy feliz. En vista de ello, piensa ampliar su negocio para que continúe trabajando. Es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar  todas sus cuotas, para acceder posteriores ayudas como en su grupo comunal quienes siempre la apoyan. Isabel, tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, abastecerse de mercadería y de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 50, is an affectionate, kind woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, 52, and their three oldest, of four total, children.  After having been a fish peddler for many years she got the opportunity to acquire a fixed locale for her sales.  Since then, together with her husband, she sells a variety of fish and other marine products at the entrance to the fish cold storage facility (fish warehouse).  This is how starting at 4am they can be found at their post selling fish until 11am.  In this manner, Isabel and her husband were able to educate their children.  They also set up a dressmaking workshop which is where their children work; this is quite gratifying for her and she feels very happy about it.  In view of this, she plans to expand the business to continue working.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to repay all the installments in order to access future loans since her communal bank fellow members always support her.  Isabel plans to use the money from the requested loan to stock up on merchandise.  She hopes to improve her profits this way.

loans.use: To stock up on fish.

loans.name: Bethi

texts.es:
La señora Bethi es socia del banco comunal Perlas de Pucallpa, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad.
Bethi se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, está trabajando con el banco comunal hace 7 años, ha logrado implementar un poco mas su taller de costura con los préstamos que ha recibido de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamos de S/. 2,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cortes de tela, 10 metros de tela algodón, 1 ciento de cierre, 1 ciento de botones, 2 tizas, 1 ciento de alfileres, 1 juego de reglas, 1 tijera, 4 hilos de diferentes colores, 1 sobre de agujas para maquina, 1 paquetito de agua para coser a mano, aceite para maquina, 2 brochas pequeñas, 1 bobina. 
Con todas estas cosas va tener mayores ingresos y podrá pagar sus cuotas sin ningún problema, no tiene mayores gastos, porque vive sola, todos sus hijos son independientes.
texts.en:
Bethi is a member of the 'Perlas de Pucalipa' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 52 years old, widowed, and has 3 grown-up children.

Bethi owns a dressmaking business.  She has been working with her community bank for 7 years and has managed to equip her dressmaking workshop a little better through the loans she has received from Manuela Ramos. 

Bethi will use her new loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles to buy: 10 lengths of fabric, 10 meters of cotton, 100 fasteners, 100 buttons, 2 lots of chalk, 100 pins, 1 set of measuring tapes, 1 packet of needles for sewing by hand, oil for her machine, two small brushes and one bobbin.

With all of these items, Bethi will make more income and be able to make her repayments without any problems.  She doesn't have any additional expenses because she lives alone and her children live independently.

loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of fabric, 10 meters of cotton, 100 fasteners, 100 buttons, 2 lots of chalk, 100 pins, 1 set of measuring tapes, 1 pair of scissors, 4 lots of thread in different colors, needles for her sewing machine, needles for sewing by hand, oil for her machine, 2 small brushes and 1 bobbin

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung and her husband, Phoeun, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land, where they can cultivate rice to sell some of the rice yield and use the rest of the rice to support their family. Ung is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding pig is getting older, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Ung is seeking a loan to buy two piglets, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: to buy two piglets

loans.name: Elishbah's Group

texts.en:
Elishbah is 35 years old and married to N. M., who operates a scrap business. He sells scrap to different factories and other scrap dealers on order. 

Elishbah is very supportive lady and does her household responsibilities as a housewife very well.  She lives in a small city called Khanewal in a 2-room brick house with her family. Khanewal is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for over 10 years.  

She is the mother of five children. Her eldest son is a motor mechanic, while others are studying in different classes. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s scrap business. Using the loan, he will buy scrap such as plastic bottles, used paper, etc. in bulk quantity to fulfill orders on time and to earn good profits. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Elishbah is confident that a loan will be productive for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Elishbah.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia tiene 34 años, casada y con un  hijo pequeño, tiene ya  2 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, realiza el almuerzo completo al medio día y por las noches vende pacumuto(pollo frito)acompañado con sodas y un tanto de cerveza los fines de semana. La Sra.  Sonia vive en casa de sus suegra con buena comunicación con sus cuñadas. Dña.  Sonia   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido al crecimiento apresurado de su negocio ya que incluso los clientes le piden que incorpore una rokola y con el dinero del crédito comprara una rokola. Ella   es cliente antigua  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  ella es una persona joven trabajadora, su deseo es ampliar su negocio, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sonia is 34 years old, married and has one young son. She has been selling food for 2 years. She offers a complete lunch in the afternoon and in the evenings she sells (fried chicken) accompanied by sodas and some beers on the weekends. Sonia lives in a home with her mother-in-law and has a good relationship with her in-laws. Sonia saw the need to request a loan from our institution because of the speedy growth of her business and because her customers have asked her to buy a jukebox. With the money from this loan she will purchase a jukebox. Sonia is a long-standing client with our institution with a good repayment history. She is a young, hard-working woman and her goal is to expand her business. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to buy a jukebox.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam V. O. tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive en el barrio de ingreso a Fortaleza a 12 km. de la ciudad, es profesional ingeniero Forestal y quiere trabajar en su profesión para lo cual necesita capital de inversión para los plantines de flores y construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda que está sin los mismos por falta de dinero.  

Ya tiene un pequeño vivero con plantas ornamentales las mismas que comercializa en la feria de los domingos en el barrio, esta actividad le ha estado ayudando a crecer poco a poco en su actividad.
texts.en:
Miriam V. O. is 27 years old. She is married and she has two small children. She lives in a neighborhood near Fortaleza, 12 Km. from the city. She is a professional forest engineer and she want to work in this field. She needs investment capital for flower seedlings and to build a perimeter wall which has not been built due to a lack of money. 

She has a small nursery with ornamental plants. She sells them at the market on Sundays in her neighborhood. This is helping her to grow her business little by little.

loans.use: with operating capital for her flower growing activities

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells basic needs such as oils, sugar, instant noodles, canned goods, baked breads, cooking ingredients and other types of dry goods. Teresa had been this business for five years. According to her, she is able to generate PHP 2,000 a month.
