Rosalvina tiene muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder terner su casa propia. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra de una congeladora y algunos gastos escolares.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalvina is 39 years old and a single mother of a nine year old son. She lives in a rented house located in Santa Rosa de Lima in the District of Parcona. She sells chicken wholesale and retail from a rented stall at the Niño Jesus de Ayavi Market. Rosalvina has been in this business for seven years and started out working as an assistant. She has many dreams and goals, one of them being having her own house. With the money she requested, Rosalvina will invest in the purchase of a freezer and pay for a few school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & pay for her child's school expenses

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and married with two children. He runs a hardware shop in Nairobi to earn a living. He also sells kerosene to earn extra income. He previously worked in the informal sector before he ventured into this business.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he saves his money with his group named Hallelluyah, which enables him to access loans. He has learned to keep business records from the training that Faulu Kenya offered him together with his group members.

He has requested a loan of 80000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add stock of paint and hardware items for sale. He dreams of growing his business into a paint industry in the future.

loans.use: To purchase paint and other hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina Martha

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la perla, la señora Guillermina Martha Q. ha proporcionado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo y producción agropecuaria dentro de las que se destaca la producción de granos básicos como es el Maíz, Ajonjolí, Sorgo y en menor escala frijoles dichos rubros le proporcionan a demás de un ingreso, parte de su mantención ya que los productos descritos forman parte fundamental de la dieta alimenticia de estos pobladores, también desarrollan la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proporciona alimento, ingresos monetarios y estabilidad económica por ser uno de los rubros un tanto rentables de la zona, dichas actividades son realizadas en unió familiar.
La señora Guillermina Martha Q. solicita este crédito ya que esta a inicios del ciclo de primera y necesita realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la producción agrícola de este año así como también quiere reponer una vaca la cual perdió después de que esta sufriera una fractura.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la perla, la señora Guillermina Martha Q. ha proporcionado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo y producción agropecuaria dentro de las que se destaca la producción de granos básicos como es el Maíz, Ajonjolí, Sorgo y en menor escala frijoles dichos rubros le proporcionan a demás de un ingreso, parte de su mantención ya que los productos descritos forman parte fundamental de la dieta alimenticia de estos pobladores, también desarrollan la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proporciona alimento, ingresos monetarios y estabilidad económica por ser uno de los rubros un tanto rentables de la zona, dichas actividades son realizadas en unió familiar. La señora Guillermina Martha Q. solicita este crédito ya que esta a inicios del ciclo de primera y necesita realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la producción agrícola de este año así como también quiere reponer una vaca la cual perdió después de que esta sufriera una fractura.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra insumos y una vaca parida.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Шарифова Фазилат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном продает детскую одежду и женскую обувь. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Fazilat S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 30 years old, single. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales at a market. She primarily sells children's clothing and women's shoes. Fazilat has been involved in this business for 8 years already. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Marcelinda

texts.en:
Marcelinda T. is from the village of  Talon, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Marcelinda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcelinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marcelinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marcelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marcelinda is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Marcelinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her mother and two siblings. She has owned her lingerie store for the past 8 years. She is now requesting to borrow $800 to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena J. is from the city of Hinagdong Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Elena is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling nipa in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evangelene

texts.en:
Evangelene B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a food stall, selling and catering many kinds of foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $220 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangelene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Evangelene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.en:
Gaudencio is a humble and hardworking family-oriented businessman. He has over ten years of experience as a salesman and two years ago opened his own business. His storefront business sells CDs, records, clothing, and gifts. Gaudencio’s wife and one of his sisters help him run the store. His business attracts the growing Latino population in his community.

One of Gaudencio’s greatest challenges is that he doesn’t always have the goods that his customers are looking for. With his second ACCION USA loan, Gaudencio will be able to diversify his inventory by purchasing more clothing and Mexican accessories. This will allow him to retain more customers who come into his store looking for specific items. 

Gaudencio has enjoyed being his own boss and generating extra income for his family. He felt the hardships of the economic crisis when no bank would lend to him. Receiving a loan from ACCION USA has allowed him to maintain his business and support his family. Gaudencio hopes to continue growing his business so that his family will be well off some day.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Additional inventory, including clothing and Mexican accessories

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 45 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos Rodrigo de 18 años y Griselda de 15, ellos dependen económicamente del negocio de gloria el cual venta de frescos y comida. 
Tiene 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, con ayuda de la hija ella trabaja todos los días de la semana de 9:00 am- 4:00pm, vendiendo frescos y comida, ella  solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para hacer freso de Horchata (elaborado de morro, ajonjolí, maní y otros) esto le permitirá continuar con el negocio, generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Las  aspiraciones de Gloria son cumplir con puntualidad los pagos de este préstamo y a futuro mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia
texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old. She lives in the town of San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department. She is a single mother with two children; Rodrigo, 18 and Griselda, 15. The depend financially on Gloria's business, which is selling food and beverages. She has 15 years of experience in the business. With her daughter's help, she works every day fron 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m selling food and beverages. She is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients to make the horchata drink (made from morro seed, sesame seed, peanuts and more). This will allow her to continue with her business and generate the income necessary to cover family expenses. Gloria aspires to making her payments on time for this loan and in the future improve her living conditions, and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients to make the horchata drink (made from morro seeds, sesame seeds, peanuts and more)

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 41 years old. Alona is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Alona is just starting this business.

In 2010, Alona joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alona is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alona from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of fish to sell

loans.name: Nelius Wanjiku

texts.en:
Nelius is 30 years old married to Jacob Ngugi who is a businessman. They have two children: five years old and six months old. She has a farm where she gets her income. She has been in the industry for a period of about two years with a profit of 6,000 KES.  

She is taking her first loan with KADET and she wants to use the loan to expand her business. She hopes to have a wholesale shop which will see her children get educated and achieve their dreams in life and become responsible adults.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar es casado, tiene 32 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el sector Tumi D. Oro del caserío YencaL. Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a L. agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito D. Lambayeque, capital D. L. región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más D. 20 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con L. agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorD. y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar trabajar como peón agrícoL. en los diversos campos D. cultivo D. L. zona. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Julio Cesar desea realizar algunos arreglos en el corral donD. guarda a su ganado para poder mantener a sus animales seguros, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is married, 32 years old, and lives with his wife and young child in the Tumi D. Oro section of the town of YencaL. Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone, located in the Lambayeque district, which is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to agriculture, such as raising cattle and goats for later sale.  In addition, he works as a farm laborer on the various harvest lands in the area.  With these activities, he helps his family get ahead.

Julio Cesar would like to make some improvements to the corral where he keeps his livestock, in order to keep them secure.  For this reason, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a hard-working father, who is very devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur, and to improve his family’s standard of living.  He is well liked and trusted by the people who know him.

loans.use: To pay for some expenses to improve his corral.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es: El Sr. José Angel A. N. él se dedica  a la siembra de granos como frijoles, maíz etc,  tiene  quince años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de insumos y granos para prepararse para la siembra los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Angel A. N. works farming grains such as beans and corn.  He has worked as a farmer for fifteen years.  He has had two loans with CEPRODEL and has used them to buy fertilizer and grains to prepare for planting.  The loans from CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to him and have helped him improve his quality of life as well as his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to rent land

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene un niño de 10 años. Rosa tiene un bodega en su casa, antes era de su hermana, pero al irse de viaje Rosa se quedo a cargo del negocio, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo y ha hecho crecer el negocio, ahora le pertenece.
Rosa solicita un préstamo porque con ello abastecerá más su negocio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, gaseosas, detergentes jabones, leche, etc.
A Rosa le gusta Finca, porque le da facilidad de crédito y recibe capacitaciones en lo familiar, negocios, en Finca aprendió los valores a ser puntual, responsable y tambien a ahorrar.
El sueño de Rosa es llegar a tener una tienda mayorista y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en: Rosa is 35 years old, married with a 10 year old boy and belongs to the Communal Bank, Nobleza.  She has a store at home, which before belonged to her sister, but she left on a trip and Rosa was in charge of the business.  Little by little Rosa began investing and grew the business, which now belongs to her.  Rosa is requesting a loan because with it she will purchase rice, noodles, oil, sugar, soft drinks, detergents, soaps, milk, etc.  Rosa likes FINCA because it gives her credit and training in businesses.  With FINCA she has learned the value of being punctual, responsible, and saving.  Rosa’s dream is to have a wholesale store and for her son to be a professional.

loans.use:
comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, gaseosas, detergentes jabones, leche, etc
To purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, beverages, detergent, milk, etc...

loans.name: Fany Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny L. es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la comunidad de Guaguanchi que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, es conocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultima hija está en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión sastre y tiene un taller en su casa, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad la que han construido con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Doña Fany es de profesión sastre la misma que la viene la ejerciendo hace 13 años, su oficio  aprendió desde muy corta edad, ha trabajado en esta actividad y con el tiempo se ha puesto su propio taller con la ayuda de su esposo, laboran de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, como labora en su casa tiene tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de pollos y chanchos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad y también son para el  consumo de su familia.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su hermana.  Los créditos anteriores la han servido para comprar materia prima y este lo va ha utilizar  en la compra de una maquina cortadora de tela para su taller.  Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanny L., 36, is a member of the Mi Bankito communal bank.  She lives in Guaguanchi which is part of Valle parish.  This parish has a cold climate and is known for the beauty of its natural scenery.  Its residents are dedicated to farming and animal raising.

She is married and has three children who are 16, 14 and 11 years of age.  Her two oldest children go to high school in the city and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a tailor and has a workshop installed in their home.  The home they reside is theirs and they have built it with the effort they’ve put into their work.

Fanny is also a tailor.  She has been in this occupation for 13 years.  She learned this skill while still very young.  She has worked at this and in time set up her own workshop with help from her husband.  They work from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm.  Since she works from home she also has time to raise chickens and pigs which she sells in her community and also uses for her family’s consumption.

She is in her 3rd loan with the communal bank.  Her sister invited her to join.  The previous loans have been used to buy raw materials and this one will be used to buy a fabric cutting machine for her workshop.  Her greatest wish is to have a factory.

loans.use: To buy a fabric cutter.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
Marisabel C. de 30 años desde hace cinco años tiene una cafetería en la parada del 7 sur donde comercializa chicle, gaseosa, agua, pan, etc. Este lugar es muy concurrido ya que transitan las personas que van a León, carretera sur, el Crucero, Ciudad Sandino, Chinandega, Nagarote, etc.
Ella trabaja junto con sus hermanas e invertirá el crédito en productos para surtir el negocio y su sueño es construir su casa.
texts.en: Marisabel C. is 30 years old.  She has had a café at the '7 sur' bus stand for five years.  She sells chewing gum, soda, water, bread, etc.  This place is very busy since people who are travelling to León, carretera sur, el Crucero, Ciudad Sandino, Chinandega, Nagarote, etc. pass through there.  Marisabel works together with her sisters and will invest her loan in buying products to stock her business.  Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To buy candies, cigarettes, soda, snacks, water, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife, who stays at home and takes care of their child. He has owned shoe shop in his town for the past 15 years. He sells women's and childre's shoes, in addition to selling women's bags. His work is an important source of income for his family.

 His shop is located in a busy area so he was able to gain a good number of clients during this period. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his store’s inventory especially with kids’ shoes for the winter season where the students returns to school and the families buy new shoes for their kids. It is the right time to take advantage of that and earn extra profit. In the future, he hopes to open a men's shoe shop in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Tatiana Maybeth

texts.es:
Tatiana Maybeth E. G. tiene 19 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el esposo y con la hija,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Tatiana Maybeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial G. y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Tatiana Maybeth E. G. is 19 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and daughter in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Tatiana Maybeth is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the G. and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy her own home.  She likes going out for walks.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Barrio La Cañada Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Barrio la Cañada", esta ubicado en la localidad D. San Antonio la Cienega, la localidad es muy bonita porqué se encuentra en lo alto D. un cerro, hay una vista hermosa del paisaje que tiene, la gente D. esta comunidad es agricultora y ganadera, por lo general toda la gente tiene su parcela para sembrar y cria sus animales para venderlos y es su principal actividad, el grupo lo integran 7 mujeres D. ahi D. la comunidad, algunas D. ellas tienen una tienda D. abarrotes y otras D. ellas lo invierten en comprar animales para criarlos y venderlos despues, los nombres D. las integrantes del grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Irma S. M., tiene 38 años y su actividad es la cria D. pollos y guajolotes
2.-Esthela M. C., tiene 19 años, ella inicia su negocio vendiendo pollos D. engorda
3.-Zenaida C. C., doña Zenaida tiene 60 años, se dedica a engordar reces y borregos
4.-Irene R. D. J., tiene 35 años, la Señora trabaja en una gallera, criando gallos D. pelea, y pidio su prestamo para poner una tienda D. abarrotes.
5.-Maria Elsa M. C., tiene 39 años, y tiene una tienda D. abarrotes
6.-Yudith D. R., tiene 19 años y venD. animales, borregos y pollos

Cabe mencionar que tambíen todas las señoras saben bordar, algunas D. ellas tambien venden sus bordados o lo que les encargen, tienen esta costumbre D. hacer servilletas, manteles algunas prendas etc. Las mujres en esta comunidad son Mazahuas y hablan este dialecto. En las escuelas D. la comunidad para que no se pierda este dialecto se implemento una maetria mas que es el Mazahua, hay un maestro especializado que da clases a los niños con la finalidad D. que no se pierda.
Doña Irma es la encargada del grupo, ella es una mujer lider en su comunidad lo cual significa que toda la gente la conoce y la sigue, su gente la apoya en sus desiciones que toma, ella tiene 21 años D. casada, vive con su esposo que trabaja en México, tanto el señor como la señora Irma se dedican a sembrar su terreno, tubieron 8 hijos en total, 3 D. sus hijos ya se casaron, 2 mas viven con ellos pero trabajan y tres hijos dependen D. ellos dos ya que van a ala escuela y quieren terminar una carrera. Doña Irma para ayudar a sus hijos en la escuela venD. sus pollos y sus guajolotes, lo que gana D. su negocio se los da a sus hijos para que esigan estudiando D. esta manera el prestamo le beneficia a su familia, doña Irma tiene mucha experiencia y comenta que no se le hace dificil criarlos, seria dificil si criara otros animales como las vacas, porqué seria sacarlas a comer y estar ahi toda el dia pero no es asi para ella, el sueño que tiene doña irma es que su familia este bien D. salud y que su negocio avance, que todos los animales los termine D. vender y sus hijos termienen lo que ellos quieren estudiar. La casa donD. viven es propia y ahora estan abriendo una parte D. su casa para poner un negocio solo que esta esperando ahorrar para terminar el local .
texts.en:
This group is called "Barrio la Cañada", and is located in the San Antonio la Cienega town. This town is very beautiful because it is located on top of a hill and it has a lovely view of the countrysiD.. The people of this community are farmers and ranchers. Most of them have their own parcel of land for growing crops and raising their animals to sell, and this is their main job. This group is maD. up of seven women from the community. Some of them have grocery stores and others will invest this loan in the purchase of animals to raise and later sell. The names of the group members are the following:

1.-Irma S. M., age 38, whose business is raising chickens and turkeys
2.-Esthela M. C., age 19, who is starting her business where she will be selling fattened chickens
3.-Zenaida C. C.. Mrs Zenaida is 60 and raises cattle and lambs.
4.-Irene R. D. J., age 35. She works in a cockfighting business, raising fighting roosters. She has requested her loan in order to open a grocery store.
5.-Maria Elsa M. C. is 39 and has a grocery store.
6.-Yudith D. R. is 19 and sells animals; lambs and chickens

It is worth mentioning that all of the women also know how to embroider. Some of them also sell their embroidery or take orders. They have the tradition of making napkins and tablecloths, and certain garments. The women of this community are Mazahuas and also speak this dialect. In the community's schools they have introduced Mazahua material so that they do not lose this dialect, and there is a specialized teacher who gives children lessons with the goal of keeping the language alive.

Mrs Irma is in charge of the group. This woman is a leader in her community, meaning that everyone knows and follows her. Her people support her in the decisions that she makes. She is 21, married, and lives with her husband who works in Mexico. Mr and Mrs Irma sow their lands. They have 8 children in total, 3 of whom are married, 2 of whom live with them and 3 of whom depend on them because they go to school and want to finish with a career. Mrs Irma, in order to help her children in school, sells her chickens and turkeys. She gives her earnings to her children so that they can keep studying--so this loan will benefit her family. Mrs Irma has a lot of experience and says that she does not find it difficult to raise the animals, but that it would be difficult to raise other animals such as cows, because she would have to let them out to eat and stay out all day.

Mrs Irma's dream is for her family to be in good health and for her business to advance, and to be able to sell all of her animals, and for her children to finish studying what they want to study. The home where they live is their own, and they are now planning to use part of the house in order to open a business; she is just waiting to have enough savings to finish the space.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 3 hijos menores de edad; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace un año esta trabajadora mujer vende afuera de su casa diversos platillos preparados a la parrilla, como pollo salchichas, anticuchos, y esta muy satisfecha pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención. Ella empieza con la venta de sus platillos a las 5 de la tarde y se puede prolongar hasta la medianoche, pues debe terminar con todos los preparados para obtener buenas ganancias. a pesar que se separó de su esposo Marilu trabajo muy duro para salir adelante y ahora esta saliendo adelante con lo que mejor sabe hacer que es cocinar, y el tiempo le ha permitido captar gran cantidad de clientes. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño restaurante en un local o en su misma vivienda. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Marilu tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le faltan para continuar preparando sus platillos a la parrilla, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marilú, age 37, lives in her own home with her three young children. Together they strive each day to get ahead. A year ago this hardworking woman began selling outside of her house a variety of dishes prepared on the grill such as chicken, sausages, and kebabs. She is very happy because her children help with the business. Marilú begins selling her dishes at 5pm and continues until midnight when she stops preparing food to generate a good profit. Despite being separated from her husband, Marilú works hard to get ahead and continues to move forward by doing what she does best, which is cooking. Over time, she was able to attract a great number of customers. In the future, Marilú wants to establish a small restaurant in her home or at a separate location.

This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to submit her payments on time because she does not want to look back to those who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. Marilú has plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of ingredients that she lacks for preparing grilled dishes. In this manner, she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing grilled dishes

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca con el dinero del préstamo cancelará las mensualidades escolares de su hijo; Blanca señora es profesora, Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Blanca will use her loan money to pay her son's monthly school fees.  Blanca is a teacher.  This is her main source of income for supporting herself and her family.  She lives in her own home which is located in the north of the city of La Paz.  This is the second time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay this year's school fees for her son

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. La mayoría de sus clientes son regulares, pues frecuentemente consiste llegan a buscar los diferentes productos que le solicitan. Hace más de 32 años que tiene este negocio, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona  responsable y que ha salido adelante con estos financiamientos. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, cosméticos, ropa en general, lentes, gorras entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ramona sells general merchandise. This is not the first time she has received financing. Most of her customers are regulars who come by on a frequent basis in search of different products. Ramona has been in business for more than 32 years. She is always known for being a responsible person and has been able stay ahead as a result of these loans.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, cosmetics, clothing, sunglasses, hats, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy bed sheets, cosmetics, clothing, sunglasses, hats, and other items

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel M. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Raquel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Raquel owns and operates a retail store. The business's main source of revenue comes from buying and selling seafood products, including milk-fish and sardines, in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase stocks of fish and to increase working capital. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional varieties of fish for resale, such as salmon and mackerel. This loan will be the second taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this investment to improve and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell, such as salmon and mackerel

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. is 51 years old, married and has eight children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 14.

Veronica is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn for 30 years. She usually earns about 6,000 PHP from this farming. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Veronica wishes to have a bigger and better house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C., from the village of Sinamar, is 54 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for over 22 years, earning approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. she is now requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Rosita's eighth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for making Churrascos [grilled meat]

loans.name: Yunes

texts.en:
Yunes M. is a thirty-seven-year-old married lady with four children aged between sixteen years old and five years old to whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Kitengela area where there are many businesses and people. Yunes has been selling water to the local people. She has been in this business and she says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy water containers for storing more water to be able to supply to a bigger number of customers. She hopes to grow her business and become a renown water supplier in the area. She also sees herself buying a plot of land on which she will build a residential house. She describes herself as very hardworking and social.

loans.use: to buy water containers

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 29 years old and married to Cornelius, who contributes to the family income. She has been running her grocery business for about three years, but she also has a secondary business in the transport industry where she has a vehicle for taxi services, earning an income of about 20,000 KES per month.

This is her first loan from  KADET, after being introduced by a friend. She wants to use the loan to expand her grocery shop and she plans to restock the business with vegetables and fruits thus have all the items that her clients will need.

She in future hopes to expand both of her businesses and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her grocery shop by adding more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 39 años, es viudo vive con los  cinco hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

José se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel is 39 and is a widower with 5 children.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

His communal bank is called "Narcisa de Jesus," and is located in the rural San Temistocles settlement in Ventanas canton.  The members of this  communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice.

Jose is a farmer who specializes in growing corn, which is a family tradition.  He makes his purchases every month in the canton of Ventanas, and he sells his products in the market in the same locality.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The financial support of this loan will help him to purchase the supplies that he needs.  He confronts the challenges of pests, diseases and variations in the weather that affect his crops.  His dream is to buy land so that he can continue to farm.

He really enjoys working in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market and from door to door to her neighbours. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of owning a well furnished café in the business.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase utensils, plates, jugs, cups, spoons and cooking pots. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, plates, jugs, cups, spoons and cooking pots.

loans.name: Wilmer Hernan

texts.es:
Wilmer Hernan tiene 19 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con la hija de 1 año, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia para la familia.

En los tiempos libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilmer Hernan is 19 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and one year-old daughter in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Wilmer is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Wilmer is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests attacking his crops.  his dream is to own a home for his family.

In his spare time, Wilmer enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina de 57 años, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Reina cuenta con su negocio de venta de comida que a colocado en su domicilio, actividad que realiza desde  hace 10 años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza, la buena sazón y el buen servicio que brinda, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar utensilios e insumos para seguir elaborando su comida y satisfaciendo la necesidad de su clientela y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  Reina con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un restaurante grande con diferentes platos típicos para ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
Reina, 57, lives in her own house with her family; it has electricity and running water and is located in Oyotún District that belongs to Chiclayo Province.  It’s a farming and livestock raising zone.

Reina has a home-based food sales business.  She’s been in this line of work for 10 years.  She has her own clientele and is known for her cleanliness, the tastiness of her dishes and the good service she provides.  Income she earns will help her provide her family with improved quality of life.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy utensils and ingredients to continue preparing her food and meeting customer demand and meet household expenses with her profits.  Reina, with her work and desire to get ahead, has won over the trust of her customers aiming at having a large restaurant in the future with a variety of traditional dishes to offer her clientele.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 35 años; se separó hace un año de su esposo. A pesar de su tristeza, ella continúa trabajando por sus 2 hijos: Fernando y Sandra; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana).  Las plantitas que se observa en la fotografía, son viveros de café que se alistan para ser transplantados en las tierras productivas. La actividad a la que se dedica es la siembra de café y plátanos; en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos propios, situados en la zona alta de su comunidad. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener ganancias seguras, pues vende sus granos en la cooperativa de Sanchirio Palomar, asimismo cuenta que en temporadas de gran cosecha los mismos intermediarios llegan a su chacra para comercializar sus cultivos íntegros. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo, “odio el bullicio de la ciudad”, afirma. Por el futuro de sus hijos, pues en ellos invierte la mayor cantidad de su ganancia, está pensando incrementar la expansión de sus terrenos agrícolas; ya que tiene varias plantitas para su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brindan. Razón por la que se compromete en ser puntual con sus cuotas. Patricia, cuenta que el proceso de crecimiento del café; contiene varias etapas que consiste en el fortalecimiento de los cultivos en su momento oportuno. Por ello de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero adquirido en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en: Patricia is 35 years old and she separated from her husband a year ago. Despite her sadness she continues to work for the sake of her 2 children: Fernando and Sandra. She takes care of them in their own home, located in Union Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). The plants seen in the photograph are coffee plants that are being developed for transplant to fertile land. She has a coffee and banana plantation. She owns 3 hectares of land and they are located in the high altitude region of the community. She already has 8 years' experience. Throughout all this time she has been able to obtain secure earnings. She sells her coffee beans in the cooperative in Sanchirio Palomar. She says that during great harvest seasons the distributors come to her fields to buy her products. what she most enjoys about her work is that she spends most of her time out in the fields. She says "I hate the bustle of the city". She invests the greater part of her earnings in her children for their future. She is thinking about expanding her agricultural land. She has various plants ready for production. She is a member of the communal bank "Desarrollando Para el Futuro de Prisma", meaning "Developing for the Future of Prisma". This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She feels content for the development opportunity provided. She is committed to making her payments on time. Patricia says that the process of growing coffee plants consists of several steps to strengthen the farm land at opportune times. Having received your support she will invest the funds in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her grandson). 

Cate has a food stall.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Cate sells her products from home, by means of retail. Cate has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish and bunches of bananas. 

The main business challenges for   Cate include thieves and debtors.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and also to sell wholesale only. 

Cate lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mehrigul

texts.ru: Мехригул проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет высшее образование. Мехригул более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется продуктовый магазин. Она берет кредит для покупки сахара, вафель, сухофруктов, риса, гороха и макарон.
texts.en: Mehrigul lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 37 years old, married and has four children.  She has a higher education.  Mehrigul has been involved in retail sales for over ten years.  She has a food store.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, waffles, dried fruits, rice, peas and pasta.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, waffles, dried fruits, rice, peas and pasta

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного двухлетнего мальчишка. Он занимается купля продажей растительного масла на местном рынке. Он имеет свою торговую точку и у него много клиентов. Более 2 лет он занимается в этой сфере бизнеса и имеет хорошую деловую репутацию среди своих конкурентов.  Акмал старается привозить высококачественные продукты для своих клиентов, чтобы они были довольны. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой товарооборот, с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2750$ США. Он хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Akmal is involved in buying and selling vegetable oil at the local market.  He has his own retail outlet and has many customers.  He has been involved in vegetable oil this business for over two years and has a good professional reputation among his competitors.  Akmal tries to bring in high quality products for his customers, so that they are satisfied.  He wants to expand his business and increase his goods turnover, and is requesting a loan in the amount of $2750 for this goal.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr:
La cliente Baseme, leader du groupe d’affaire «Umoja Kibabi », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 37  ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient convenablement.  Son mari est chômeur (sans emploi). En dehors de ses enfants légitimes, elle héberge également  4 autres enfants de sa famille élargie (cousin, neuve, voisin du village). Elle est vendeuse des  boissons (bière Primus, Mutzing et Fanta, etc.). Elle expose ses produits devant des boutiques des amis et connaissances (sur la voie publique, rond point Signers) pour la vente en gros et parfois à son domicile c’est la vente en détails. Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son beau père sous forme d’assistance. Son capital initial était 20$ équivalent aux deux caisses de la bière Primus. Il y a 16 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  33 casiers de Fanta et Primus.
Elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client named Baseme, the leader of the business group called «Umoja Kibabi », is a young entrepreneur of 37, married and the mother of five children, who are all studying appropriately. Her husband is jobless. Besides her legitimate children, she also shelters four other children from her extended family (a cousin, a nephew, neighbors from the village). 

She sells drinks: Primus beer, Mutzig beer, and Fanta (orange soda), etc. She displays her products in front of the shops of friends and acquaintances (on the roadside, at the Signers traffic circle) to be sold wholesale and sometimes, out of her home, retail. She began her little business with her own money, received from her father-in-law as a form of assistance. Her initial working capital amounted to $20, or the price of two cases of Primus beer. She has been in this business for 16 years. This new loan will allow her to buy 33 cases of Fanta and Primus. 

She hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business. This client thanks Hekima for its efforts on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 33 cases of Fanta and Primus (beer).

loans.name: Resalie

texts.en:
Resalie is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She is a dealer of herbal medicines in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicines.

She has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the herbal medicines business for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear. Resalie aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine.

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en: Neriza is 28 years of age and married with one child. At her young age, she is able to manage her variety store. She has been operating it for three years, and she is able to earn about P3,500 a month. She would like to improve her store by completing the set of groceries she sells. With the income generated from her business, Neriza couldn't buy a complete set of basic needs due to the high cost of basic commodities. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital in the amount of P7,000. She believes that she could improve her store by having a complete set of basic needs. Through her loan, she could satisfy her customers' demands. In this way, she could generate more income to provide the needs of her family and save some for the education of her only child.

loans.use: to buy a complete set of basic needs for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Dora Emilse

texts.es: Dora Emilse es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 7 años trabaja vendiendo productos femeninos por catálogo como cosméticos, accesorios, ropa por encargo, ropa interior y productos de belleza, es madre de 2 hijos y su mayor anhelo es poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro, por ello trabaja diario con la ilusión de progresar. Actualmente Dora quiere comprar mercancía en mayor cantidad pues así las utilidades son mayores y esto le traerá beneficios de descuentos y premios, su intención es cumplir en el menor tiempo posible con los pedidos de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias, sin embargo Dora no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir el negocio y comprar en las cantidades que requiere, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual mejorar las ventas y generar mas ingresos, logrando así una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dora Emilse is a very enterprising woman who for the last 7 years has been selling products for women by catalogue such as cosmetics, accessories, clothes by order, underwear and beauty care products. She is the mother of 2 children and her greatest desire is to offer them a better future. For this she works every day with the hope of making progress. Currently Dora wants to buy merchandise in bulk as in this way the profits are higher and it will bring her benefits such as discounts and prizes. Her intention is to make her order turn-around time as short as possible and make better profits. However Dora does not have the capital necessary to stock her business and buy in the quantities necessary which is why she is asking for a loan with which to improve sales and generate more income, thus achieving a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk such as clothes, beauty care products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Matisi Sgh Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Matisi SGH Group in Western Kenya! Rosemary is the facilitator of the Matisi SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rosemary takes care of 11 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of a good harvest and because One Acre Fund has the best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Rosemary had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rosemary was only able to harvest 2.4 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rosemary will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Matisi SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the above photo, Rosemary appears with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Mrs. Saing, 25, is a farmer and pig-raiser. She lives in Baray district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common-law relationship with her husband who provides a trailer-motorcycle service in and around the community. Together, this couple is able to earn a good income of $15 per day from their businesses. With this income, Saing has saved some money and kept it for using in a future business. 
Saing is a smart and hopeful housewife who always takes care of the family and maintains her business growth. With a loan of $1,200 from HKL, Kiva’s partner, Saing will buy a rice-husking machine that can be used in the family. Furthermore, she will be able to provide a rice-husking service to local villagers in exchange for money, or she can buy rice with outer cover at a low price from local farmers, and then start husking its cover for sale at a profitable price. In the future, Saing hopes to provide her child with great opportunities and the chance to join a university in Phnom Penh.
The picture shows Saing in front of a thatch house, with her son and two nieces.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine.

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба жительница города Исфара. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном Матлюба занимается торговлей женских и мужских носков оптом. В этой области он 28 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en: Matlyuba is a resident of Isfara. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. Matlyuba sells socks for men and women at the local market. She has been working in retail for the last 28 years. She is taking out this loan to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to expand inventory

loans.name: Cynthia Cecibel

texts.es:
CYNTHIA CECIBEL tiene 19 años de edad es soltera tiene un hojo, vive con la mamá y con el hijo de 2 años Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
CYNTHIA se dedica a estudiar y piensa poner una minis tienda.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para poner una mini tienda de arroz, embutidos, y bebidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener más dinero para la comida para ayudar a la familia.
El sueño es estudiar y graduarse en la profesión cómo diseño gráfico.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta Salir con el hijo a pasear.
texts.en:
Cynthia Cecibel is 19. She is a single mother of one. She lives with her mother and her 2-year-old in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the Las Brisas Communal Bank, located on 6 de Octubre and Asad Bucaran streets, in the El Hospital neighborhood which is part of the Ventanas parish. They work in general commerce.

Cynthia is a student and is planning to open a convenience store. She buys and sells in Ventanas. Cynthia is requesting the loan to open a small store selling rice, sausages, and drinks. With the help of the loan, she will be able to have more money for food to help her family.

Her dream is to study and graduate in a profession like graphic design. 

She has not had any type of problem. In her free time, she likes to go out walking with her son.

loans.use: to open a mini mart selling rice, sausages and drinks.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom is 31 years old and the mother of two young children.  She lives in the Prey Chor district.  To earn a living, she has been involved in rice farming for more than five years.  Prom’s farmland is located near the river, which provides enough water for her rice crops in both rainy and dry seasons.  She is able to generate an income of $2.00 per day through her business. 

At this time, Prom is preparing to build her own house and she needs more funds to complete the construction.  Fortunately, her husband is a construction worker and will gather his own team to perform the work.  As a result, she will pay less for the labor needed to complete the work. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase timber and other materials necessary for construction.  Prom hopes to receive this loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other materials for the construction of her home.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad con su anterior credikiva compró mercancías para atender lo pedidos de su clientela sin depender de los anticipos o cuotas iniciales que le suelen entregar sus clientes y esto la hizo muy feliz. Ahora se propone acceder a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará en mayor cantidad mercancía que viene en los descuentos que traen los catálogos e incursionar en una nueva línea de productos como calzado que comprará en la ciudad de Pereira. Su préstamo  tendrá éxito porque lo hace en una época de mucho movimiento comercial porque hay una buena rotación de dinero por efecto de compras  y estará fundamentada en pedidos de sus mejores clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Que Dios les conceda muchas bendiciones por la ayuda recibida.”
texts.en: Piedad, with her previous CrediKiva, purchased merchandise in order to attend to her customers' orders without depending on the advances or initial fees that her customers usually provided and this made her very happy. Now, she proposes to access a new loan with which she will purchase merchandise in greater quantities that comes at a discount from catalogs and to enter into a new line of products, like footwear that she will be in the city of Pereira. Her loan will be successful because she is doing this in a season of much commercial movement because there is a good rotation of money due to purchases and orders will be based on her best customers. Her message to the lenders of Kiva is the following: "May God grant you many blessings for the help received."

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in greater quantities that comes at a discount from catalogs and to enter into a new line of products, like footwear.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rose operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals during the evening when all  family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Rose's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rose is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rose dreams of giving her her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego learned entrepreneurship in the United States of America. After his graduation, he came back to his hometown to launch a booklet on software for secondary students. He sold more than 6,000.

He met with a Zafen analyst in an entrepreneurship camp. He seized the opportunity to present his business model. His objective is to bring new technology closer to poor students while making some money. His collaborator is a young student who earns some money to support her school fees.

With this loan, Diego will buy a printer, boost his Short Message Service platform and print out more paperback books.

He is pictured with Jenny (customer service agent).

Diego has another source of income to support his repayment. Finally, he will also create two part-time jobs for students.

loans.use: to launch a printing service for primary and secondary schools.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is seeking his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. With his first loan he was able to invest in his furniture making business. He increased his supply of raw materials and he was also able to hire two new employees. Wilson has also just opened a new location from which he hopes to sell his final products. He is very excited about the new store that will be run by his daughter.

Wilson truly runs a family business. His two sons are employees in his workshop along with a couple of other workers. His daughter is helping him at his new location and Wilson is responsible for the oversight of the whole operation. He needs the loan in order to invest in his new store and continue purchasing raw materials. He will also invest in products made out of paja toquilla straw, the same material used for panama hats.

Furniture making has always provided him and his family with enough income for food and housing. Wilson is proud of the progress his business is making. He thanks the Kiva community for providing him with his first loan and hopes to continue receiving support from the international community.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He needs the loan in order to invest in his new store and continue purchasing raw materials.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married, and her husband is a self-employed electrician. They have four kids, two of which are very young and dependent on their parents. She is a nurse, and is interested in having a business related to health. A year and a half ago she found some natural health products, which help prevent diseases. She had already tried other products, and the last ones she found are the ones she believes in. Her clients like them a lot, and there is a high demand for them.

She already has a pretty big amount of orders. However, she first needs to invest in order to provide variety. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, which she hopes to pay back in six months. You can help this business grow, go ahead and support her.

Martha esta casada, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por su cuenta, tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son pequeños y dependen directamente de sus padres. Ella es enfermera y le interesa tener un negocio de salud, hace año y medio encontró unos productos naturistas que le ayudaban a prevenir enfermedades, ya había probado otros productos y éstos son los que a ella le han convencido. Por lo que han tenido gran aceptación y demanda de sus clientes.

Ya tiene un pedido suficientemente grande de estos productos pero primero tiene que invertir para que sea surtido, por lo que Martha requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 dólares que espera devolver en el transcurso de 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a que este negocio crezca, apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Angelica

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia needs to extend her house. “I would like to build a bedroom in my house since I have a teenager daughter who is 16 years old, and she needs to have some privacy. Right now she is sharing her bedroom with my other son who is 14 years old. I would like each of them to have their own bedroom”. I’m requesting for $1000.00 for the construction of a bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Sonia Necesita ampliar su casa. “Me gustaría hacer un cuarto en mi casa ya que tengo una hija adolescente de 16 años y necesita privacidad, ahora esta compartiendo su cuarto con mi otro hijo de 14 años y quisiera que cada quien tuviera su propio cuarto” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. has been working very hard to raise her two children for 7 years. Her husband left the family to go down south, making her life (which is already hard) become even harder. H.’s main job is to make rice pancake. She wakes up to work from 3 a.m. everyday. She finishes making the rice pancake at 5.am., then spends her whole morning to deliver the pancakes to the restaurants. Because her pancakes are good, she often finishes selling everything before noon. Each pancake brings her a profit of $0.012. On average, Ms. H. earns $3.5 a day. This amount is mostly spent for the food and the school bills. Now Ms. H. is looking forward to borrow $125 to buy more rice and sesame – the ingredients for her rice pancakes- to increase the amount of pancakes sold everyday during the summer.

Translated from Vietnamese by PH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương một mình làm việc để nuôi 2 con ăn học từ 7 năm nay. Chồng chị bỏ vào miền Nam khiến hoàn cảnh gia đình đã khó khăn lại càng thêm khó khăn. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là làm bánh đa. Chị Hương dậy tráng bánh từ 3 giờ sáng. Việc tráng bánh được hoàn tất vào lúc 5 giờ, sau đó toàn bộ buổi sáng là thời gian chị Hương mang bánh đi giao cho các cửa hàng. Bánh chị làm có chất lượng cao nên toàn bộ số bánh thường được bán hết trước buổi trưa. Mỗi chiếc bánh làm ra chị lãi được 0,012 USD, trung bình một ngày chị Hương thu nhập khoảng 3,5 USD. Số tiền này chủ yếu được chi dùng cho việc mua thức ăn hàng ngày và trả học phí cho các con. Hiện tại chị Hương đang làm đơn xin vay 125 USD để mua thêm gạo, vừng để tăng số lượng bánh bán ra mỗi ngày trong mùa hè.

loans.use: buy rice and sesame to make rice pancake

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Francisca H. S. and I have a small business selling used closed on the streets in my city. I have had this business for a year and a half. Through my work I have been able to help out with my family's food and medical costs. Now I am asking for help to buy more clothing because I want to provide my customers with better service. I would very much appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola, Me llamo Francisca H. S., yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada en la calles de mi cuidad. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año y medio. Con este negocio he podido ayudar mi familia para gastos de alimentacion y medicamentos. Ahora necesito si me puden ayudar a comprar mas ropa ya que tengo que dar un buen servicio a mis clientes. Le agradecere mucho su ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes

loans.name: Mardiah

texts.en: Mardiah  is 25 years old and is married with one child aged 6. She has been running a business selling waste and scrap materials which she collects and sells.  She usually earns a profit of $1.50 per day while her husband Warsa works i a syrup factory. His income is unfixed, earning her only $13  per week.  She is urgently requesting a loan so that she can expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Marita Astra

texts.es:
Mrs. Marita is part of the communal bank “Las Fresitas”, lives at Jr. Los Cedros Mz. 265 Lt. 3, District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali Province. She’s 42 years old and is the mother of 3 children, of whom only one still depends on her. She’s married and her husband works, but the income isn’t enough to cover the costs of the house. This is why Marita, with the 1st loan she received of 300 soles ($100US) from Manuela Ramos, started a bakery and bought a second hand motorcar to increase the household income.

In fact, she bakes in the bakery she started in her house and delivers it with her motorcar. She and her husband wake up at 4am to knead the dough so they can be ready to distribute and sell it to their customers by 6am. Afterwards, she makes breakfast for her sons so they can go to their respective jobs and schools.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 3000 soles ($1000US approx.) -- which will be repaid in 6 months -- she‘ll buy 1 bag of flour, 1 box of butter, 3 packs of yeast, half a bag of sugar, 2 packs of large sodas and two packs of small sodas, and also some parts for her motorcar. Marita is happy because she feels that all her dreams are being made into a reality.
