texts.es: Juan Carlos es un joven que se dedica a al elaboración de balones anteriormente él trabajaba para su tía en la fabrica de balones pero ahora es independiente y hace sus propios balones, el cliente es bastante trabajador y conoce bastante de su área, gracias a su trabajo el puede ayudar a su familia que vive en La Paz, el actualmente tiene bastante mercado y también viaja a provincias para comercializar sus productos, comenta que a un mediano plazo piensa retornar a su tierra natal La Paz para estar al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos.  Él vive en alquiler en un cuarto en la casa de su tía, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de blader para las pelotas, esta agradecido con la institución  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young man whose business is making balls.  He used to work for his aunt in her ball factory but now he works for himself and makes his own balls.  Juan Carlos is hard working and quite well-known in his area.  His work enables him to help out his family who live in La Paz.

Juan Carlos currently has quite a large market for his goods and he also travels to different provinces to sell his products.  He comments that in the medium term, he is thinking of returning to his native city of La Paz so that he can be with his parents and siblings.  He currently rents a room in his aunt's house.  He will use his loan money to buy bladders for making his sports balls.  He is grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy bladders for making sports balls

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 30 years old. She has four children and all of them except the youngest attend school. Dativa sells vegetables and she has been in this business for twelve years. Dativa has requested this loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She says that her business has contributed much because she managed to build a house from this business. She plans to make her business grow with the profits she intends to make. In the future, she wishes to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Héctor de 41 años, que trabaja como operario en una empresa y de sus dos hijos menores. Desde hace un año instaló en una pieza de su casa un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, y ahora tiene muchos clientes entre niños y jóvenes que gustan de este tipo de juegos para entretenerse. En ocasiones su hijo la apoya en el negocio, en donde administra el negocio; mientras ella trabaja como niñera en una guardería que queda cerca de su casa, este trabajo le permite percibir un sueldo. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la pedrería para prendas de vestir, actividad que lo hace durante sus ratos libres, en donde lo apoya una persona. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, en adelante tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Violeta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una máquina más, que necesita para implementar mejor  su negocio de alquiler de  videojuegos, de esta manera espera aumentar la cantidad de clientela que recibe a diario.
texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her two youngest children and her husband Héctor, also 41, who works as a machine operator.

A year ago Violeta set up a videogame rental service in a room of her house and she now has many customers, both children and young people who like to entertain themselves with these type of games. Sometimes Violeta's son helps her with the administration of the business while she works as a nanny in a nusery close to her home, which provides her with an income. In her spare time she also helps out another person sewing beads into items of clothing. As she is a very enterprising woman, Violeta plans to improve the facilities of her videogame rental service to increase her earnings. 

This is the eighth loan that Violeta has taken out with MFP and she promises to repay her loan installments on time. She is very grateful to the people who make this loan possible as it allows her to continue working. Violeta plans to invest this loan in purchasing another sewing machine so she can better outfit her videogame rental service. With the earnings from this new purchase she hopes to increase her daily client base.

loans.use: Puchase another sewing machine to better outfit her videogame rental service.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia  realiza trabajos de costura en paño (tela especial); el crédito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadería, compra de 2 pieas de paño, cada una de 50 metros. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Tejar  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene 4 hijos. La cliente se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Alicia works as a wool seamstress; she needs this loan to expand her merchandise. She's going to buy 2 swaths of woolen cloth, each 50 meters long. She lives in her own home located in the Alto Tejar area of the city of La Paz; she's married and has 4 children. She's satisfied with the loans she's received since 2005.

loans.use: Purchase of 100 meters of woolen cloth for her sewing business

loans.name: Aracely Sulay

texts.es:
La Señora Aracely A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad posee  una gran belleza natural y arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. Aracely tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Aracely se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de productos Yanbal, esta actividad  la realiza hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos de la marca Yanbal. Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Aracely A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia”. She lives in the Uncovia sector of the city of Cuenca. This city possesses both natural and architectural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. The great food captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners.

Sra. Aracely is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 14 and 9). The older child is a high school student while the younger one attends school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. They do not own a home, so they currently live in a rental property.

Doña Aracely is devoted to the household duties and selling Yanbal products. She has been in this business for three years and works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.

Aracely is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of more cosmetics from the Yanbal line. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B. is from the village of Linconcomonan, Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Mary Ann is a widow and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling food like hot and spicy chicken and salted fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. 

Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like fish, vegetables and spices. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like fish, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily B. is a hog-grower in Surallah, South Cotabato. She sells the hogs to the people in her community. She also grows bananas and sells the fruit as well. Lily also makes an income out of providing general alteration and tailoring services to her community.

Lily has requested a loan to purchase feed, cloth and other tailoring materials. She hopes to have a stable business so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and also cloth and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Genia

texts.en:
Genia N. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Genia is single. To make a living, Genia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & candies in the local community. Genia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Genia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Genia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

loans.name: Enterprising Women Group

texts.es: La Sra. Barbara  es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Barbara  trabaja desD. hace 8 años en la venta y confección D. pantalones D.  vestir en un taller alquilado junto con una socia, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que su esposo ganaba sueldo minimo y no podían cubrir  sus gastos primordiales y es así que barbara se asocia con una amiga y pusieron su pequeña empresa nos cuenta que nada fue fácil trabajo my duro tocaba puertas y asi vendia sus pantalones hasta que ahorro un dinero y empezó en un taller junto a  su socia,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  tiene 4 maquinas propias para su negocio, y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida. Barbara nos cuenta que ahora esta ahorrando para comprarse una maquina industrial. El prestamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercaderia (telas, hilo, etc). Sabemos que Barbara cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Barbara is married and she has 3 children. She is a member of the communal bank named “Enterprising Women". It is a group of 8 members who have various business types. Barbara has been in business for 8 years, selling dress clothes at a rented shop she has with a partner. This business came to be because her husband earned minimum wage and they were not able to cover the basic expenses and so Barbara partnered with a friend and they established a small business. She said that it was not at all easy and she had to work hard, knocking on doors to sell her dress clothing. She finally managed to save some money and she set up a shop with her partner. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to secure a better income. Her children go to a private school, she has 4 sewing machines for her business, but above all, her family has a better quality of life. Barbara says that she is now saving to purchase an industrial sewing machine. The loan that she was granted will be used to purchase merchandise (fabrics, thread, etc.). We know that Barbara will meet her goals with a great deal of work and effort and that the loans granted to her by Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter K. M. is 49 years old. He is married and has three children.  

To earn a living, he sells old newspapers. He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed two people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown tremendously. He sees himself having a big business in five years. He has requested 80,000 KES to buy more newspapers and renovate his house.

loans.use: To  buy more newspapers and renovate his house.

loans.name: Zwena

texts.en: Zwena is 22 years old.  She has a 2 ½ years old child. She works with her husband and everything is going on well.  Zwena sells bicycle spare parts and has been in this business for 4 years. With the income from this business, she feeds her family and has improved her family's living standards. Zwena is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts.  With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a family house.

loans.use: buy bicycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: G.s. Estrella De Dios Group

texts.es: Sonia del Carmen, Juana, Dora y Graciela conforman el grupo solidario Estrella De Dios. Graciela tiene 9 años de trabajar en la venta de tortillas, inicio este medio de vida como una alternativa de apoyo para su esposo ya que no tenían los suficientes ingresos para mantener a sus 5 hijos menores de edad a su cargo de 3, 5, 7, 9 y 12 años a pesar de ser una familia con muy pocos ingresos han podido enseñarles a sus hijos valores y ganarse la vida de una manera muy honrada. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de cal, maíz, leña, bolsas plásticas, actualmente el precio del quintal de maíz es muy caro y ella quiere comprarlo a gran cantidad.
texts.en: Sonia del Carmen, Juana, Dora and Graciela make up the supportive group "Estrella De Dios" (Star of god).  Graciela has been selling tortillas for 9 years.  She started this means of earning a living as another support for her husband, since they didn't have sufficient income to support their 5 dependent children ages 3, 5, 7, 9 and 12.  In spite of being a very low income family, they have been able to teach their children good values and to earn an honest living.  The purpose of the current loan is to purchase lime, corn, firewood and plastic bags.  Currently, the price for 100 kg. of corn is very high, and Graciela wants to buy it in a greater quantity.

loans.use: to purchase lime, corn, firewood and plastic bags.

loans.name: Eudiber Cristobal

texts.es:
Eudiber de 51 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio y tienen dos hijos que estudian en colegios fiscales. Tiene una tienda de víveres.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás cuando se cambio de domicilio decidió abrir una tienda para su clientela . Labora de 6H00 am a 10H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas víveres para sus ventas y surtir mas el negocio. En un futuro desea comprarse otra casa para alquilarlo y tener otros incremento en su capital.
texts.en:
51 year-old Eudiber lives in Primavera, Duran (an area on the outskirts of the city that was originally built upon without official authorization.  The area has several hills, streams and lakes that are visible as the remains of a broken ecology).  Eudiber's wife helps him in his business and they have two children who are in public (state) schools.

Eudiber has a grocery store.  He started his business some time ago when he moved house.  He decided to open a store for his customers.  He works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  With the help of this loan, Eudiber would like to buy more food products to sell, so that he can better stock his store.  In the future, he would like to buy another house to rent out and increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks and candy

loans.name: Manka'a

texts.en:
Manka'a is a widow. Her husband died, leaving behind 8 children for her to support their needs. She lives in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Manka'a has faced serious difficulties in paying rent for her house, her children dropping out of school, and inadequate capital to start up a business for herself before joining GHAPE. She has also suffered from ill health. 

With this loan she plans to buy baby pigs, purchase cassava to produce water fufu, and to be able to afford the transportation of her products to the market. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and marketing strategies from GHAPE and also has some form of experience in this business. Manka'a has the skills and other supporting factors for success in her business. The loan, if granted, will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper rates. She has also taken and successfully repaid loans from GHAPE in the past.

She will put her profit back into her business and use part of it to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay children’s hospital bills. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buy items for resale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 40 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora,. Esta casada con Timoteo de 52 años y tienen 03 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia casa. Paulina trabaja arduamente desde sus 19 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba tan solo a la agricultura lo cual le servía solo para sostener a los miembros de su familia. Con sus ahorros acumulados abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Es así que su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, ya  lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir mas espacio de terreno para cultivar donde trabaja su amado esposo. Con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este es su 20avo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con el dinero del crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.
texts.en: Paulina, a resident of the city of Santa Rosa, is 40-years-old.  She is a down to earth and hard-working woman.  She is married to Timoteo who is 52-years-old and they have three school age children and they all live together in their own home.  Paulina has worked very hard since she was 19-years-old.  At that time she worked only in agriculture which only enabled her to maintain her family members.  With the savings she accumulated she opened a grocery store where she offers a variety of staple products.  This is how her stand generates good profits.  She opens the doors of her business very early in the morning to wait for her first buyers.  She mentions that the key to getting better customers is attending to them in a friendly manner and helping them with their purchases.  What she likes best about her work is having a good relationship with her customers.  Now she has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to be on her feet all day long.  Her business is going very well and thanks to this she was able to acquire more land to cultivate where her beloved husband works.  With the money from the loan she will buy supplies for her store.  With time, she hopes to expand her house and make her store bigger.  This is her twentieth loan and she is very happy to know that she will have support once more from all of you to continue growing.  In her communal bank she is a member who participates and is very punctual to meetings.  With the money from the loan she will buy merchandise like: sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, oil, and detergent to stock her store.

loans.name: Antonina Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Antonina  Florencia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  tiene un total de cinco hijos, tres mujeres y dos varones, desde hace tres  años tiene su  tienda sus hijos le ayudan a atender  .
Esta muy contenta  por que  tiene muchos clientes y se vende muy bien ,obtiene buenas ganancias.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas mercancía ,por que sus clientes  luego van a comprar y no tiene lo necesario  hay ocasiones que si tiene todo  pero se le termina muy rápido.
Sus clientes le recomienda que compre artículos de papelería  por que es lo que menos tiene y lo que mas se vende  por que el negocio esta cerca de algunas escuelas.
Doña Antonina Florencia es una señora muy  trabajadora  en ocasiones vende antojitos mexicanos en la noche para tener un dinero extra por cualquier necesidad.
Le da  las gracias a fundación  por  el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante  y obtener  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonia works selling groceries. She has a total of 5 children, 3 girls and 2 boys. She has had her business for 3 years and her children help her.
She is very happy because she has many customers and her sales are very good so she makes good profits. 
She requested the loan to buy more merchandise because sometimes her customers come to buy things and she doesn't have what they want. Sometimes she runs out of things very quickly. 
Her clients advised her to stock-up with stationary products because this is what she has least of but there is a lot of demand for stationary because the business is close to some schools. 
Antonia is a hardworking woman. Sometimes she sells Mexican food at night in order to have extra money for whatever comes up. 
She thanks the Foundation for the support it has given her to be successful and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery and stationary supplies.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 30 years-old. She is married with two school-aged dependents. The family is settled in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is cultivating land to earn a living. She grows various crops and sells them to community members and at the town market for a profit. She has already spent the last three years of her life tilling fertile soil. Every month, she gets a total of PHP 3,000 from the work.

Richel is now a member of Kiva partner GDMPC. She can now access financial services offered by the cooperative to some extent. In this third loan application for PHP 10,000, she can compensate for land preparation cost and start planting another set of crops for additional production in the future. Richel plans to plant as much as she can, to generate enough for the family and buy more lots to increase farm production.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 26 years old. He is married and they have one child. He has been farming for the past five years. Stephen is applying  for his third loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and expand his farm. His dreams are to prosper in farming and be able to provide better lives for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtur, 42, is a business man who runs two businesses. He lives with his wife and four children in a house owned by one of his relatives. He is primarily a meat seller at a local bazaar and also works as a transportation driver using his minivan to supplement the family income. 

For many years, he has been saving money from his businesses in order to purchase his own piece of land. But he is falling short of little money to cover the land payment. Buying this land is very important for his family. Therefore he is taking a loan as additional funding to purchase the land. He has taken loans twice earlier and has repaid successfully on time.

loans.use: as additional funding to purchase his own piece of land for his family

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Filbert, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children, and one of them goes to school. He has had a fruit and vegetables business since 2005. He works from 6 a.m. to 8.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build his small house, bought a TV, a fridge and paid household expenses. He also increased his fruit and vegetables stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to build more rooms.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Faraja" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for clothing to resell on credit.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been engaged in a retailing business where she sells different kinds of basic commodities and other products needed within their village. She is 52 years of age, married, and has three children. Aside from her store, she also sells fish within their local community.

Lolita aims to buy more groceries such as sugar, cooking oil, beverages and other products needed in her retail store, but her income is just enough for their daily needs. So, Lolita is requesting for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000.  In this way, she can make her business more profitable and attractive to many customers. She hopes that she can maintain her retail store and save some money for her emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: buy grocery products

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive  la señora María José, ella tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 11, 10 y 5 años, los tres estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo de las marcas Nivi y Unimoda, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja cuatro días a la semana tres horas al día sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas sus hijos están en clases y así puede realizar sus ventas mucho más rápido, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada 15 días, lleva ya en su negocio cerca de 7 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños en todos los modelos y géneros. Este es el séptimo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de ropa
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton (Portoviejo).  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that the local people make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Here we meet 30-year-old María José who lives with her common-law husband.  She has three children who are 11, 10 and 5 years old.  All three of them attend school.  Her husband is a salesman.

As well as being a great housewife, María José also works in commerce.  She sells Nivi and Unimoda-brand clothes through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door.  She works four days a week, three hours a day, mainly in the mornings, as this is when her children are in school and so she can make her sales much more quickly.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in her business for nearly seven years now and it is doing very well.

María José needs this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes in all styles and designs.  This is her seventh loan cycle with her community bank which she likes because of the ease with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is to own a clothes wholesaler's.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih (face is hidden) is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children; one of them attends school. 

He has been working as a car blacksmith for the past 14 years.  He opened his own car body repair shop in 2009.  

Today, Nazih’s asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air compressor and mechanical equipment.  

This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will help him achieve substantial growth in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Diougousoperin Group

texts.fr:
DIOUGOUSOPERIN est un groupe  constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles monogames à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. 
Madame  BINTOU en écharpe bleu claire et en première position à partir de la gauche fait le commerce de pomme de terre.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 400 Kg de pomme de terre qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The Diougousoperin group consists mainly of married women who are on average 30 years old, have 5 children and for the most part live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso.

They are on their twelfth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Bintou, wearing a light-blue scarf and standing first on the left, trades in potatoes.

She intends to use her ​​loan to buy about 400 kg of potatoes, and resell them retail at the Medina market in Sikasso, in a fixed emplacement and also from her home, for cash to both men and women customers..

She expects to make average monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interests, with the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Maynard

texts.en:
Maynard is 21 years old, married and has one child.  At his age, he is very young to have his own family. But because of the situation, he needs to make a sacrifice and surrender his freedom for the sake of his family. His young age doesn’t stop him engaging in the farming business. As he has always said “if others can do, I can do it too”, so he patiently works hard at his farming business.

To produce greater profits, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour costs.  With his little experience in farming, he knows that he cannot do it alone especially when he feels financial constraints.  Hopefully, through this financial assistance and his endurance, he will yield better crops in the harvesting season.

By then, he will be able to provide for the needs of his family as well as save for their future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay for labour costs

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Semirames trabajaba como ayudante en el restaurante de un sobrino con el tiempo dejo el negocio debido a un viaje, durante algún tiempo ella se dedico a otra cosa, pero después de un tiempo retomo el negocio del restaurante para trabajar en el alquilo nuevamente el local y así empezó por su propia cuenta poco a poco fue ganado su propia clientela ya tiene en su negocio cerca de un año, actualmente ella sola cocina, atiende y realiza todas las labores ahora que su negocio ha crecido esta en búsqueda de una persona que la ayude por que ya no puede abastecerse sola, en su restaurante vende diversos platos de comida criolla menú y platos a la carta por las mañanas también prepara desayunos su negocio ha mejorado mucho por eso que quiere  formalizarlo para ofrecer una buena atención a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha podido surgir y darle a su hijo comodidad y estudios. su préstamo le va a servir para comprar los insumos que necesita para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz,aceites, azúcar etc. que es lo básico para la preparación de los alimentos que vende, Semirames es integrante del grupo “ TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” lo conforman 07 socias que viven en el Callao zona costera del Perú.
* Semirames es la cuarta de las paradas (derecha) viste polo guinda.
texts.en:
Semirames used to work as a helper in a nephew's restaurant. In time, she left the business due to a trip. For some time she worked at something else. But after a time she took up the restaurant business again, and started to work in it.  

She rented the premises again, and so began on her own account. Little by little, she started winning her own clientele. She has been in her business for close to a year now. 

Currently, she cooks on her own, serves customers, and does all the work. Now that her restaurant has grown, she is seeking a person to help her, because now she can't run it alone.

She sells various traditional dishes in her restaurant, a meal of the day, and a la carte dishes. In the mornings she also prepares breakfasts. Her business has really improved. That's why she wants to formalize it, so that she can offer good service to her customers. 

Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead, and provide her son with schooling  and the comfort of a home. She is going to use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar etc., which are basics for the preparation of the food she sells. 

Semirames is the fourth person standing, and is wearing a cherry-coloured T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a 29-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business, which he has been operating for the last seven years, is motorcycle transport. His challenges are seasonal customers and high fuel prices. His dream is to educate his children and to buy at least three more motorcycles. Francisco needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 42-year-old woman with one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling sugar cane juice, soft drinks and lottery tickets.

For the past eleven years Hoa has run her business to cover her family's daily living expenses and her son's education fees. The business is going smoothly, and she would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy more furniture and many kinds of soft drinks to serve and attract more customers.

Hoa hopes this loan will help her increase her income, improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and a variety of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Lidia de 39 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella radica en un barrio de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Lidia maneja su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado ubicado en un barrio en San Lorenzo, pues ahí ella atiende a sus clientes que a diario le visitan, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de calzado y ropa para señoras ya que estamos en el mes de las madres y es una buena época para el negocio, con el préstamo Doña Lidia pretende mejorar mas sus ingresos y por ende sacar adelante a su familia.
Las expectativas para su negocio es crecer más y con respecto a  su vida es vivir cómodamente y seguir con el negocio del transporte que es otra fuente de ingresos de Doña Lidia tiene.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de calzado y ropa para señoras para su negocio

loans.name: Gie Booku Diome Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Booku Diome regroupe 5 femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont déjà eu à bénéficier d’un crédit à l’IMCEC. Elles ont comme responsable, la dame Awa qui évolue dans la vente d’habillements et de chaussures. On la reconnait sur la photo, celle qui est au milieu portant du noir et blanc. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a démarré avec un capital dérisoire, qu’elle a fructifié petit à petit jusqu’à maintenant. Le crédit lui permettra de diversifier ses produits et services, de mettre un peu d’argent de coté et de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Comme projet futur, elle veut ouvrir une cantine.

loans.use: acheter des habits et des chaussures pour revendre

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Agnès est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Agnès et son mari. Pour cette raison, Agnès vend des noix d’acajou par la méthode de distribution depuis huit ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Agnès s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SEDJRO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix d’acajou.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha and her husband own a metal workshop where they make stands and furniture. She runs the administrative part of the business while her husband is in charge of production. This operation all got started about 8 years ago. At the time, her husband would only make furniture out of wood, but he got a customer that asked him to make a tv stand out of metal. Because he had some experience with metalwork he took the job. Once he finished, he realized that working with metal was much faster and easier than wood and therefore more profitable.

Today they have four employees (3 of them pictured next to Martha) that work with them and get paid by commission. They sell most of their products in their community and also in nearby rural towns. They need the loan in order to invest in paints and raw materials for their operation.

Martha is 28 years old and has 2 small children. Her husband is a hard working family man who has dedicated most of his time and efforts to this microenterprise. They are very proud of their business and hope it will continue to grow with the help of a loan from the international community.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in paints and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Cintia Magaly

texts.en:
"I would like to build a room in the back of my house. I have three children and my mother in-law and sister in-law also live with us, such that our space is very limited. My children sleep on the floor because of this. I am asking for $1000 to add a room to my house."

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

"Me gustaría construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda. Tengo tres niños y vive conmigo mi suegra y una cuñada así es que el espacio es muy reducido. Tengo que acostar a mis hijos en el piso debido a eso. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar mi casa con un cuarto más."

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs. Concepción P. R. is 55 years old, she is a widow a has a 27 year old daughter and 2 sons, one is 24 and the other 13 years old. She shares her home with her younger son and her oldest son’s family. She has her own grocery store at home since 5 years ago, her grocery store’s name is “Lucy” because of her oldest daughter who is now working in Madrid, Spain, because she couldn’t find work in Paraguay. In the store, Concepción sells general products like rice and mandioca, also sells meat, and herbs for the preparation of mate and tereté (two traditional and popular beverages similar to tea), candies, gas, books. Her clients are her neighbors and other people who live near by home. Concepción says the success of her business depends on the diversity of her products, so she acquired her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya two years ago to increase inventory. Concepción goes once a week to the central marker and she also buys from a vehicle that sells products to her home, but they charge for the delivery service. So she is asking a $300 loan that would allow her to buy at wholesale prices and sell in larger quantities and expand her business. Also her daughter will help her build a little house just for the grocery store, because currently the store is place on her living room, this will allow her sell more products and keep on helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Concepción P. R., de 55 años de edad, es viuda con una hija de 27 años y dos hijos, uno de 24 y otro de 13 años. Comparte su casa con su hijo menor y la familia de su hijo mayor. Desde hace cinco años tiene su propia despensa en su casa, a la cual le puso el nombre de “Lucy” por su hija mayor que actualmente se encuentra trabajando en Madrid, España, ya que no pudo encontrar empleo en Paraguay. En la despensa, Concepción vende artículos de primera necesidad como arroz y mandioca, además vende productos como carne, yerba para la preparación de mate y tereré (dos bebidas tradicionales muy populares), caramelos, gas y artículos de librería. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y otras personas que viven cerca de su casa. Concepción comenta que el éxito de su negocio depende de que haya surtido, por lo tanto sacó su primer crédito la Fundación Paraguaya hace dos años para surtir su negocio. Concepción va una vez por semana al mercado central de abasto y el resto del tiempo compra de un carro que le lleva los productos hasta la casa, sin embargo cobran por este servicio. Por lo tanto, está pidiendo un crédito de $300 que le permitirá comprar por mayor ya que de este modo le salen más económicos los productos y este le permite venderlos en mayores cantidades y así expandir su negocio. También dice que su hija le va a ayudar a construir una casita dedicada a la despensa, ya que por el momento la despensa está instalada en donde debería ser la sala esto le permitirá vender productos con más variedad y así seguir proviniendo para sus dependientes.

loans.use: Buy meat, milk, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, sugar, salt.

loans.name: Mohammad Anowar

texts.en: M. Anowar lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters.  He is a shopkeeper, he  sells glasses and plates and some other goods.  He wants to expand his business, therefore he wants to take out an individual loan to improve his shop.  He hopes to make a good monthly income and support his family.  He wants his childen to have a better education.  He is happy that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his store

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old, married with 5 children and she cares for 4 orphans.  She is the very much in control as the owner of the Good Feeding Restaurant and Bar.  She is the woman sitting in the front of the photo and her guests are seated behind her.  

Small restaurants and bars in villages serve a special need for people to escape for a while without leaving their village.  Some food and some drink inside a dark but comforting shack provides that respite.  Often, these places make their own alcohol.  I asked how they make their alcohol and was told they use tea leaves mixed with sugar, pineapple and yeast.  Outside her restaurant, which you enter via a draped doorway, she had a large pot over a charcoal cooker.  Today in the pot were pork and beans.

Florence plans to use her loan to buy more sodas and foodstuffs for her restaurant.  She dreams of one day building her own home.

loans.use: Florence plans to use the loan to buy more sodas and foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat K. is a very cheerful woman. She always smiles a happy smile.She is a kind person and the mother of 3 children. Her business located is in the J.Rasulov food market in Tadjikistan. Hosiyat's husband is a worker on a collective farm and supports her in her activity. 17 years ago he gave her money to start her business. He also helped her to rent a trading  place in the market. She started her business from selling cookies and other confectionery products from local confectionery workshops.Gradually she has increased her working capital and has included several kinds of candy to her assortment .Today Hosiyat has a fast turnover of her goods and she is requesting from KIva lenders extra capital to increase her assortment  of candies before the New Year holiday.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of goods before New Year.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria S. is one of the young active mothers in the programme. She is twenty two years of age from the village of Sologa Mulifanua. She is currently running a Fishing business with the help of her husband who is a good fisherman. This is her first loan and she is planning to use this money to buy a new fishing canoe and some sets of fishing nets for her husband. Her husband goes fishing five days of the week but she only goes to the market two days to decrease her traveling costs. She is a hard working mother and she wants to repay this loan on time so that she can have access to more loans In the future.

loans.use: “Buy a new fishing canoe and some sets of fishing nets for her fishing business.”

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
From a young age, Guadalupe has worked in order to help support the family’s income. Now, at 53 years old, married with three children, she continues to work with the same effort and commitment. When she moved to her current home two years ago, she realised there were numerous factories and manufacturing companies in the vicinity. Furthermore, she learned there was no restaurant nearby. With her creativity, she decided to make breakfasts and mid-morning snacks for the service staff working within the local businesses. Lacking space to serve her customers, she took food to their workplaces. Guadalupe says that there are periods in which her business is not making a profit. And so, a year ago, she decided that, as well as selling food, she would also sell leather handbags and wallets which she makes herself. She did all this with the aim of putting her youngest daughter, 20 years old, through university. Her dream is to finish constructing a room where she can serve her customers and also sell her products (handbags, wallets, pullovers etc).

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde su infancia, Guadalupe esta acostumbrada a trabajar por la necesidad de ayudar en la economía de su familia. Ahora a sus 53 años, ya casada y con tres hijos ella continúa trabajando con las mismas fuerzas y empeño. Cuando se mudo hace doce años a su actual vivienda, ella detectó que había muchas fábricas y empresas manufactureras alrededor de su casa y además, ningún restaurante cerca de ellas. Con su ingenio decidió preparar desayunos y almuerzos para el personal de servicio que trabajaban en ellas. A falta de un espacio donde atender a sus clientes ella lleva la comida al mismo lugar de trabajo de sus clientes. Guadalupe cuenta que hay temporadas en el que su negocio no sale a cuenta. Por ello decidió hace un año que, además de vender comida también vendería carteras y billeteras de cuero hechas por ella misma. Todo ello con el objetivo de ver terminados los estudios universitarios de su menor hija de veinte años. El sueño de ella es terminar de construir una habitación donde poder atender a sus clientes y también vender sus productos (carteras, billeteras, chalecos, etc).

loans.use: To complete construction of an area for her restaurant and shop.

loans.name: Marvin De Jesús

texts.es:
Marvin T. is in the agriculture business. He owns his own farm in the town of Condega where he plants grains and vegetables. He is a very confident man and very dedicated to his work since he works to sustain his household and care for his 4 children.

For the past 3 years, Ceprodel has contributed to the development of his business, offering him credits that he has invested in the purchase of grains and protection products for the crops. Today, this is his major necessity and therefore he has asked Ceprodel again, trusting that he will secure the requested credit to improve his crop.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica del C. Marvin T. es la agricultura, teniendo su propia finca donde siembra sus granos básicos y hortalizas en el municipio de Condega. Es un C. muy esforzado y con mucha dedicación a su labor ya que trabaja fuertemente en este negocio con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así mantener a sus 4 hijos.

Desde hace 3 años Ceprodel ha contribuido al desarrollo de su negocio brindándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de granos y productos de protección para la cosecha. Hoy en día esta es su mayor necesidad y por esto una vez mas acude a Ceprodel confiando que obtendrá el crédito solicitado para lograr aprovechar su cosecha.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en: Ms. Adjo B. is 34 years old, single, and does not have any children.  However, Adjo provides some much-needed help to her siblings by caring and providing for their numerous children.  Adjo owns a salon just outside of the central market in Adèta, a location that attracts the market traffic throughout the week and especially on the weekends.  Like many hairdressers in Togo, she specializes in ‘tresses,’ a popular African hairstyle of braids made with synthetic hair.  With her loan Adjo would like to buy more hair products and tresses to satisfy her customers.  With these purchases she hopes to increase her sales to be able to raise her quality of life and contribute to the expenses of her siblings’ children.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and tresses

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla is a diligent and enterprising mother, she has used her low economic resources to strengthen her business selling articles of clothing like sweaters and an immense variety of ‘polleras,’a festival costume, on mobile stands in the cities of Juliaca and Ayaviri. Thanks to her commitment and dedication she is able to obtain good weekly earnings and profits with which she supports the members of her family. The desire of doña Pabla is to acquire new designs and colors of polleras to accommodate the requests of her customers, who are mostly beautiful ladies who need to showcase their outfits in different festivals and in some cases for daily wear.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Pabla, es una diligente y emprendedora madre, sus bajos recursos económicos la llevan a esforzarse en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir como chompas y también de una inmensa variedad de polleras que son ofertadas en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca y Ayaviri. Gracias a su empeño y dedicación logra obtener semanalmente buenas ganancias y beneficios con los que apoya a los miembros de su familia.El deseo de doña Pabla es adquirir nuevos diseños y colores de polleras con el fin de complacer la solicitudes de sus clientes que en su mayoría son hermosas damas que requieren sus prendas para lucirlas en algunas festividades y en algunos casos para su vestir diario.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a greater variety of festival costumes

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia P., 31, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the pan cake business. She sells to the villagers/public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Faapaia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. to assist in buying equipment used in her pan cake business.

loans.use: flour, vegetable oil, bakery bowder and sugar

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um N. is a fish-paste seller while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. They both live in Kork Phnov Village, Siem Reap Province. She buys fish-paste from villagers in her area and resells it for a profit. They have five children, one of whom is married; the four others are in school.

N. makes about $10 per day while her husband earns about $5 per day driving his motorcycle taxi. Now N. is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to use instead of his old one so as to attract more customers. She can also use it to transport her fish-paste to sell. The loan will allow her to increase her family’s income using the motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem E., 46, runs a family business out of her home with her husband, Hau Te, where they sells pickled radishes. They work together with one of their four children and they typically make US$3 each day. Pickled radishes are considered a delicious treat, but it is a time consuming process to make them. Two of their other children work in the local garment factory and earn US$2 each day to help support the family.

Chhem E. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more radishes for her business. She believes that by increasing her inventory, she can meet the growing customer demand and increase her family’s income. She looks forward to improving her standard of living with any extra profits that the family can make through this investment.

loans.use: Purchase more radishes

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 31 años, es separada, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 3 años.
Se dedica a la venta de DVDs y CDs, lo que realiza en su pequeña bodega, donde también vende dulces y bebidas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace tres años, nos dice que gracias a Dios su trabajo y su hogar esta en el mismo lugar y puede estar al pendiente de las necesidades de sus hijos.Lo que más le agrada es que puede  escuchar las últimas canciones de grupos nuevos y ver las películas que le gusten. Pero lo que a veces perjudica su negocio es que las personas comerciantes al por mayor la engañen, vendiéndole los discos en blanco, por eso es que está aprendiendo hacer muy cautelosa en ello. Luz tiene en sus dos amores, sus hijos, sus mejores motivadores de esfuerzo y trabajo.
Ahora desea adquirir un local propio, donde pueda vender sus películas y CDs obteniendo mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 31; is separated; and lives with her two children, who are 12 and 3.

She makes a living by selling DVDs and CDs, which she does in her small store, where she also sells sweets and drinks. She has done this for 3 years. She tells us that thanks to God, her work and her home are in the same place, and she can still be devoted to her children's needs. What most pleases her is that she can listen to the latest songs from new groups and watch movies that she likes. But at times what harms her business are the wholesale salespeople who deceive her and sell her blank discs. This is why she is learning to be very cautious with them. Luz has in her two loves, her children, her best motivators of strength and hard work. Now she hopes to acquire her own location where she can sell movies and CDs and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase her own location where she will sell CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Sialuga

texts.en: Sialuga N., 45, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in the plantation and vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Sialuga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Sialuga is a very energetic mother who loves to keep herself busy. Her business has grown so much that their whole family is relying on it for their major income.

loans.use: Sialuga would like to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, weedkiller, fungicide, and a backpack sprayer for her farm.

loans.name: Oigul

texts.en: Oigul is a loving mother of 4 children. She has her own business - livestock. She buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them. Besides livestock, she also cooks national bread and sells it at the market. In this way she helps her husband support their family.  She wants to borrow money for buying more cattle and also for buying more hay and forage for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchasing more livestock and supplies

loans.name: Ashurmurod

texts.en:
Ashurmurod is a very hard and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He is married with four children. 

Ashurmurod works in the central city market selling women’s clothing, jeans, jackets, shirts and other clothing items. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for the past five years. Once a month, he travels to the neighboring city to purchase new goods. At the day of our visit, he had gone to purchase new goods in the neighboring city. That’s why his wife is pictured in the photo as she is helping him with his business while he is absent. 

Ashurmurod likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today, Ashurmurod would like to ask for a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) for the loan repayment term of 7 months. He aims to purchase winter clothing from wholesalers and increase his merchandise assortment in his store. We believe Ashurmurod’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Ashurmurod’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items to continue to grow his business

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, dame H. Marguérite est maitresse couturière de formation.  Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle exerce son activité dans une boutique à coté de sa maison. Parallèlement a sa formation elle  vend des boites de conserve et des savons à coté de son atelier. Pour acquerir de nouvelle gammes de  ses produits et quelques fournitures de coutures, elle a fait reccours à notre institution.
texts.en:
Madame Marguérite H. is 36 years old and a trained master seamstress. She is married and the mother of two and works in a shop next to her home. Concurrent to dressmaking, she sells canned food and soap. To acquire a new range of products to sell and some sewing supplies, she has turned to our institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of canned food and soaps

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es casada, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Se dedica al tejido a mano de diferentes prendas de vestir, principalmente de chompas y tapetes para muebles, su sistema de trabajo consiste en tejer durante varias semanas todas las prendas, una vez listas las lleva a su tierra natal llamada Huari que está a 4 horas de viaje desde la ciudad donde actualmente ella radica. Allí hace un trueque de sus prendas con queso, el cual trae a la ciudad y lo vende en el mercado principal. De esta manera Vilma se abastece de los recursos económicos para aportar al sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar y no solamente sentarse a esperar que los ingresos vengan netamente de su esposo, por lo cual, ella se siente muy contenta por ser también la que sustenta su hogar. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha estado trabajando con mucho entusiasmo en su grupo solidario y aprendió el gran valor del ahorro, además es muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para comprar variedad de colores y de calidades de lana, ésta está valorizada en un promedio de 18 soles la bolsa de un kilo, Vilma comprara alrededor de 30 bolsas, que de acuerdo al color y calidad varían su precio.
texts.en:
Vilma is married, and lives in a rented house with her husband and their three children. She hand knits various items of clothing, mainly sweaters and tablecloths for furniture. She generally knits all the items over the course of several weeks, and once they are ready takes them to her home town Huari, which is a 4-hour trip from where she currently resides. There she trades her garments for cheese, which she takes to the city to sell in the main marketplace. In this way Vilma obtains the financial wherewithal to support her home monetarily and is not simply sitting and waiting for the money her husband brings home. She is happy that she is also able to contribute to supporting her household. This is the fifth loan Vilma has received from MFP. All this time she has worked enthusiastically with her solidarity group and has learned the value of saving. She is additionally very prompt in making her loan payments. The money that she has requested is for buying various colors and types of yarn, which on average sells for 18 Peruvian soles per 1-kilogram skein. Vilma will buy approximately 30 skeins, the price of which varies according to the color and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn

loans.name: Phu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phú Thị Huyền năm nay 57 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998, hiện tại chị Huyền đang là chủ một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Chồng chị là bác sỹ thú y đã nghỉ hưu, ngoài thời gian làm công việc tiêm thuốc thú y tại nhà anh cũng giúp đỡ chị rất nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm hàng hóa phục vụ cho  công việc kinh doanh  của gia đình.
texts.en:
Phú Thị Huyền is 57 years old. She has 4 children, all grownup. She is a TYM fund member since 1998. She owns a grocery store. Her husband is a retired veterinary but still runs a pet pharmacy at home. He also helps her out a lot in his free time. Her family income is 2.000.000 VND a month and the living standard has improved. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min T. is 36 years old, and resides in Taho village in Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia. She is single and earns a living by growing and selling flowers at the market. She is responsible for the care of her mother who assists her in the business. Her younger sister and brother are employed to help with family expenses. Her sister is sells cakes and her brother is a motorcycle taxi driver. T. is asking for a $400 loan to replace an old motorcycle that belongs to her brother. (She and her mother are pictured.)

loans.use: Replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma A. O., reside en San Jacinto junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado del lugar, dicho puesto esta ubicado en muy buena zona comercial, ya que logra obtener una venta razonable, debido a que posee varios clientes fieles. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda invertir en el negocio, permitiéndole comprar más ropa y poder agregar otros productos a su negocio, de manera que pueda tener mayores ganancias ofreciéndoles más opciones a sus clientes. Irma desea poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos y es por ello que es conciente de trabajar arduamente por ellos, es de esta manera es que Irma desea mejorar su negocio, para brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma A. O. lives in San Jacinto with her husband and three young children. She has a business in clothing sales in the market of her town. It is located in a good commercial zone and she makes a reasonable amount of sales, due to her loyal clients. Irma is requesting a loan to invest in her business, allowing her to buy more clothing and to add more products to her business, so that she can have greater earnings and offer more options to her clients. Irma wants to be able to offer her three children a better future and this is why she works hard for them. This is how Irma wants to improve her business and offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more material for her business

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Mariama Aliou

texts.fr: Mariama Aliou D. est mariée, 41 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait renforcer son activité qui consiste à la transformation de l’arachide en pâte afin de la vendre. Elle a pour objectif d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Aliou D., 41, is married and the mother of 5 children. With this loan, she would like to bolster her little business which consists in transforming peanuts into peanut butter for sale. Her goal is to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Since 2007, Philomina M. has worked as a petty trader in Elmina selling such goods as rice, oil, canned tomatoes and salt.  She is married with 2 children and has received an education through Senior High School.  While Philomena makes her living as a petty trader, her husband works in the Elmina area as a boat carver.  She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food items for re-sale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a home.

loans.use: purchase additional food items for re-sale

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba D. âgée de 43ans s'active dans le commerce de poissons séchés. Elle habite à Mbour ville côtière où les activités de pêche occupent une place importante dans l’activité économique .Elle achète le poisson transformé pour le revendre  dans le quartier .Elle a démarré son activité avec un premier prêt contracté à l’IMCEC. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de nourrir sa famille de six (6) enfants  mais aussi de payer les frais médicaux de ces derniers .Avec le prêt elle veut profiter de période pou renforcer son stock de marchandises avant la saison morte ou le produit devient rare et chère.
texts.en:
Daba D., age 43, is active in the commerce of dried fish. She lives in Mbour City on the coast, where fishing occupies an important economic place. She buys processed fish to resell in the area. She started her business with an initial loan taken out with IMCEC. The revenues derived from commerce will enable her to feed her family of six children but also to pay for their medical fees. With this loan, she wants to make the best use of this period to bolster her stock of merchandise before the off-season, when goods become short in supply and expensive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Teodocia Felicitas

texts.es:
Teodosia es  socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Teodosia es casada tiene 50 años, dos hijos de 30 y 29 años que  trabajan.
Teodosia puso un taller de tejido, pero no le fue bien tuvo que cerrar y empezó a comprar y vender ropa, ahora ella deja  ropa a los puestos de mercado. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le ayudan a poder invertir y son un respaldo para su negocio.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de pedidos de ropa que le han hecho.
El sueño de Teodosia es poner una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She is married and is 50 years old. She has two children, 30 and 29, who work. Teodosia started a business working with fabrics, but that didn't go well and she had to close it. She then started buying and selling clothes, and now she leaves clothes at the booths at the market. Since she has been working with Kiva partner Finca, the loans she has gotten have helped her invest in and support her business. Teodosia needs a loan of 1600 soles to pay for clothing she has ordered. Teodosia's dream is to operate a soda fountain out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing/inventory purchase

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C., 21, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her two young children. She sells resin and daily makes around US$ 3. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who also makes around US$ 4 each day. The rise of rice prices in Cambodia has made business difficult for Heng C. and she is asking for a loan of US$ 1000. With the loan, she would like to replace their old and unreliable motorbike for her husband as the old one is uses a lot of gas and has had to be fixed many times.

loans.use: To replace an old and unreliable motorbike

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Barrio San Martín II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, ubicada en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Tiene 14 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.Carolina, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Carolina is a client of the Community Bank “Barrio San Martín II”, in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, San Martín. She is married, 48 years old, and has 3 children, two of whom still depend on her. Her fighting spirit and her will to succeed on her own propelled her to start her own business selling Anticuchos (a popular Andean meat dish) from a very well situated location with a lot of traffic. Little by little she became known by her customers, and today she tells us that her business is going very well. Currently, Carolina continues in the same business, selling food every night. She has been working at this business for 14 years, and is very happy with what she does. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, Carolina will purchase ingredients like bags of rice, eggs, and chickens for her juanes (a traditional chicken dish), and also new kitchen utensils to provide quality service and replace the old ones. Carolina is very happy and content, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the achievement of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline S. is a 40-year-old woman who has been raising her 12-year-old twins all by herself after her separation from her husband. She and her children live in Patria, Pandan in the province of Antique. Though their village is far from the market and the main municipality, Emeline never allowed these circumstances to hinder her from earning money. She had been selling a variety of cooked food in her neighborhood, even reaching houses farther away in their village. She is used to walking through the rough and narrow road covered with trees to make sure that when she comes back home, she brings money that the children need for school. Neither rain, the heat of the sun, nor tiredness is an excuse for her to stop her from what she has been doing.

Emeline's family owns a small land that can be used in planting rice. However, this land has not been productive because there was no business capital to start with. The vision of profiting from this kind of business made her join ASHI and take a loan. From then on, her farming business was born and with the help of her family, she tries to maintain it together with her food selling business.

Having her family, her own children, and ASHI, Emeline is secure for she can have her own business, which can enable her to send all of her children to college and give them a better life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to support her food selling business

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai S. (0) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Faleula Fogaa. She is married and has six adult children.

Fenumiai owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 650 WST a month.

Fenumiai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,400 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Fenumiai is now requesting a new loan of 5,150 WST which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena, a 28-year-old woman, is married. She started her own shop business selling Colgate, cooking oil, salt, etc. two years ago. Zuwena works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

Zuwena is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. This is Zuwena's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zuwena hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Mwasham

texts.en:
Mwasham is a member of the Frelimo borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18, 15, 12 years old.

Mwasham has owned a shop business selling commodities  like Colgate,rice, cooking oil, brush for 8 years, she works 14 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Mwasham`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.
