With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mwasham hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en:
Sabuhi has been in the beauty salon business for three years. He plans to improve his business by increasing the number of his clients.  He has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary items to improve his beauty salon. 

Sabuhi lives in the Fuzuli region. He was born in 1982 and is single.

loans.use: to buy the necessary items to improve his beauty salon

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a 57-year-old entrepreneur. Her husband, Miguel, 59, drives for a living. Together with their three children, they live in a populous urban community in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Editha has been a successful distributor of health products, which she obtains from a reputable distribution chain. She is also engaged in direct-selling of cosmetics and apparels. She has been enjoying her business for four years now. Although she sometimes find it difficult to collect debts on earlier purchase orders of her clients, she still enjoys doing her business because she goes everywhere and meets a lot of people. With her business, she earns 18,000 PHP a month.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She is now  applying for a new loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to infuse more capital into her business.  he is also saving most of her profits so she can soon buy her dream car. She wishes to also establish her own outlet for her health products so she won’t need to leave every time. 


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cereals for her business.

loans.name: Rosas De Bautista Group

texts.es:
Confección de sombreros, elaboración de embutidos, trenzado de mantas, producción de calzados, atención de tienda  de barrio, venta de DVD, calzados y elaboración de masitas son los diversos negocios de las integrantes del grupo Rosas de Bautista que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana.

Un claro ejemplo es Julia C. de 39 años, trabaja elaborando masitas hace 7 años aproximadamente en su domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar harina.

Este grupo tiene aproximadamente 10 años de vida y les gusta compartir y llevarse bien entre  todas, así también les gusta asistir a el consultorio.
texts.en:
Making hats, making sausage, braiding blankets, producing footwear, working in a neighborhood store, selling DVDs, selling footwear, and making pastries are the diverse businesses of the members of the Rosas de Bautista Group. This group belongs to the Panamericana community center. A clear examples is Julia C., 39. She has been making pastries in her home for approximately seven years. She needs a loan to buy flour. This group has existed for approximately ten years. They like to share, and they get along well with each other. They also like to help in the office.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buys supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Rose Aoko

texts.en: Rose O., 34, sells clothes in Rangala/Ungunja.  She has been in this business for 7 years and her primary customers are parents who need school uniform for their children, and locals with basic clothes needs. She manages stiff competition and high transportation costs in this line of work. She is using this loan to buy more clothes to sell during the holiday season. Rose dreams of one day owning a dressmaking and tailoring shop. She is married with three children aged 4 to 11 years old, and very much wants to educate them to a higher level. Rose describes herself as selfless and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Loem Hong

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem Hong N. lives in Prey Prum village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns 4-hectare (~10-acre) field of land on which she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Pov Yorn, owns a rice milling machine. This couple has two children who are grocers and help the parents work to earn income. 

Mrs. Loem Hong N. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer, pig food, and to repair the rice milling machine. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband appears with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pig food, and to repair her rice milling machine

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou D. est une femme de 44 ans qui habite a Ndeugagne un des quartiers de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 12 et 26 ans. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Yoff depuis juillet 2009 et n’a jamais sollicite de crédit. Elle est connue dans la vente de Dieumbes, masque, habits d’art, poissons fumes qu’elle exporte a destination de Paris. Elle évolue dans ce secteur depuis 1984.C’est surtout son mari ancien employé d’Air Afrique qui l’a motive a faire ce choix d’activité car il lui offrait périodiquement le billet. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité  ce sont les voyages qu’elle effectue et les bénéfices qu’elle réalise. Elle vend surtout sur commande. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de certains produits commandes et a assurer son argent de poche. Grâce aux profits gagnes elle assure la scolarité de ses enfants.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou D. is a 44-year old woman who lives in Ndeugagne, one of the neighborhoods of Yoff. She is married and has eight children, whose ages range from 12 to 26 years old. She has been a member of the Yoff savings bank - which belongs to the U-IMCEC mutual loan and savings union - since July 2009 and has never taken out a loan. She is known for the sale of "Diembe" drums, masks, handcrafted clothing and smoked fish which she exports to Paris. She has been developing her business in this area since 1984. It is above all her husband, a former employee of Air Africa, who encouraged her to take up this activity because he was able to offer her a ticket from time to time. What interests her most in her business is the trips she makes and the profits she earns. She sells mainly to order. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used for the purchase of certain products she has ordered and to give her some pocket money. Thanks to the profits she makes she can cover the costs of her children's schooling. As part of its ongoing vision to participate actively in the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully providing support to people so that they can carry out lucrative revenue generating activities; this in turn contributes to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ivania tiene un negocio de líneas de ropa la cual distribuye en vario lugares del sector ella tiene dos trabajadores que le colocan la mercadería y a la vez cobran las cuentas pendientes por pagar, el negocio tiene cuatro años de existir pero ella esta encargada desde ya mas de un año ya que antes solamente estudiaba y el negocio lo miraba el papa pero por problemas de salud ella esta a cargo de la administración del mismo. 
El crédito lo ocupara para invertirlo en la compra de mas productos ya que así aumentara su capital de trabajo y a si podrá tener mayores ingresos, ella es soltera y esta estudiando en la universidad con el negocio costea sus estudio y le ayuda a sus padres en el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Ivania has a business selling lines of clothing which she distributes in various places in her sector. She has two workers who place the merchandise and collect pending account payments. The business has existed for 4 years but she has been in charge for over a year. Before, she just studied and her father looked after the business. But due to problems with his health, she has taken charge of administering it. The loan will be used to purchase products that will increase working capital and thus, bring in more income. Ivania is single and is studying in the university. The business helps pay for her studies and helps her parents to sustain the family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE: SHOES, PANTS, BLOUSES, COSMETICS, PERFUMES AND BACKPACKS

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida J., 43, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Gerry J., a carpenter, and they are blessed with 3 children. She helps her husband by earning money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rag making business and has been selling clothing and cosmetics directly for five years now.

Zenaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. As a result of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business by buying the raw materials needed to make rags. A portion will also be invested in her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can enjoy life with her family in good health.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce rags and to invest in her direct selling business

loans.name: Rashelle

texts.en:
Rashelle J. is a business-minded woman. She is 30 years old and the mother of three daughters and one son. She is married to Willie Boy, a 31-year-old fisherman. She lives in Talim, Binangonan in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She belongs to a poor family that needs help to change their standard of living and she is grateful to ASHI for support, even in all the challenges in life.

With her belief and faith in getting out of poverty, Rashelle decided in 2008 to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a chance of having start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loan from ASHI, she carefully invested in her sari-sari store (a small retail store selling different goods). The profit is what she uses for daily expenses.

Now on her fourth loan, Lolita proposes to borrow Php 20,000 to create a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase sacks of rice, vegetables, cooking oil, canned goods, and other supplies for her general store. She is very determined and disciplined in using the money which is lent to her.

Rashelle still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During her almost two years in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase rice, vegetables, cooking oil, canned goods, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
El Sr. Saul tiene 60 años es separado y tiene 2 hijos mayores . 
Saul  tiene una  despensa en su domicilio en la cuidad de San Lorenzo.
 El Sr.  dió inicio a este negocio con su hermana y gracias  a la  buena afluencia de clientes logro ahorrar y construir un pequeño  salón .
El crédito será de ayuda para poder comprar mercaderías en cantidad así abaratar el costo del mismo .
En el futuro desea  ampliar su negocio y así poder cumplir con todos sus clientes  .
texts.en:
Sr. Saul is 60 years old and is separated, with two grown children. Saul has a shop in his home in the city of San Lorenzo. He began this business with his sister, and thanks to the abundance of customers he was able to save and build a little room.

The loan will help him buy merchandise in quantity and thus at lower cost. In the future, he would like to expand his business and thus be able to satisfy all his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, rice, sugar, pasta, herbs, meat, soap

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is part of the Los Diamantes community bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Justina is originally from Vilcabamba, a historic city that served as the last refuge of the Inca Empire. However, Justina has been living in the city of Cuzco for many years. She is 38 years old and lives with her spouse and her 9-year-old child, who is currently enrolled in a local elementary school. 

Justina makes a living selling artisan goods. She sells mostly woven goods but also some metal items, and buys the raw materials from local wholesalers. She sells these artisan goods in the Plaza de Armas, a main tourist hub of the city. Justina makes 180 soles per day on average, around 60 US dollars. 

Justina will use her loan from Kiva to further her artisan business. She is appreciative and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: For materials to make artisan goods

loans.name: Channy Sokh Group

texts.en:
Vat P., Leng K., Chanphall P., Channy S., S. Heng A. and Saei C. all live in Preaek Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. The six members of this lending group are part of AMK’s Loan Workout Program. All clients have outstanding loans that are delinquent and they are currently unable to pay back the full amount of their existing loan. 

Their business ventures, which they funded using their existing loan, have failed, putting them in a very unfortunate position. In addition, less work at garment factories and sickness in their families have drastically reduced other sources of income for each family. All six clients will use their loan to start a new business making T-shirts.

As part of AMK’s workout program, each client is given a workout loan that will be used to purchase sewing machines, an electricity line and additional sewing equipment. AMK has hired a tailor to train the group to make T-shirts. The material will be provided by AMK to ensure that quality material is used and so that the clients do not have to purchase it themselves. 

AMK has partnered with Ahkun.org to sell their T-shirts online. Fifty percent of all profits will go to this group and the other borrowers in their village who are unable to repay their loan.

This program is in contrast to the traditional ways that microfinance institutions deal with delinquent clients:
•	By rescheduling the loan and pushing off the problem to another day
•	Repossessing items that the clients own, including their house or land.

Because of AMK’s strong social mission, AMK has created this program to provide an alternative solution to one of microfinance’s dark sides. We hope that Kiva Lenders will support us in this initiative.

All six clients of this group have had previous loans on Kiva:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/58345
http://www.kiva.org/lend/58347
http://www.kiva.org/lend/62359
http://www.kiva.org/lend/63814
http://www.kiva.org/lend/71201
http://www.kiva.org/lend/51660

loans.use: to start a new business making T-shirts

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Claudia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Claudia se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en horno alquilado. Además Claudia vende ropa en la feria los días domingos.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Claudia son tener horno propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Llamkasum communal bank. Llamkasum means "we make clothing" in Quechua (language of the indigenous people of Peru). Claudia is married, 35 years old, and has 4 children. She uses a rented oven to make traditional breads. In addition, she sells clothes in the street market on Sundays. She needs a loan of 1500 soles ($550). The loan proceeds will be invested in flour. Claudia's dreams are to have her own oven and to give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt:
Alda N. C. nasceu na ciadade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4 filhos de 20, 16, 14 e 10 anos de idade, os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta Mais ninguém.
Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro da Matola rio quando se juntou ao seu marido. Trabalha como auxiliar de limpezas no Instituto Agrário de Boane ha mais de 20 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.060.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez em quanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, portas, aros de portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa e oferecer conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Alda N. C. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 20, 16, 14 and 10 years old. The two younger children attend school. Alda only studied through 4th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. She left the city of Matola for a neighborhood near the Matola river when she was married. She has worked for more than 20 years on the janitorial staff of the Agricultural Institute of Boane. She doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly income of 3060 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some in her bank account. Alda has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is her 3rd loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, zinc plates, doors, door frames and other items) in order to continue with the construction of her home. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to furnish her house and offer her family more comfortable living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates, doors and other items)

loans.name: Bulowooza B Basilika Grace Group

texts.en:
B. Grace is a 50-year-old business woman who is married with 14 children, five of whom are in school. She cares for five siblings who attend school, too. She is running a business of selling clothes, and she has been doing this business for more than 20 years. She is using the loan to purchase clothing, such as Gomes’s, for sale. 

She wishes to develop her business, educate her children and work hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Suzith

texts.en:
Suzith L. is a 30-year-old woman from the city of Manabay Ozamis City. Suzith is married and has 3 school-age children. To earn a living, Suzith owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, the main source of income for the business is primarily derived from selling snacks in the local community. Suzith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Suzith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and in turn to improve her standard of living. Suzith has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Suzith is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 18,000 PHP ($400), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Suzith through GDMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business on account of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly comprised of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Mrs. Phai Y., age 51, makes a living by selling vegetables. She became a vegetable trader in 2000 and sells the vegetables both retail and wholesale. She goes to buy them in bulk at a reasonable price from the rural farmers. She currently earns an average of US$4 a day, and has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 51 years old and is a construction employee who works around the community.

Phai Y. is the mother of four teenage kids, who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses.

Phai Y. faces a big obstacle: her house is cracking since the heavy rainy season started, and the family’s living conditions are often bad. She hopes to resolve this problem by asking for a loan to use towards repairing her old house.

loans.use: To use towards repairing her old house

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Y. is a villager in Thommoda village in Takeo province and she was born in 1969. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Met San, is a government sector who is also get low salary to support his family. Although both of them try to work hard they can earn less income. So to improve production, Mrs. Neang Y. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets, pig food, and rest of the loan she purchases some chicken for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of a child who is studying in school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig food

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora María del Carmen G. es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el Sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por los 4  ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico que fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía, su gente amable y cordial hacen que esta ciudad sea muy bella.
 
La Señora María del Carmen se dedica a la venta de frutas actividad que la realiza recorriendo el mercado de la feria libre, lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 40 años, labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. vende todos los días de la semana.

La socia tiene 53 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales los 3 primeros son casados y vive de manera independiente y sus tres hijos son solteros se dedican a estudiar, con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Es su primer crédito y ha sido invitada por su hija a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan mejorar el bienestar de sus familias, su crédito lo va a invertir en mejorar el techo de su casa y su meta es  llegar a terminar totalmente  su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Carmen G. is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) communal bank. She lives in the Batan sector of the city of Cuenca, a city known for the four rivers that run through it, its historic center which was named a World Heritage Site, its cuisine, and its kind and friendly people which make this city very beautiful. María del Carmen sells fruit, a business which she carries out traveling through the Feria Libre market. She has been working in this business for 40 years; she works from 8 am until 7 pm every day of the week. This group member is 53 years old. She is a single mother and has six children. The first three are married and live on their own, and her three single children attend school. With her work she has managed to build her own house. This is her first loan, and she has been invited by her daughter to be part of this great group of determined women who seek to improve their families' lives. She will invest her loan in improving the roof of her house, and her goal is to totally finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the roof of her house

loans.name: Chirapaq Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Chirapaq (Arco Iris en quechua) son D. L. comunidad D. Sachabamba, Distrito D. Chiara, Departamento D. Ayacucho, L. comunidad se encuentra a una hora y media D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales D. L. zona son L. ganadería y agricultura.
Justo es el auxiliar D. tesorería del Banco Comunal, es socio hace 2 años, Justo es casado tiene 5 hijos, Justo tiene un restaurante en donD. venD. también bebidas, su local esta ubicado en L. plaza principal D. Sachabamba, Justo inicio con L. venta D. loceria, olL., platos en L. feria D. su Distrito, sus productos los adquiere en L. feria D. su Distrito, Justo solicita un prestamo para L. compra D. verduras y abarrotes.
Los sueños D. Justo son mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. sus hijos, brindar una buena educación y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank Chirapaq (“Rainbow” in Quechua) are from the community of Sachabamba in the district of Chiara, department of Ayacucho. The community is an hour away from the city of Ayacucho. The principle activities in the zone are animal husbandry and agriculture. Justo is assistant treasurer of the Communal Bank and has been a member for 2 years. Justo is married and has 5 children. He has a restaurant where he also sells drinks. His business is located in the main plaza of Sachabamba. Justo started out by selling china, pots and dishes in the district fair. He buys his goods in the district fair. Justo is seeking a loan to buy vegetables and groceries. Justo’s dreams are to improve the quality of life of his children, give them a good education and have his own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food and groceries

loans.name: Puriza

texts.en: To make a living, Puriza L. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Cabaruan. Puriza has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Puriza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Puriza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Puriza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janessa

texts.en: Janessa P.'s main source of income comes from selling vegetables in her community. She is 21 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. Janessa has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Janessa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Janessa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Janessa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Shaloobu

texts.en:
Shaloobu I. is 57 years old, married, and has five grown children. Her four daughters live on their own. Her son, in keeping with Kyrgyz tradition, lives with her and helps in the family household. Shaloobu is well educated and works as a geography teacher in the school in Kenesh village. She is known for her strong commitment to education. 

Unfortunately, teacher salaries in rural areas are very low. For this reason, in 1990, Shaloobu began to breed farm animals using starting capital of 10,000 KGS. She also began to grow potatoes and clover on her farm. Her ongoing efforts to develop the farm led Shaloobu to obtain her first loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays. Now Shaloobu plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy eleven sheep, three bull calves, and two colts. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to pay for her son's wedding. In the future, Shaloobu wants to increase the number of cattle on her farm. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase sheep, cattle, and horses

loans.name: Dominga Francisca

texts.es:
La  Sra. Dominga tiene 16 años de laborar como auxiliar de enfermería en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución comprando materiales indispensable para reparar  su vivienda 
Esto le permitirá al cliente ofrecerle a su familia una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dominga has worked for 16 years as a nurse's helper for the local MINSA (Ministry of Health) office.

She has her own home which she plans to improve with the financing she receives through the institution.  She will buy the materials needed to repair the house.  This will allow her to offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Briceida Andreina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Briceida, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una hermosa bebe de 9 meses de nacida. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 recorre con sus productos, los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra en dos pagos cada quince días, o por pagos semanales, de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes, nos cuenta que en estos últimos meses no ha podido salir con mucha frecuencia por que su bebe  esta pequeña pero igual sus clientes la visitaban en su casa. Además de esto su esposo tiene una tienda de víveres donde ella también vende su mercadería. Compra en Guayaquil por que allá es más barata.
 
Este crédito es justamente para ir a Guayaquil a comprar sus productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para sacar su negocio adelante. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Briceida is 22 years old, married, and has a beautiful nine month old baby. Her husband is a merchant. She sells all types of clothing door-to-door. Briceida works every day starting at 8:30am by traveling with her products. She extends credit and collects two payments either on a biweekly or weekly schedule based on the needs of her customers. In recent months, Briceida has not been able to go out as much because of her small baby so her customers have been coming to her house. Her husband also has a grocery store where she can also sell her merchandise. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it is cheaper.

This loan will be used to buy products in Guayaquil. Briceida has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys having the opportunity to move forward with her business. Her dream is to have her own home since she lives at the house of her in-laws.

loans.use: Purchase all types of clothing

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Tith R., 34, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Cambodian province of Kampong Cham, an area known for rubber plantations. R. and her husband sell groceries, earning an income of about 4.16 USD per day. R. has to spend 50 USD on food, 3 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Marifer Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MARIFER, lo tomaron porque les gusta ese nombre. Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Cristobal Huichochitlan, en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Felicitas M. es una integrantes del grupo. Tiene 33 años, estudió unicamente la  primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos; 1 mujer  y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse de fruta y verduras para poder poner un puesto en el tianguis. Sus clientes se expresan bien de la señora ya que les muy amable y tiene lo que sus clientas le solicitan.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta e ilusionada ya que podrá crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.   Quiere este crédito para poder darse a conocer en otras comunidades pero necesita tener gran cantidad de surtido para poder realizar las ventas fuera de su comunidad, en el tianguis.   También espera poder seguirle dando estudio a sus hijos ya que son los que la motivan a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called MARIFER.  They chose the name because it is one they like.  The group is located in San Cristobal Huichochitlan community in the State of Mexico and has 9 members.  One of these members is Felicitas M..  She is 33 years old and has only an elementary-level education.  She is a saleswoman and has 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys.

Felicitas sells fruit and vegetables, a business which she started 5 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to stock her business with fruit and vegetables so that she can set up a stall in the open-air market.  Her customers speak well of her because she is very kind and has everything that her they ask for.

As she requests this loan, Felicitas feels very happy and enthusiastic as she will be able to grow her business and increase her sales.  She would like this loan so that she can become known in other communities but she needs to have a large quantity of goods in stock if she wants to sell outside her own community in the open-air market.  She would also like to continue providing her children with an education as they are her motivation to continue working.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and set up a stall in the open-air market

loans.name: Guido Daniel

texts.es: Guido Daniel S. C. es un hombre de 46 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 8 y 12 años. Allí tiene un negocio llamado “Bobinas Guido” dedicado a la producción de Bobinas que vende en el centro de Barranquilla, Ciénaga y Fundación, otros municipios costeros; también ofrece el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de  abanicos  en su propio barrio y vende sus repuestos. Guido inició su negocio  en el año 1990 por la necesidad de buscar ingresos para sostener su familia, y lo ha logrado, pero siempre con la intención y la decisión de crecer y sostenerse en el mercado. Los activos fijos vinculados a la microempresa son sus  cajas de herramientas y una mesa. Su negocio ha sido exitoso por su  servicio calificado, porque ha logrado construir una buena clientela tanto en su comunidad como en el centro de Barranquilla y en los municipios de Ciénaga y Fundación; sus  ventas promedias  son  $3.170.000 COP y genera utilidades del 23 % Desde hace tres años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha recibido 3 financiamientos que ha aplicado efectivamente a su negocio, razón por la cual ha crecido y sus utilidades se han incrementado,  logrando adquirir su vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos, con quienes sueña verlos educarse con calidad y  prosperar  en el futuro, por eso dedicará todos sus esfuerzos a perfeccionar su negocio, adecuándolo en una habitación principal donde se exhiba como un gran taller. Con su credikiva, cuarto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará: alambre de cobre, carretes, alambre desoldadura repuestos de abanicos,preparandose para el fin de año momento en que hay mucho dinero circulante y su venta se incrementa.
texts.en:
Guido Daniel S. C. is a 46 year old man who lives in the municipality of Soledad, with his spouse and their two children, who are 8 and 12 years old. There he has a business called "Bobinas Guido", (Guido's Coils) where he produces coils that he sells in the center of Barranquilla, Ciénaga, Fundación, and other coastal towns. He also offers maintenance and repair services for fans in his own neighborhood, and sells spare parts for them.

Guido started his business in the year 1990 due to the need to search for income to support his family, which he has attained, always with the intention and the decision to grow and support himself in the market. The fixed assets linked to his micro-business are his tool boxes and a table. His business has been successful due to his skilled service, and he has been able to build a good customer base not only in his community, but also in the center of Barranquilla and the towns of Ciénaga and Fundación.

His average sales are 3,170,000 Colombian pesos, and he generates profits of 23%. For three years he has been linked to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization which has given him three loans which he has applied specifically to his business, which has been the reason it has grown and his profits have increased. This has allowed his to buy his home and pay for the education of his children. He dreams to give them a high-quality education so that they can prosper in the future. For this reason, he will dedicate all of his efforts to improve his business, adapting it to a main room where he displays a grand workshop.

With this "credikiva" (Kiva loan), his fourth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he will buy: copper wire, coils, soldering wires, spare parts for fans, preparing himself for the end of the year when there is a lot of money in circulation and his sales increase.

loans.use: copper wire, coils, soldering wire, spare parts for fans, and preparing himself for year-end when there is a lot of money in circulation and his sales increase.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 5, 7 Group

texts.en:
Leonel is the coordinator of his group, Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo 5 & 7  (Christ and Our Effort). He makes his home in a simple structure with his four children. He says that his most difficult challenge is raising his children without their mother. While he continues to do so, he intends to carry on attending church.

Leonel is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza, having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He has had his business for ten years. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying shoes by the dozen in different sizes, colors and for varying types of clients. He will use the profits to invest in his business, while saving part of it to eventually build a house, buy a vehicle and pay for his children's studies. 

Leonel's story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia, reside en Nueva Guadalupe departamento de San Miguel, tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa de forma ambulante, la familia de Ana Lucia está conformada por su madre, hermanos, dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 6 años, es madre soltera.
Ella inicia este negocio hace 7 años, trabajando de lunes a sábado, hasta el momento su negocio es estable y no ha tenido dificultades para comercializar sus prendas de vestir, pero para mantenerse siempre debe seguir fortaleciendo el negocio, y es con esta intención que solicita  un préstamo para comprar jeans, blusas, camisas, pantalones, short, y ropa interior, con esta inversión espera agradar a los clientes y llamar su atención para que puedan comprarle y generarle ganancias.
Ana Lucia está motivada a seguir trabajando para fortalecer cada día el negocio y proveer para sus hijos lo necesario y que estudien para superar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia lives in Nueva Guadalupe, part of the department of San Miguel. She is 30 years old and works selling clothing by foot. Ana Lucia’s family is comprised of her mother, siblings, and two children who are 3 and 6 years old. She is a single mother.

She started this business seven years ago, working Monday to Saturday. So far, her business has been stable and she hasn’t had any difficulties selling her clothing items. However, she must always continue strengthening her business in order to support herself and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts and underwear. With this loan, she hopes to please her clients and attract their attention so that they can buy from her and generate income for her.

Ana Lucia is motivated to continue working to strengthen her business every day, to provide her children with what they need, and for them to study to succeed in life.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, and underwear

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth M., 37, lives in Monterico, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, where she and her husband, a farmer, have three children. In order to help her husband while at home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. She also buys and sells goods such as root crops, vegetables and anything else just to earn a living.

Elizabeth became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This co-op teaches women how to develop their own businesses to support their spouses’ incomes. She has thus far been able to obtain a loan and now is requesting 5,000 PHP to buy feed and piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavours.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
July is the leader of the Community Bank named “Soleil Plus” which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

July is 57, married, and has been part of the micro-enterprise world for many years. He operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. 

He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $180 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. July is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having eight times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of sugar, and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. July has six children aged between 12 and 26 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a bakery and buying and selling dried fish. Her husband Narsiso is 59 years old. They have five children who are 25 to 33 years old. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,000 as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future family and business needs. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu  T. N. is 43 years old with three children who are at high school.  

Being a farmer, she grows rice and vegetables and raises pigs for meat. Her business is developed and creates a stable income that helps her to cover her living expenses. 

When she received loans from 2007 to 2010, she invested in developing her farming. Based on this, she not only covers all expenses but also has a savings account. 

This year, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to improve her house.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Robert William

texts.es: Robert tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive con su madre en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace tres anos, Robert se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino. Guarda sus animales en unos corrales ubicados en la casa de un familiar. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente, para generar ingresos adicionales, brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Actualmente, sus corrales se encuentran en un estado deteriorado a causa de las lluvias. Desea arreglar y mantenerlos para proteger a sus animales y también brindar una presentación más profesional para los compradores. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, Robert puede seguir ayudando a su madre con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Robert is 20 years old and single with no children. He lives with his mother in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. For three years, Robert has raised pigs. He keeps his animals in corrals located at a relative's house. When they reach a good stage of development he offers them for sale to business people that usually visit the area where he lives. In addition, to generate additional income, he offers passenger transportation services in his mototaxi, a vehicle that comprises a motorcycle and a cab to transport people inside it. Currently, his corrals are in a state of deterioration due to the rains. He wishes to fix and maintain them to protect his animals and also to provide a more professional presentation for the buyers. To do this, he thought it advisable to request a loan of 1000 nuevo sols from Edpyme Alternative. With his income, Robert can continue helping his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his corrals

loans.name: Zena

texts.en: Zena M. is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Zena operates a food vending business, selling as wholesale and from home to her neighbors. The business has enabled her educate her children and improve their standard of living. Zena faces the challenges of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a café in the future. Zena is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase timber and iron sheets to build a food vending stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to raise her business standards.

loans.use: To purchase timber and iron sheets to build a food vending stall

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El cliente vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, empezó a trabajar a muy temprana edad junto a su padre, como peón en la tierra de su padre en el departamento de sucre. 
Gumersindo se independizo a muy temprana edad, ya que su padre ya no podía mantenerlo, porque eran varios hermanos y tuvo que emigrar al trópico de Cochabamba, cuando llego trabajo como peón y posteriormente fue ahorrando y se dedicó al comercio de ropa, y actualmente vende en las diferentes ferias del trópico.
El crédito que solicita es para ampliar su negocio de venta de ropa, más específicamente para comprar más ropa, Gumersindo necesita un impulso, para poder ampliar y mejorar  su negocio, que ha sido su sueño de toda su vida, también tiene un deseo de comprar una casa,  Ahora con el crédito seguirá creciendo y podrá comprar algún día su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
This client lives in Entre Ríos in the Tropics of Cochabamba.  He began working as a field hand on his father’s land in the Sucre department when he was very young.  Gumersindo went out on his own when he was young because his father was no longer able to support him.  He had many brothers, so he had to immigrate to the Tropics of Cochabamba.  When he first arrived, he worked as a field hand.  He saved his money and later began selling clothing.  Now he sells in various fairs around the area.

He is asking for this loan so that he can expand his clothing business, specifically to buy more clothing.  He needs some backing so that he can expand and improve his business, which he has dreamed of all his life.  He also wants to buy a house.  This loan will allow him to continue growing and someday be able to buy his own house.

loans.use: to expand his clothing business

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en: Ofelia is 55 years of age with three children and married to a company driver. Her group has six members. The group works hard to improve their way of living. Ofelia is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional feed for her hogs. She earns PHP 4,000 every three months in her hog-raising business. The members hope that Kiva lenders will continue to give them financial assistance for the development of their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo has been in the hog-raising business for 5 years. He has a backyard piggery where he raises pigs for fattening. Reynaldo sells his pigs at his town's local market. He also works as a palm oil harvester in his town. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

Reynaldo works hard for his family, which includes his wife and 4 children. His oldest child is 20 years old. He hopes to succeed in sending his children to school and providing them with better living conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca Nubia Cortez Céspedes siempre se ha considerado una guerrera, pues debido a su falta de oportunidades laborales, se vio en la necesidad de crear su propio negocio, una tienda en la que le ofrece a sus clientes gran variedad de productos, ubicada en su vecindario en un barrio de Itagüí. 

Llegar a tener otro almacén que ofrezca productos de ferretería y lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia es el sueño de esta emprendedora y para lograrlo día a día trabaja largas jornadas, desde las 11:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, pero para ella este no es un sacrificio sino la manera de alcanzar sus sueños y de superarse. Sin embargo, se siente privilegiada por no tener que cumplir un horario de trabajo, ni un jefe a quien rendirle cuenta ya que ella puede disponer de su tiempo según las circunstancias que se le presenten en el camino

Debido a su gran vocación emprendedora, y sus ganas de que su negocio crezca, Blanca solicita un préstamo que brinde la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y que su microempresa cada vez sea mas reconocida tanto en la vecindad como en la ciudad en general.
texts.en:
Blanca Nubia Cortez Céspedes has always been considered to be a fighter.  Due to the lack of job opportunities, she saw the need to create her own business, a store in which she offers her customers a large variety of products located in her neighborhood in Itagui.

The dream of this enterprising woman is to become the owner of a small hardware store, so that she can improve the quality of life for her family.  To do this she works long hours each day, from 11am until 8pm, but for her this is not a sacrifice, but rather a means of achieving her dreams and becoming successful.  However, she feels privileged in that she does not have a set job schedule or have to account to a boss, so that she can use all of her time to take advantage of the circumstances that present themselves along the way.  Because of her great entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to make her business grow, Blanca requests a loan that will provide her with the opportunity to increase her income and make her business better known, both in her neighborhood and in the city in general.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Ayawa Alice

texts.fr: Mère de03 enfants, Ayawa est revendeuse de plastiques et perles depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne d’habitude au marché de Lomé et revend au marché de HEDZRANAWOE.  Elle a 50ans et son conjoint est topographe. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité.
texts.en: A mother of three children, Ayawa has been a retailer of plastic ware and beads since 2004. She usually gets her supplies at the Lomé market and re-sells at the HEDZRANAWOE market.  She is 50 years old, and her husband is a topographer. This loan will be used to bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware and beads

loans.name: Ifede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFEDE est composé de neuf personnes qui sont issues de la même famille.  C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Olga Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Olga Rose est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un fermier du nom de Samson. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus des enfants, Olga Rose a deux autres enfants à charge. Olga Rose assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Olga Rose mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, etc.) et de façon secondaire la vente d’œufs frais à son domicile. Olga Rose s’approvisionne au Bénin. Olga Rose exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Olga Rose sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFEDE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The Ifede group is made up of nine people from the same family. This is the second time that the group has asked for financial help from Alidé, in order to increase their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Olga Rose, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Olga Rose is 39 years old and married to a farmer by the name of Samson. The couple has three children who are all at school. In addition to her own children, Olga Rose has two other children in her care. She provides for the various family expenses together with her husband. In order to cover these expenses, Olga Rose has a business selling various food products (corn, etc.) and as a secondary activity she sells fresh eggs from home. She gets her supplies in Benin. She has been carrying out this business for the past twenty years. With a view to providing customer satisfaction and increasing her turnover and profit, Olga Rose is requesting a second loan together with the other members of the Ifede group.

loans.use: to buy corn and trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a tricycle driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susana operates a mobile store. Her mobile store is basically a small homewares store which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. Her husband drives the mobile store within the local community to sell the products. Susana gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her regular customers are locals. She earns a minimum of Php 1120 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susana hopes to be able to expand soon and to be a successful business woman. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 28 años convive con Vilma de 26 años, con quien tiene una hermosa hija. Viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Durante su adolescencia Walter, se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, ayudando a sus padres en tiempos de cosecha, pero pensó aquello que sus padres le enseñaron, iba a tener continuidad. Por ello que no se arrepiente de nada y se siente feliz debido a que le va muy bien con el trabajo que realiza. En tiempos de cultivo, necesita de trabajadores para que agilicen de manera rápida y oportuna. Su producto lo vende en los Centros de Acopio de Sivia a un precio razonable. Su plan a futuro es comprar terrenos para que siga incursionando en esta misma actividad, y asi darle mayores satisfacciones a su querida familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el esta comprometido en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Walter es nuevo en su banco comunal por lo que esta agradecido por formar parte de ello. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una parcela de terreno.
texts.en:
Walter is 28 years old and lives with Vilma who is 26 years old. Together they have a beautiful daughter. They live in their own house in the district of Sivia. When he was a teenager, Walter worked in agriculture, helping his parents during harvest time because he knew that what they taught him would be useful in the future. He does not regret anything and is very happy because this type of work has gone very well for him. 

When he plants his crops, he needs workers to expedite the process. He sells his products at a reasonable price at the markets of Acopio de Sivia. His plan for the future is to buy land in order to expand his work and to be able to take better care of his beloved family. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is committed to paying it back on time. He is a new member of the community bank and is very grateful to be a part of it. With the $550 he is requesting he will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married lady. She runs a restaurant in which she sells soup and meat in Mombasa. She has been running it for two years now. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge she has is that there are other people in the area running the same kind of business as hers, so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled for choice. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more meat to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to open a big hotel in the future. She describes herself as a very hardworking and honest lady.

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается торговлей канцелярских товаров. Год как она занимается этим видом бизнеса. Кредит берет для покупки общих тетрадей, школьных рюкзаков и книг.
texts.en: Nigora lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 23 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  Nigora is involved in sales of office supplies.  She has been in this business for one year.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of general-purpose notebooks, school backpacks and books.

loans.use: to purchase general-purpose notebooks, school backpacks and books for first-grade students

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un aide comptable. Elle a 02 enfants
Akouvi travaille comme commerçante de plastiques et laitues depuis 2004. Elle vend à ses clients de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Akouvi a requis son  second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des plastiques et des plastiques.
texts.en:
Akouvi, age 27, is married to an assistant accountant and has two children. Since 2004, she's been working as a reseller of plasticware and lettuces. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and resells them as a traveling saleswoman.

Akouvi is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy plasticware and lettuces.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and plasticware

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y solidarias las unas con las otras se unieron para formar el comité llamado San Ramón, mediante el cual desean poder generar mayores ingresos para sus familias y de esa forma poder ser muy útiles y sacar a delante a todos los que dependen de ellas. Se definen como muy sacrificadas, pues la mayoría de ellas trabajan muy duro en actividades que requieren de mucha fuerza física.
Una de las miembros es la señora Clara, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Comenta que este es su medio de subsistencia, ya que gracias a esto es logra mantener su casa y a su familia. Dice que tiene muchos clientes y pedidos siempre, además de eso tiene una clientela bien formada pues hace un tiempo ya que se dedica a esto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para la posterior venta, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
Ten women who work hard, struggle and are supportive of one another got together to form the communal bank called San Ramón.  Through the bank they want to generate more income for their families and help those who are dependent on them to get ahead.  They consider themselves to be self-sacrificing since most of them work in activies requiring a lot of physical strength.

One of the members is Mrs. Clara who sells all kinds of clothing.  This is her only source of income and it has helped her maintain her household and family.  She claims to have many customers and orders, and her customer base is long standing because of the years she has been in business.

She is requesting a loan to buy all types of clothing to sell.  She has many orders and wants to fill them all.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 51 years old and widowed with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and selling medicine.

Josefa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is widowed with two children. Lida is 61 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Lida sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase bananas and vegetables.

Lida has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Yolanda Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 13  y 11 años de edad,  los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comediante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de ciertos útiles escolares, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados.  Este negocio le ha dado para ganar el sustento diario sin tener que descuidar su hogar y sus hijos, tiene diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, útiles escolares y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Damas al Poder” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Yolanda, 33, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 14, 13 and 11 years old.  The older ones go to secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like: rice, sugar, oil, detergent and also some school supplies.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her work when they aren’t busy.  This business has provided for their daily sustenance while not neglecting her home and children.  She’s been in business for ten years and she does very well.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats, school supplies and other staple goods.  She’s been in the communal bank for four years and likes it because she’s made many friendships in the group.  Her goal is to stay in business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 25 year old business man, who is single.  He is a crop farmer and a motorbike transport driver to generate extra income.

Farming has been his business for the past ten years and his monthly income is about KES 10,000.  This helps him cover the cost of his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Andrew will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.  

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will service his motorbike.  His hopes and dreams are to focus on building his transportion business to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 year old a married woman with four children between the age of 19 and 8. All of them are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk south Sudan for a year.

Mary requested this loan through Brac South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income that she will generate to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Crizalde

texts.en:
Crizalde is 32 years of age. He is married to Juanita and blessed with two children. He decided to get involved in farming in order to improve their standards of living. He works hard to give his children a good quality of life and lift them out of poverty.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase corn seed, fetilizer and pesticides for his corn farm. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticides for his corn farm.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Francisca has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Francisca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ama Enyonam

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a 1 enfant.
Ama travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des ustensiles de ménage et des produits de beauté pour tous au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Ama a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ustensiles de ménage et des produits de beauté. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama is 38 years old, married to a mechanic and the mother of one child. She has been working as a retailer since 2007. She sells household utensils and beauty products for men and women at the market. She gets the supplies for her one-woman business in Lomé and is not currently experiencing any difficulties.

Ama is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she can invest in her business and restock on household items and beauty products for resale. In the coming years, she would like to open a shop. She will use the profits from her business to take care of her family.

loans.use: to restock on household utensils and beauty products.

loans.name: María Angelina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Futuro de Vida, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una gran riqueza cultural, natural y arquitectónica, esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 27, 21, 18, 16, y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y estudia, su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su cuarto hijo trabaja solo para sus gastos personales y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de aluminio y vidrio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. María hace 10 años se dedica al negocio de venta de joyas de golfild, su mercadería lo vende recorriendo la ciudad y labora 5 días de la semana sin un horario fijo.
 
Es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de joyas para crecer en este negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank “The Future of Life.” She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city which is culturally, naturally, and architecturally rich. It is surrounded by four rivers, which give it the name “Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.” Its people maintain the culture and tradition of its villages.

María is 53 years old and married, and from her conjugal union has produced five children, ages 27, 21, 18, 16, and 10. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second son works and studies. Her third daughter studies in a high school in the city, and her fourth son works on his own for his personal expenses. Her youngest son is in an elementary school in the city. Her husband works in an aluminum and glass shop. They do not have their own house, which is why they are renting. 

For ten years, María has sold Goldfield jewelry. She walks around the city selling her merchandise, and she works five days a week without a fixed schedule. 

This is her third loan with the communal bank, and she will put the loan towards the purchase of jewelry so that she can expand this business. 

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат занимается торговлей женской одежды. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается четыре года. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает таксистом. Мамлакат берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en: Mamlakat sells clothes for women.  She has been involved in this type of business for four years.  She is 45 years old and married.  She has four children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Mamlakat has requested a loan to increase her range of merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her range of merchandise

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Sareth, 33, is a married mother of two children. For the last seven years, she and her husband have been cultivating rice on 6.5 hectares of farmland to make a living in the area.
