Sareth has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already, and she completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to improve her living. After the loans from VisionFund, she feels empowered and confident to make her living. 

Now applying for a loan of KHR 3,000,000, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business by producing more rice, and to earn more income so as to build some savings to fulfill her dream of building a new house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Pafa Group

texts.fr:
Takku Liggey Pafa regroupe cinq femmes qui logent dans le même village et qui se sont associer en groupe de crédit pour bénéficier de financement. Leur activité consiste en l’agriculture. Elles sont toute mariées et puisse que, vivant dans un village, la culture est la principale source de revenus. Elles sont aux champs le matin et l’après midi, elles vaquent à leurs occupations domestiques. Madame Amy, qui se trouve être au milieu de la photo, habillée en rouge-blanc est la responsable du groupe. Avec le crédit, elle envisage d’acheter de l’engrais et des semences pour cultiver son champ. 
 Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la maison.
En plus de son activité, elle désirerait faire de l’élevage car elle a de l’espace.

loans.use: acheter de l'engrais et des semences pour préparer la campagne agricole

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther came from the Dominican Republic 10 years ago. She had studied Skincare back at home and she owned her own business back there. She decided to come to the United States because it was apparent to her that she would find better opportunities to build her business. With a lot of effort Esther opened her Esthetic Salon and she has been helping clients with their skin issues ever since. The $7350.01 that were provided to her will be used to purchase new equipment that will help her expand her services and expand her client base.
texts.en:
Esther came from the Dominican Republic 10 years ago. She had studied Skincare back home and she owned her own business back there. She decided to come to the United States because it was apparent to her that she would find better opportunities to build her business. 

With a lot of effort Esther opened her Esthetics Salon and she has been helping clients with their skin issues ever since. The $7000 that were provided to her will be used to purchase new equipment that will help her expand her services and expand her client base.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to expand her business.

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.en:
Sakhavat has a small store where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly and hard working person. He has had his businessfor 13 years ago and it allows him to support to his family.He is 39 years old. Sakhavat is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar. He and his 3 children sttled in the Khirdalan town. He borrowed $500 from Komak Credit Union and spent this loan amount to buy the spare parts .
He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy the spare parts and to expand his business area.. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Cassa

texts.en:
Cassa lives in the Mtambani area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Cassa is in a food vending business. She has four years in this business.

She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes and a stock of cold drinks. Sometimes she loses some customers due to inadequate equipment. She is also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically. To facilitate her plan, Cassa needs USD400.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This business owner has a small shop inside Kirkuk market to sell women's clothing. His son works with him in the same shop. He is applying for a loan of $1200 from AL-Aman to purchase more goods for his shop. He has a big family to support: four children and his mother. He works hard to increase his income and improve his family's life.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Maria Florinda

texts.en:
Maria Florinda C. is 29 and earns most of her living by buying and selling vegetables in the market. She'll buy at one market and then sell at another, making perhaps US$7 to $13 per day and taking home half of that after travel  expenses and food and the like. With this loan Maria is branching out and buying a calf, hoping that the sale of the calf later will increase her income. She'll buy the calf for about US$200 and hope to sell it later for between US$300 and $400. Maria has three school-aged children, and all are in school. She herself had no schooling at all and cannot read or write. She dreams someday of buying the plot of land  by their house, which would cost about US$7000. Maria's village is nestled right against the side of the Santa Maria volcano, part of a complex of volcanoes that regularly rumbles the area and that completely destroyed the village in the early 20th century. It's a place of beautiful green hillsides and lush plots of corn and vegetables, all divided into little sections called cuerdas. The poorer women often rent just one cuerda and try to grow their own corn for the family and sell some vegetables from it. Those who have more sometimes own two or more cuerdas, and sometimes rent even more. It's hard work, and they always refer to their life as a "battle" or "struggle", but they continue with the battle to feed their families and keep the kids in school.
Writtten by Randy Fay and Nancy Lewis, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase and raise a calf for sale

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Khachmaz. He rents a booth in a local market, where he sells hardware and other items he makes out of sheet metal. He also produces items for clients who place special orders with him. He makes these items in a small workshop in his house, where he has run his business for the last 15 years. He would like to expand this business, and has applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro Khachmaz to the buy tools and sheet metal he needs to make that happen.

loans.use: To buy tools and sheet metal

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en: Solinuu is 31 years old, married and has three children. She is very talented at making and producing handicrafts, especially Samoan designs for items such as earrings, rings, necklaces and hats. She has been in this business for five years, but faces a serious problem: to expand her business, and her income, she needs to buy expensive tools, such as drill, that she simply cannot afford. She has applied for a loan of $300 to buy these tools, which will allow her to provide a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy tools for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Bickencha

texts.en: Bickencha T. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004.  She has recommended herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. She engages in  commercial services and trade. She has a business in child wear and shoe selling. Besides this she has a business in head-dress selling. She has been in business for 15 years.  Bickencha T. works in the Kistakuz bazaar where her shop is located. She has a wide assortment. Now she requests a loan  for  business support and to increase her head-dress business.

loans.use: For business support and to increase her head-dress buisiness

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is in her early forties, and she lives with her husband and four of their children. The other five boys are grown up and have their own families.

Paula sells women’s clothing. She operates her store within her house. The entrepreneur says that her business supports the children’s studies. She hopes her business success can help her keep supporting her family. With her loan, Victoria will buy more clothing in bulk to supply her store.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to replenish her little store

loans.name: Gladyz

texts.es:
Gladys sells prepared meals, especially ceviche and seafood. Seven years ago, she started selling in the streets in a moving cart. As she acquired more clients and bigger earnings, she decided to rent a stand in the market and see what happened. Fortunately, thanks to her efforts, she has been doing very well in her small restaurant.

She states that she would not have thought of opening this business if it weren’t for some of her colleagues who she saw do well in similar businesses. Currently, she does not regret deciding to start from the bottom because she is certain that everything is possible with hard work. Her dream is to have a large restaurant, but for now she wants to expand her food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys se dedica a la venta de comida, especialmente Ceviche y mariscos. Hace siete años ella empezó con un puesto ambulante vendiendo en la calle, a medida que iba teniendo más clientes y más ganancias, ella optó por alquilar un puesto en el mercado y ver qué sucedía. Felizmente, gracias a su empeño, le ha ido bien en su pequeño restaurante.

Ella afirma que no se le hubiera ocurrido abrir este negocio de no ser porque veía que a algunas compañeras suyas les iba bien en negocios similares. En la actualidad, ella no se arrepiente de haberse decidido a empezar de abajo porque tienen la certeza de que con las ganas de trabajar todo se puede realizar. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande, por ahora quiere ampliar su puesto.

loans.use: Expand her food stand.

loans.name: I Gusti Ayu Kurniati

texts.id:
I Gusti Ayu Putu Kurniati and her husband have a two year old boy named I Gusti Aria Oka. This young couple is very hard working. I Gusti Ayu Putu Kurniati's husband works as a security guard for a private company. As soon as Gusti Kurniati heard about the opportunity to receive a business loan to grow her pig farming business, she applied for a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah. In her business she has raised 10 fattened pigs. 2,500,000 Rupiah of the loan would be used to purchase a boar. The pig pen she uses is not permanent. It is made of bamboo with a roof made of palm leaves. and is not a good place to raise young pigs. Every day Gusti Kurniati is very busy with all of the work involved in raising her pigs from cleaning their pen to bringing them food. She says the target age for fattening and selling her pigs is four months. She estimates that it costs her 5,000,000 Rupiah to feed and care for a pig until it is 4 months old and ready to sell. Unfortunately, the cost of pig feed has gone up. She makes approximately 10,000,000 selling a pig and after paying for a boar and the pig feed she has about 2,500,000 every 4 months. From this money she plans to build a permanent pig pen.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

I Gusti Ayu Putu Kurniati dan suaminya baru memiliki 1 orang anak laki-laki yang diberi nama I Gusti Aria Oka umur 2 tahun. Pasangan muda yang baru membina sebuah keluarga ini bisa dibilang pekerja yang ulet. Suaminya bekerja sebagai satpam disebuah perusahaan swasta. Mendengar ada pinjaman dana dari Dinari yang ditujukan untuk usaha, Gusti Kurniati langsung bergabung dan mendapat pinjaman dana sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Gusti Kurniati memelihara 10 ekor babi penggemukan. Modal awal untuk bibit menghabiskan Rp.2.500.000.- Walaupun kandangnya tidak permanen, hanya dipagari oleh bambu dan atapnya ditutupi oleh daun kelapa, tidak mengurangi semangat Gusti Kurniati untuk memelihara penggemukan. Setiap hari Gusti Kurniati disibukan dengan mengurus babinya dari mulai membersihkan kandang sampai memberi makan. Gusti Kurniati memiliki target umur 4 bulan harus dijual dengan berat maksimal. Sampai umur 4 bulan biaya pakan diperkirakan akan menghabiskan Rp.5.000.000,- karena saat ini semua biaya pakan naik. Pendapatan kotor dari penjualan babinya Rp.10.000.000,-. Setelah dipotong biaya bibit dan pakan keuntungan bersihnya Rp.2.500.000.,- per 4 bulan. Dari hasil inilah Gusti Kurniati akan berencana bertahap memperbaiki kandangnya supaya permanen.

loans.use: to purchase a quality boar and pig feed

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
In the El Sauce area of León city, Mr. Alejandro M. has raised cattle since he was a youth, so he has a lot of experience in the business which has been the way he has supported his home. Today he is the father of six children who feel grateful to have a responsible and hardworking father

His wife has been a great help to Mr. M. by always supporting him in the business, and she has given him all her support in the home and by taking care of the children. In order to improve their quality of life Mr. M. needs to buy cattle, so he is seeking the support of Ceprodel for a loan that will enable him to move his business forward, enabling him to buy animals in order to later sell them. He has three previous loans with Ceprodel which have been paid according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, el señor Alejandro M. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería desde su juventud teniendo una alta experiencia en este negocio que ha sido el sostén de su hogar desde que trabaja en ello. Hoy en día es padre de seis hijos que se sienten muy agradecidos de tener un padre responsable y trabajador.

Su esposa ha sido una ayuda idónea para el señor M. por el hecho de que siempre le ha apoyado en el negocio y le ha brindado todo su apoyo en el hogar y cuido de los hijos. Para mejorar su condición de vida el señor M. requiere la compra de ganado por lo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita salir adelante y de esta manera comprar los animales para su respectiva comercialización. Hoy en dia su record crediticio es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Kev Ke Group

texts.en: Mrs. K. K. is the leader of this five-member group in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 38-year-old housewife and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the others are yet too young to attend.  Her husband, Mr. Narin Heak, is a construction worker in the village.  In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. K. K. is requesting a loan to start a pig breeding business to assist her husband in supporting the family.

loans.use: To start a new business breeding pigs.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells fish. She is single, and the income she generates from her fish-selling business is insufficient to pay for her living expenses.

Even so, there is high demand for her goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate an increase in her profits. Accordingly, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Malae

texts.en:
Malae V., 58, is married with 5 children and has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public 3 days a week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  

SPBD loans are Malae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy items for her farming business, such as gromozone and chemicals. Some will also be used to pay for her childrens' school expenses and for home improvements. Her husband does the farming on the plantation.

loans.use: To buy items for her plantation business, such as gromozone and chemicals.

loans.name: Eb

texts.en: Eb S., age 20, is a housewife with one child, and she stays at home looking after her child and cooking food for her family members. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning around $5 each day. Mrs. S. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer for her husband to attach to a motorbike for runnig his business. S.'s husband can speak English, and normally he waits around the hotel to transport foreigners to the temple. Visitors and especially foreigners like to take a motorbike with a trailer called tuk tuk for city tours because it is safe. (Eb S. and her huaband are pictured together behind the trailer they are going to buy.)

loans.use: To purchase a trialer to attach to a motorbike.

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: El señor Sergio Jose O., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado le tienen tres hijos, una niña de 12 años de edad que cursa el tercer grado de primaria en una ecuela publica, y sus otros dos hijos son gemelos y tienen 8 años de edad y ambos cursan el segundo grado de primaria, su esposa tambien le ayuda en la barberia cuando puede sino se mantiene cuidando a sus hijos, su proposito es poder acondicionar un local donde mejorar y ofertar sus servicios como barbero, el cual en la actualidad esta ubicado en el mercado la terminal de buses en leon, donde tiene bastante demanda, este señor tiene dos años de tener esta barberia propia, habiendo iniciado como ayudante en otro salon pero como iniciativa y con el deseo de superarse se dio a la tarea de poner su propia barberia y generar empleo, su deseo es poder acondicionar mejor su local y aperturar otro salon y ofertar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Jose O. is 34 years old, he is married and has 3 children, a girl who is 12 years old and in 3rd grade in a public school, and the other two sons are 8 years old and twins, both are in 2nd grade. His wife also helps him at the barber shop if she is not taking care of the children. The reason for the loan he is requesting is to improve his barber shop to offer better services, which is currently located in the market at the bus terminal in Leon. He has good demand for his services there, he has two years with his own barber shop, he started as an assistant at another saloon but with good initiative and his will for improvement he opened his own barber shop and generated employment, his wish is to improve his shop and open another saloon and offer his services.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur M. is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Dushanbe. Bahodur is a private entrepreneur who sells sports footwear in the central city market.

Bahodur is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade, which helps him in his work with customers. Bahodur has been in the market for 10 years. He started as a little boy, helping his mother with her business.

Bahodur‘s main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and a stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Bahodur is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. For this purpose he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 12 months. He believes that this loan will be one of the steps toward his goal. Let’s get behind this dedicated father to achieve his goals and he will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing new sports footwear for men to sell.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina H. has owned a restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works from 6:00am to 3:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $920 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food for her restaurant to please her customers and increase her profit.

Amina is 38 years old, married, and has five children, aged 8, 12, 14, 16, and 22. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Magret, Anna, Amina, MwanaJ., and Maryam. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anwar Akmal Masih Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is a 44-year-old woman who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, a city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband, A. M., is a blacksmith by profession. Anwar baji is the mother of seven children: two sons and five daughters. Her eldest son works with his father. Her eldest daughter helps her to embroider dresses. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Anwar baji embroiders dresses and sells them in the clothing market. She has successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband’s business so that her husband will be able to make more iron rods and expand his business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Zarqa baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods

loans.name: Sena-Kossi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur âgé de soixante ans vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il est un exploitant de moulin à maïs, avec la farine de maïs obtenu, les togolais préparent de la pâte qui est une nourriture très appréciée dans ce pays , ce monsieur travaille durement pour pouvoir  soutenir sa famille, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et demande son premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter du matériel électrique, l’entretien et les frais d’installation d’électricité pour son moulin.
Il est marié et sa femme est une revendeuse, ils ont ensemble sept (07) enfants qu’ils doivent entretenir.
texts.en:
This gentleman is sixty years old and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé, he is the operator of a corn mill. With the corn flour, the Togolese prepare a corn mush that is a highly appreciated food in this country. This gentleman works hard to provide for his family, he has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for his first loan to buy electrical equipment, to pay for the electric wiring of his mill, and for maintenance . He is married and his wife is a reseller, together they have seven (07) children to provide for.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electric wiring of the mill

loans.name: Seh

texts.en: Mr. Seh S. was born in 1976 and now lives in Phdao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. He is a security guard who earns a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sao Sophal, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mr. Seh S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 hundred ducks for his wife breeding business. He is 33 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 200 hundred ducks for his wife breeding business.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Twenty-nine years old and married to a watchman, Sunday S. has two children, both attending school. She currently sells beer and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn S. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Chi Chrab Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sum San, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they gather a little rice revenue, but not enough to provide a better life to their family. Additionally, their family members also live in an old house in poor conditions; thus, Mrs. Thoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family members. She has six children, three of whom are working in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family members.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suweni

texts.id: Harga coklat memang tidak menentu.tidak membuat suweni kendor dalam menjalani usaha bertani coklat.Karena setelah diberi pinjaman yang pertama hasil buah coklat yang dihasilkan sangat memuaskan.Pinjaman yang pertama tersebut digunakan untuk membeli obat yang bisa membuat buah coklat tidak terserang penyakit.Sehingga bisa mendapat buah yang bagus dan hasil yang memuaskan. pemeliharaan kebun coklat selalu dilakukan sampai sekarang,agar jauh dari penyakit.setiap harinya Suweni pergi kekebun bersama Suami pada pagi hari sampai sore.selain merawat dan membersihkan juga kadang membawa buah coklat yang sudah matang.Hasil yang diterima semakin meningkat.sehingga keuntungan yang diterima juga lumayan.Untuk  pinjaman yang kedua ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit coklat.agar bisa lebih banyak mendapatkan hasil.Usaha ini sangat membantu kebutuhan keluarga Suweni.Semoga untuk kedepannya,Bisa mendapat pinjaman yang berkelanjutan.agar bisa lebih mengembangkan usahAnya.
texts.en:
The price for chocolate being definitely uncertain does not make it flexible for Suweni in operating as a cacao farmer. Because after being given a first loan yield from the cocoa bean was encouraging. The stated first loan was used to buy pesticides to prevent the cocoa beans from being infested. With the result of good beans and encouraging yield, tending to the cacao plantation usually conducted until now, so that is it safe from disease, every day Suweni goes to the plantation with her husband in the morning until evening, besides feeding and maintaining also sometimes harvesting ripen beans. Yield generated is gradually increasing until earnings attained are acceptable. For this second loan will be used to buy cacao seedlings so that more yield will be produced. This endeavor significantly assists meeting Suweni’s family’s needs. Hopefully, in the future, receiving subsequent loan will expand her endeavor.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Minoutikpo

texts.fr: Minoutikpo a pour activité la vente de gravier roule.  pour bien exercer ce commerce Il a crée sa propre entreprise qu’il a appelé « Ets Thofils » en 2000 à Agoe, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Il a reçu  de ses clients des commandes qu’il ne peut satisfaire avec son stock de gravier actuel,  il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 10 bennes de gravier.Ce monsieur  est marié, et il a trois enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè Zongo
texts.en:
Minoutikpo sells river rock (gravel). To properly engage in this trade, he started his own business in 2000 in Agoe, a neighborhood north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. He named it "Ets Thofils," He has received orders from his customers that he cannot fill with the supply of river rock that he currently has on hand. He is asking for his first loan in order to purchase ten loads of rock. Minoutikpo is married and has three children. He lives with his family in the Zongo section of Agoe.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of river rock

loans.name: Edit Luz

texts.es:
EDIT LUZ M. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en el Jr nueva york Mz.B.Lt.7, en yarinacocha, tiene 45 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es operador de máquinas.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender en su bodega.
 
Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diversos víveres y frutas para implementar su bodega.

“Manuela Ramos me esta apoyando  en la educación de mis hijos, por ello estoy muy agradecida y contenta por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
EDIT LUZ M. V. is a member of the “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” Microfinance Institute. She lives in Yarinacocha. She is a 45-year-old mother of two. Her husband works as a machine operator.

She started her own general store with her first 300.00 PEN loan. She purchased goods so that she could sell them at her store.

Now, she and her family have made progress, and the general store has improved. With this 1,400.00 PEN loan, she will purchase assorted goods and fruits to restock her shop.

“Manuela Ramos is helping me provide an education for my children, and for this reason, I am very happy and grateful for this opportunity.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods like rice, noodles, sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Mariaisabel

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86432&_tpos=4&_tpg=1
María Isabel es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos, es jubilada de las Fuerzas Policiales.
María Isabel estudio en un centro de enseñanza de manualidades por varios años, le gusto mucho que sus amigas le empezaron a pedir que les vendiera su trabajos, se ha puesto a vender  todas las manualidades que  hace, ella también está enseñando en su casa manualidades.
María Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades pana, lino, pinturas.
Desde que María Isabel esta en Finca aprendió  administrar su negocio, a separar el capital de las ganancias.  
El sueño de María Isabel es poner un bazar de manualidades.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86432&_tpos=... María Isabel is a member of the Viñedos community bank. She is retired from the Police Force. María Isabel studied for several years in a center for teaching handicrafts. She really liked that her friends started to ask her to sell her work. She has set out to sell all of the handcrafts that she makes. She is also teaching handicrafts in her home. María Isable needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy materials like corduroy, linen, and paints to make her handicrafts. Since María Isabel has been with Finca she has learned to run her business and to separate the capital from the earnings. Her dream is to have a handicraft bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like corduroy, linen, and paints to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Laura B. tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios y darle una buena educación ya que es madre soltera, su negocio es una tienda que desde seis años administra, el cual comenzó con fondos propios y prestamos en micro financieras el cual ha podido mantener con variedad y mercancías su negocio, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara ropa para niño y adulto para incrementar las ventas. Su meta es poder tener una segunda tienda en otro mercado y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar a sus hijos mejor bienestar economico.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Laura B. lives in the Villa Venezuela neighbourhood of the capital city Managua. She has two children, and her hope is to be able to support them through school and provide them with a good education even though she is a single mother. She has owned her own business for seven years, starting out using her own savings and small loans, and managing to maintain a variety of merchandise. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic; she will use it to buy children’s and adults’ clothing in order to increase her sales. Her goal is to be able to open a second store in another market so she can earn more money and give her children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Mmh Fouleymatou

texts.fr: MMH FOULEYMATOU T. EST UNE COMMERCANTE CAPITALISANT UNE EXPERIENCE DE 2 ANS DANS LE DOMMERCE DE DETAIL.ELLE ACHETE DES SACS A MAINS, BIJOUX, LINGERIE EN FRANCE, ALLMENGNE AFIN DE LES REVENDRE AU SENEGAL.ELLE DISPODE D'UNE CLIENTELE POU ECOULER SES MARCHANDISES. ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET CE AUGMENTER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT.
texts.en:
MMH FOULEYMATOU T. is a merchant capitalizing on two years of experience in retail commerce. She buys handbags, jewelry, and lingerie in France and Germany in order to resell them in Senegal. She has a customer base for moving these goods on the market. She is requesting this loan to augment her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment working capital

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil A. is 29 years old. He and his wife are raising one daughter. Khalil has been running a drug store for five years. He sells only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town, which allows him to have many clients and customers.

Now he is requesting $2000 USD. Being a very accurate person by nature, Khalil is sure, and would like to assure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and to expand his business

loans.name: Pia Dolores

texts.en:
Pia Dolores F. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Pia Dolores is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pia Dolores owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies like pancakes and barkeron in the local community. Pia Dolores has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Pia Dolores joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pia Dolores is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Pia Dolores from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “22 D. septiembre”, en centro Poblado D. M.  del distrito D. D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la primaria incompleta (3er grado).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir animales menores.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para la compra D. ganado mayor como vacas, los venD. en las ferias D. ganado en Ilave y Acora.

Su deseo es tener muchos animales y vender a los mayoristas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de vacas.

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde is 40 years old and married with six children. She rents tables, chairs, etc., and has been in this business since 1999.

Yetunde hopes for the loan of N180,000 to purchase more tables and chairs to rent. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs to rent

loans.name: Dyesebel

texts.en:
Dyesebel is already 51 years old. She feels lonely because they do not have a child. She and her husband, though, are very determined to have a progressive life.

Dyesebel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional business capital for her general store. Obtaining this loan would help her improve it and increase her income. She is hoping that through Kiva’s Field Partner Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: For additional capital to improve her store

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  Cicilia is 40 years old and is Widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita C. is from Sitio Tuburan. She is 48 years old and is married with four school age children. Mrs. C. saw the rising needs of her family and wanted to help her husband in sustaining their needs. At that point in time she thought of making pots and selling them to her neighbors and some were displayed on the roadside where motorists could see her products. Because of her creativeness in making pots, some of her customers ordered them in bulk so that they could also resell them to neighboring communities.

Leonita aims to give her family a better and comfortable life. Now, Mrs. C. applied for PHP 17,000 loan which she intends to invest in her pottery business as additional capital.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo Group

texts.en:
Maria runs a small grocery store in her neighborhood. In the past, she sold mostly non-perishable or semi-perishable foods such as rice, beans, flour and oil – foods which make up Dominican staples. She is a 33-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Maria and the other borrowers in her group live in Los Llanos, a small town to the north of San Pedro. She lives with her husband and three teenage children in a small home made of cement blocks and wooden paneling.

Before coming to Esperanza, Maria was unable to find a fair loan. With this, her first loan with Esperanza, she will expand her sales to include fruits and vegetables. In the past, it was not viable for Maria to purchase such perishable items. Now, with an increase in her cash flow, these items will bring in even more profit. She hopes that with the new income from this loan, she will be able to finish the house with cement blocks only. That way, it will be secure from thieves and safer as a shelter during hurricane season. She likes that Esperanza not only gives her a loan, but also creates community, gives lessons, and provides other banking services such as savings. She is now confident that she can send all three of her children to school through university.

Maria is the coordinator for her group, Éxito con Cristo ("Success with Christ"), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Éxito con Cristo group!

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D., 40 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF depuis 7 ans et demi et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficultés. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète des moutons, les engraisse et les revend. Parallèlement elle fait la vente d'arachide. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye D., aged 40, is married and the mother of 8 children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de BAYOUF for 7½ years and has received from it 15 loans, which she has always repaid without a problem.  Ndèye fattens livestock.  She buys sheep, feeds them, and then sells them.  Concurrently, she sells peanuts.  The profits she earns allow her to support her husband in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has been the owner of a wheel repair shop since 1999. He is 39 years old and married with two young children. He has been able to meet his children's needs over the years – thanks to his business income. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a Rapid car to facilitate his business movements.

loans.use: To buy a Rapid car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Raky

texts.fr: Raky S. est une dame de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend des habits d’enfants et divers effets de toilette. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital avec les revenus générés et de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Raky S., 56, is married and the mother of two children. She sells children's clothing and various toiletries. Her objective is to grow her working capital with the income she generates and to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing and toiletries sales

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo El Buen Pastor está integrado por Isabel V. quien vende comida y frutas,  Ana María B. es comerciante de ropa y cosmético y R. Melida Rosa G. tiene un comedor y  además vende ropa y cosmético por encargo.
texts.en:
The group "El Buen Pastor" is made up of Isabel V., who sells food and fruit, Ana María B., who sells clothing and cosmetics, and R. Melida Rosa G., who has an eatery and also sells clothing and cosmetics on order.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as staple grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
T. Dương Thị (20213040006) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Dương Thị (20213040006) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen C. is a 31-year-old mother who cares for her two children. She is married to Rommel, who is a fisherman. To help to support her husband, she started a business selling fish. With dreams to get away from poverty, in 2008 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc., which means “To rise up from poverty”), a Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since her membership in the institution, she had shown good performance in her credit rating (on the basis of loans) to get more capital for her business. Now on her third loan, she applied for a 20,000 Philippine peso loan to buy additional fish to sell, such as big heads, tilapia, fingerlings (small fish) and other types. In the future, Maureen hopes to establish a stall in the market where she can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house for living and a happy family to live with. About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy an additional fish to sell, such as big heads, tilapia, and fingerlings (small fish)

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es:
“SOMOS IMPACTO: 2006”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  11 miembros entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividad informal dentro del comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años.
Margarita asume el cargo D. presidenta, a sus 51 años, es conviviente, tiene 5 hijos D.  14, 17, 21, 23 y 25 años D. edad. DesD. hace 3 años se dedica al tejido D. bolsas D. macramé (carteras), se inicio en este negocio porque cuando estudiaba en el colegio hace muchos años llevo un curso D. manualidades en el cual le enseñaron a tejer, además también porque se malogro su maquina D. coser desD. entonces le agrada realizar esta labor en compañía D. una D. sus hijas y siempre se capacitan para sacar nuevos modelos D. bolsos, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria solo cubre para ayudar a su esposo, ya que lo que él gana no le alcanza. El gran sueño D. Margarita es tener un puesto en el mercado para realizar las ventas D. sus carteras, el  reciente préstamo será destinado para L. compra D. materiales para tejer.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado D. los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Somos Impacto: 2006” (We Impact – 2006) is a Communal Bank that consists of eleven enthusiastic and enterprising members who have an affinity for converting their informal activities into small businesses. They have been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for four years.

Margarita has taken over the office of President. She is 51 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 14, 17, 21, 23, and 25). For the past three years, she has been knitting macramé handbags. She started this business as a result of a high school course in handicrafts that she took several years ago in which she learned how to knit. She also started making things by hand because her sewing machine broke down. Margarita is happy to be working with one of her daughters and always learns about creating new models of handbags. Through the efforts of her daily work, she is able to help her husband since his earnings do not cover everything. Margarita’s greatest wish is to have a vending post at the market where she can sell her handbags. This recent loan will be used to buy materials for knitting.

All of the members are grateful for the support that has been provided and they commit to submitting their payments according to the established timelines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase knitting materials

loans.name: Salaama Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
L. Dennis, shown in the small photo at the top left, is the same person seated on the right. He is a single father with one child.

To subsist, Dennis is into the business of commercial photography in Salaama village, Mukono district. He has subsisted rather pathetically on this business for the last ten years. This is, in part, due to the low earnings he gets from this business.

This has not been the only low point of Dennis’s business; he also has had to be brought in harsh terms with the reality of many defaulting clients. On the other hand, those clients who have given him steadfast support have, suffice to say, borne testament to his many good business graces. It’s because of this loyal support that he carries conviction that his future business prospects are rosy.

Dennis needs this loan to buy more equipment so that, in future, he can make his own studio where he can take, process and produce his pictures.

loans.use: To buy more equipment like a camera and a film

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has run a tailoring business from her home since 2008.  She also works at an environmentA. company in her town to earn extra money to help her husband support the household. She offers all types of sewing services to her clients.

Today, Amira is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an additionA. sewing machine and to expand her home business because she's planning to leave the outside job to focus full-time on the tailoring business. She specifically notes that with the new machine she will be able to deliver her services faster.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 59  años y tiene cinco hijos. Es socia nueva y por primera vez que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender comestibles en su domicilio, ella acomodo una habitación de su domicilio para convertirla en una tienda de venta de abarrotes. Ella abre la tienda a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 10  de la noche. Ella es una madre joven, responsable y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a su hijo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar dos exhibidores para poner pescado y pollo y para comprar también comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a sus hijos. 

Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the community bank Mi Peru, which is part of the Arariwa Association. She is 59 years old and has five children. She’s a new member; this is her first time working with Mi Peru. Her primary source of income is selling foods in her home, where she converted one room into a grocery store. She opens at 5 AM and closes at 10 PM. She is still a young woman, and an entrepreneur who feels responsible for seeking out every opportunity to succeed. She works every day to create a better future for her children. She needs this loan so that she can buy two display cases for fish and chicken. She will also buy sugar, noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc. Norma wants to be professional and successful so that she can help her children. She’s grateful for your support, and has promised to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying display cases and grocery items.

loans.name: Bibaikhol

texts.en:
Bibaikhol has a very good sense of humor and her jovial spirit helps her face difficult times. She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and for that reason, she decided to remain in this industry. Bibaikhol works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities. The immense love that she feels for her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard. She wishes to buy more animals and this way increase her income.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Zinsou Francis

texts.fr: Né en 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Zinsou Francis vit depuis trente ans au quartier Akpokpota à Cotonou. Francis est marié à ATCHEDEDJI Marie et est père de six enfants, dont cinq sont à sa charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Francis vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Francis a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Francis exerce le métier d’électricien bâtiment. Parallèlement, Francis vend des matériels électriques (fils électriques, ampoules, multiprises, etc.) de façon ambulante. C’est à Cotonou que Francis achète ses produits. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Francis sollicite pour une première fois, de prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mr. B. Zinsou Francis has lived for thirty years in the Akpokpota district in Cotonou. He is married to Ms. ATCHEDEDJI Marie and is the father of six children. Only some of his children have had schooling. He lives together with his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure that their different household expenses are covered. Francis had dropped out of middle school. He has been a building electrician for a dozen years. Concurrently, he sells electrical supplies and equipment (electrical wire, light bulbs, power strips, etc.) door-to-door. He gets his supplies in Cotonou. With the goal of increasing his stock of goods and responding better to customer requirements, Francis is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife. He started working in a car body repair shop in 2002, and opened his own shop in 2005.

He is now requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old; she lives with her husband and her only son, Ranjit, in a house she owns. She has been dedicating herself to bamboo set (furniture) making since she joined ASHI in 1994, but approximately 5 years ago, she also started a fishing business & fish selling, bordering her community. This is how she earns a weekly gross, and she can also count on the help of her husband and her son. 

As this business has proved to be profitable, she will keep on working in this field; her aim is to increase her working capital. She will be very responsible with her payments and she is thankful to all Kiva lenders who support the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to make her business grow. The loan will be used to buy another "bangka" (fishing boat); remaining funds will be used to purchase raw materials for her bamboo set business and increase her working capital.

The capital will fund further expansion of the family ventures to support her dreams for her family to have a decent way of life. 

Yolanda is a hard-working entrepreneur, always looking for opportunities to grow. Through her daily work, she is building a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy another fishing boat and purchase raw materials for her bamboo set making business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida P. is from the village of Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Zenaida is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Zenaida operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks and biscuits. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 53 years old. Maria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling bread in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Maria is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: San Miguel (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe E. García, vive  en el Barrio San Miguel, en Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Tiene tres hijos: dos mujeres y un varón: Yessenia, Maricela y Juan Dagoberto quien cada uno ya están casados y son padres de familia.

  Ella se dedica a la comercialización desde hace veinticinco años, en cual comenta que con esta actividad a salido adelante con su familia pues a aun que es pequeño le ha dado buenos resultados en los ingresos de su hogar y con ello también apoyo a sus hijos para terminar su carrera.

   Lo que lo motivo a solicitar el préstamo en fundación realidad a.c, es para comprar más producto y aumentar su negocio y comprar cosas de mejor  calidad, para que su clientela se sienta segura de lo que compra, comenta que se siente muy contenta con este trabajo yaqué está en buen lugar y la gente la prefiere por las atenciones que les brinda.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, lo invierte comprando más mercancía y así  no estar limitada en su venta y con la inversión obtener mejores ganancia, para poder ahorrar y ofrecerle lo mejor a sus netos que son su adoración y su razón de seguir adelante.

    Comenta que su sueño es construir le a cada uno de sus nietos un hogar para cuando estén grandes ya tenga donde vivir, pero lo más importante para ella es que todos termine una carrera y tengan mejores logros en la vida  ya que para eso tienen su apoyo hasta que dios le preste vida.

    El grupo se llama san miguel y está conformado de cuatro señoras, la razón del nombre es porque así se llama el barrio donde ella vive,  y formo parte del grupo por su hija Yessenia quien es  la representante del grupo.  
Las integrantes del grupo san miguel son:

 Yessenia N. E.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catálogos de zapatos para hacer pedidos.
 María de Jesús Velásquez Sánchez: utilizara el préstamo para surtir su tienda de ropa con mejor calidad.
 Guadalupe E. García: invertirá el préstamo en su tienda de comercio y es la que se le tomo la entrevista para el programa de kiva.
 María Piedad Velásquez Hernández: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catalogo de avon y de zapatos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe E. García lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of Copainala, in the state of Chiapas, México. She has three children, two daughters and one son: Yessenia, Maricela and Juan Dagoberto, all of whom are married and have their own children. She has operated a store for the past 25 years. She comments that with this activity, she has been able to help her family get ahead. Although her store is small, it has given her good results as far as income for her household, and with this, she has also supported her children in finishing their education. What has motivated her to request the loan from the Realidad Foundation is the need to buy more products and expand her business, and to buy higher-quality products, so that her customers will feel confident about the items they buy from her. She comments that she feels very satisfied with this work, since the store is in a good location, and she is popular among customers for the service she provides. With the earnings she obtains from her business, she will invest in buying more merchandise, so that she will not be limited in the amount she can sell, and with this investment she will obtain better profits, so that she can save and do the best she can for her grandchildren, whom she adores and who are her reason for continuing. She comments that her dream is to build a home for each one of her grandchildren, so that when they grow up, they will already have a place to live; however, the most important thing for her is that all of them finish their studies and have significant achievements in life, and for this reason, they will have her support as long as God grants her life. The group is called "San Miguel," and it is made up of four women. The group has this name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they live. Guadalupe joined the group thanks to her daughter Yessenia, who is the group's representative. The members of the San Miguel group are: Yessenia N. E.: she will invest the loan in buying shoe catalogs so she can take orders. María de Jesús Velásquez Sánchez: she will use the loan to stock her store with higher-quality clothing. Guadalupe E. García: she will invest the loan in her store, and she was the one interviewed for the Kiva program. María Piedad Velásquez Hernández: she will invest the loan in buying Avon and shoe catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to stock her store, such as pencils, pencil cases and notebooks, among other items

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma A. is from the village of Locus, Sapang Dalaga. She is 51 years old and is married with no children. Wilma owns and operates a business planting and harvesting assorted crops. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. In 2007, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used as additional cash to purchase a motorcycle. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional cash to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores D.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcycle (or habal-habal) services to local community members. She is 25 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Banisilan, Cotabato. Dolores has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Dolores joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Dolores is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a member of the Kiserian Victory group in Faulu Kenya. He sells food, milk and eggs to earn a living. He was previously employed before he started the business. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

So far, he has serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his food kiosk in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to build a food kiosk.

loans.use: To build a food stall

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $82 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old.  Edna is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for transport business

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy O., 37, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. O. sells vegetables, earning an income of about US $2 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of about US $2 per day. O. has to spend US $66 on food, US $2 on electricity and water supplies, and US $10 on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase a new motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfarero lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Irene T. de 39 Años quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, perfumes y cosméticos Avon además de realizar bisutería desde hace cinco años.  Ella con el crédito compra los encargos que tiene para diciembre los cuales son muchos.
Las otras integrantes son Fabiola B. quien vende esquimo y cerveza desde hace 5 años y Heydi R. comercializa ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The Alfarero group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is 39-year old Irene T. who sells underwear, perfume, and Avon cosmetics. For the past five years she has also made costume jewelry. Irene plans to use the loan to buy the items she needs to fill her December orders, of which there are many.

The other members of the group are Fabiola B. who has been selling Eskimo milk products and beer for five years, and Heydi R. who sells clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, cosmetics

loans.name: Gladis Araceli

texts.es:
la señora Gladis Aracei E. E. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Liure, Gladis se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Gadis es una mujer emprendedora, su negocio esta en un lugar de facil acceso, se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, desea tener surtida su pulperia para la navidad.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Gladis Aracei E. Espina lives in the municipality of Liure. She earns her living running a small general store located in her house selling basic supplies. She is an entrepreneurial woman. Her store is located in an easily accessible location. Every day she gets up at 5am to serve her customers.

Gladis plans to use the loan to buy stock for the store in preparation for Christmas. She needs the money she earns for household expenses and for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as rice, beans, bread, cookies etc.

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Elsa, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, posee un comedor y vive con una de sus hijas de 14 años de edad, es madre soltera, su comedor lo inicio con poco material y atendiéndolo sola, pero hoy día tiene dos empleadas, lleva ya 7 años de administrarlo con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, ha ganado mucha clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar los alimentos, ya que en ocasiones no logra salir con la demanda por lo que quiere aumentar su inventario comprando bebidas, arroz, pastas, condimentos, verduras y carnes, con esta compra espera tener en mejores condiciones el comedor y poder salir con todos los pedidos.
Doña Elsa, sueña con un comedor más amplio, casa propia y ayudar a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old.  She lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  She is a single mother and lives with one of her daughters who is 14 years old.  She owns an eatery which she set up with just a little bit of material and, in the beginning, she worked there on her own.
